Roles & Responsibilities
As a Shipping Executive, you will be responsible:
Prepare all shipping documents for import shipments and process bank documents such as Letter of Credit, etc.
Ensure all documents comply with Singapore’s import regulations and the correctness of documents from suppliers.
Ensure all documents received on time for clearance to avoid incurring charges due to late clearance of documents.
Update and communicate with Procurement team on any changes to vessel’s arrival schedule.
Ensure all documents comply with international trade regulations and the specific requirements of shipping carriers and customs authorities.
Ensure timely delivery of products while maintaining cost-effective shipping solutions.
Monitor and track shipments to ensure they reach their destination on time.
Coordinate with shipping carriers, freight forwarders, and other logistics providers to ensure timely and accurate documentation and shipping schedule.
Resolve any shipping-related issues or delays in a timely manner.
Continuous process improvement for documentation and shipping processes to improve efficiency and reduce costs.
Stay current on industry trends and regulations related to shipping and logistics.
Carry out administrative tasks such as data input, processing of information, completing paperwork and filling of documents.
Reviewing freight cost, negotiating rates with freight forwarder companies and propose to HOD for review and approval.
Work closely with Logistics and Purchasing teams to ensure alignment between inventory levels and shipping schedules.
Maintain accurate records of all shipping documentation, records and transactions for compliance and audit purposes.
Qualifications:
Diploma in supply chain management and logistics.
Min 3 years of relevant experience in food service or supply chain management within the manufacturing industry.
Possess Tradenet Certification.
Proficiency in using shipping software and tools.
Knowledge and familiar with shipping term, shipping documentation and L/C preparation and negotiation.
Highly proficient in Microsoft office applications and in ERP system.

Additional Information
$3,000 to $3,800 per month (depending on experience & appointed designation)
1 month AWS + Variable Bonus
5.5 days work week (alternate Sat)
14 days annual leave per year

Roles & Responsibilities
Software Quality Engineer Job Description
We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Senior Software Quality Assurance Engineer to join our dynamic tech team. In this role, you will be instrumental in ensuring the quality and reliability of our platform, working closely with cross-functional teams to implement robust testing strategies and drive continuous improvement in our development processes.
Key Responsibilities:
Test Strategy and Planning:
Develop and implement comprehensive QA strategies that cover all aspects of the software development lifecycle.
Design, maintain, and execute test plans, test cases, and test scripts for both manual and automated testing.
Automation and Tooling:
Lead the development of automated testing frameworks using Cypress/Playwright for end-to-end testing.
Implement performance and load testing using tools like Gatling, K6, and Autocannon to ensure platform scalability.
Quality Assurance:
Conduct contract testing with Pact.js to validate interactions between microservices.
Perform thorough regression testing when bugs are resolved and new features are implemented.
Collaborate with developers to ensure code quality and adherence to best practices.
Maintain the E2E pipeline and promptly address any issues to prevent blocking or delays.
Cross-Functional Collaboration:
Work closely with product managers, developers, and DevOps engineers to understand requirements and deliver high-quality software.
Participate in agile ceremonies, providing QA insights and contributing to sprint planning.
Collaborate with other QEs and team members to prepare the weekly deployment and lead the deployment activities.
Issue Resolution and Reporting:
Identify, document, and track software defects using industry-standard tools.
Conduct root cause analysis for critical issues and implement corrective actions.
Provide regular reports on QA activities, test results, and quality metrics.
Mentorship and Leadership:
Mentor junior QA engineers, fostering a culture of quality and continuous improvement.
Stay updated with emerging QA technologies and methodologies, introducing relevant innovations to the team.
Requirements
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field. Advanced degrees are a plus.
Minimum of 5 years of professional experience in Software Quality Assurance.
Proven experience with automation testing, particularly using Cypress for E2E testing.
Hands-on experience with performance testing tools like Gatling and Autocannon.
Experience with contract testing frameworks such as Pact.js.
Proficiency in JavaScript (TypeScript) and familiarity with Go.
Solid understanding of frontend and backend technologies, including ReactJS, ExpressJS, and Gin-gonic.
Experience with AWS services, Docker, and Kubernetes.
Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines using GitLab and ArgoCD.
Knowledge of relational databases (MySQL, PostgreSQL) and caching solutions (Redis).
Understanding of REST API, GraphQL API, JWT authentication, and Elasticsearch.
Experience with logging and monitoring tools like Splunk or OpenSearch.
Soft Skills:
Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written.
Ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced, agile environment.
Leadership qualities with the ability to mentor and guide team members.

Roles & Responsibilities
Build a career with confidence
Carrier Global Corporation, global leader in intelligent climate and energy solutions is committed to creating solutions that matter for people and our planet for generations to come. From the beginning, we've led in inventing new technologies and entirely new industries. Today, we continue to lead because we have a world-class, diverse workforce that puts the customer at the center of everything we do.
About the role
This role will develop and drive people strategies for all of our businesses in Singapore. They will be part of the Singapore Leadership Team as well as a valuable member of a regional South Asia Pacific HR Leadership team.
Partnering closely with business to drive an inclusive and diverse culture and create relevant human resource policies and programs for employees in line with business needs. Develop a strong relationship with partners in talent acquisition, talent development, rewards, employee and labor relations and drive effective HR service delivery across business units.
Engage with all areas of business to ensure strategic initiatives integrate human capital considerations. Bring strong HR operational skills and knowledge of best practices. Have considerable personal confidence, be decisive and agile, and intellectually sharp with sound judgment.
The position is based in Singapore and reports to Regional HR Director based.
Key Responsibilities:
As a Senior Manager, Human Resources, you’ll be responsible for:
Partnering with leadership teams to develop key strategies and objectives for the organization, ensuring that the HR initiatives and programs are clearly aligned with business priorities.
Lead the organization change management process in response to business strategies.
Participate in and be a key contributor at key management discussions and provide HR input for strategic business projects and long-term planning and budgeting processes.
Partner with Talent Acquisition team to ensure timely pipelining of quality talent to meet business needs.
Play a leading role in key HR processes including talent review, compensation, performance management, talent development for the business units.
Provide advice and coaching to managers and employees on performance and development.
Establish and maintain a positive work environment which encourages the full use of the organization’s diverse talents and abilities.
Drive employee survey action plans and engagement outcomes including employee retention.
Drive workforce planning strategy including productivity and workforce effectiveness actions.
Support any potential HR diligence and integration initiatives as part of overall transformation.
Support governance framework for employee and labor relations with focus on compliance to local laws and consistent deployment of best practices that maintains harmonious industrial relations.
Requirements
Minimum 10 years of diverse HR business partnering experience preferably in the Multinational Corporation with at least 5 years in a country HR leadership role.
Ability to balance between being ‘hands on’ and ‘strategic’.
Talent obsessed – passionate about bringing the best out of people and proven record of deploying talent strategies in support of business growth.
Ability to manage multiple stakeholders, assertive by conviction and collaborative by nature with strong people skills.
Strong commercial acumen, analytical ability and use of data to provide key business insights.
Strong reputation as a HR professional, integrity and judgment that is beyond reproach.
Strong ownership on execution with focus on result orientation.
Benefits
We are committed to offering competitive benefits programs for all of our employees, and enhancing our programs when necessary.
Our commitment to you
Our greatest assets are the expertise, creativity and passion of our employees. We strive to provide a great place to work that attracts, develops and retains the best talent, promotes employee engagement, fosters teamwork and ultimately drives innovation for the benefit of our customers. We strive to create an environment where you feel that you belong, with diversity and inclusion as the engine to growth and innovation. We develop and deploy best-in-class programs and practices, providing enriching career opportunities, listening to employee feedback and always challenging ourselves to do better. This is The Carrier Way.
Join us and make a difference.

Roles & Responsibilities
Amaris Consulting is an independent technology consulting firm providing guidance and solutions to businesses. With more than 1,000 clients across the globe, we have been rolling out solutions in major projects for over a decade – this is made possible by an international team of 7,600 people spread across 5 continents and more than 60 countries. Our solutions focus on four different Business Lines: Information System & Digital, Telecom, Life Sciences and Engineering. We’re focused on building and nurturing a top talent community where all our team members can achieve their full potential. Amaris is your steppingstone to cross rivers of change, meet challenges and achieve all your projects with success.

At Amaris, we strive to provide our candidates with the best possible recruitment experience. We like to get to know our candidates, challenge them, and be able to give them proper feedback as quickly as possible. Here's what our recruitment process looks like:

Brief Call: Our process typically begins with a brief virtual/phone conversation to get to know you! The objective? Learn about you, understand your motivations, and make sure we have the right job for you!

Interviews (the average number of interviews is 3 - the number may vary depending on the level of seniority required for the position). During the interviews, you will meet people from our team: your line manager of course, but also other people related to your future role. We will talk in depth about you, your experience, and skills, but also about the position and what will be expected of you. Of course, you will also get to know Amaris: our culture, our roots, our teams, and your career opportunities!

Case study: Depending on the position, we may ask you to take a test. This could be a role play, a technical assessment, a problem-solving scenario, etc.

As you know, every person is different and so is every role in a company. That is why we have to adapt accordingly, and the process may differ slightly at times. However, please know that we always put ourselves in the candidate's shoes to ensure they have the best possible experience.

We look forward to meeting you!

ABOUT THE JOB
Create, review, and revise cGMP documents such as batch records and SOPs.
Create and manage change records.
Develop technical training materials and conduct technical training for production staff.
Support the technology transfer of new products/processes, including field testing.
Create, review, revise, and approve technical reports and engineering documents such as URS, FS, SDS, and P&IDs.
Design, procure, commission, and qualify new equipment.
Work effectively as part of a team responsible for ensuring successful and efficient production processes for recombinant proteins
ABOUT YOU
Bachelor's degree in a relevant life science field (e.g., Biology, Biotechnology, Biochemistry).
Previous experience in a GMP-regulated environment.
Strong attention to detail, organizational skills, and ability to work independently or in a team.
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, in English.
WHY AMARIS?
At Amaris Consulting, we believe in creating a thriving, positive workplace where every team member can grow, connect, and make a real impact. Here’s what you can expect when you join our dynamic community:
Global Diversity: Be part of an international team of 110+ nationalities, celebrating diverse perspectives and collaboration.
Trust and Growth: With 70% of our leaders starting at entry-level, we’re committed to nurturing talent and empowering you to reach new heights.
Continuous Learning: Unlock your full potential with our internal Academy and over 250 training modules designed for your professional growth.
Vibrant Culture: Enjoy a workplace where energy, fun, and camaraderie come together through regular afterworks, team-building events, and more.
Meaningful Impact: Join us in making a difference through our CSR initiatives, including the WeCare Together program, and be part of something bigger.
Equal opportunity
Amaris Consulting is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to promoting diversity within the workforce and creating an inclusive working environment. For this purpose, we welcome applications from all qualified candidates regardless of gender, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, beliefs, age, marital status, disability or other characteristics.

You will ensure that proper governance is in place to maintain timely and accurate data in Workday as well as ensuring continuous improvements are carried out to streamline business processes so that best practices are implemented for the University.

The responsibilities of this role are:
Perform system administration and enhancement of core functionality
Provide all operational support work on Workday HCM including but not limited to
Perform event and incident management, troubleshooting, and plan break/fix scenarios
Rescind, correct, advance workflows or transactions
Configure business processes in the applications based on given business requirements
Participate in application upgrade impact analysis and management
Establish relationship with key stakeholders and seek to understand business needs
Lead efforts in determining user requirements, propose design and test system solutions
Perform ad hoc system projects as required
The ideal candidate will need to have the following qualities and experience:
Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Information Technology, Computer Science, or a related field.
5-8 years of relevant experience in HR Consultancy, HR technology or a related field
In-depth knowledge on HRIS systems, especially in Workday with strong functional and technical skills in Core HR, Recruitment, Learning, Performance Management and Time and Attendance
Demonstrated ability to manage full life-cycle of HRIS-related projects from understanding user requirements to translating these into system configurations would be an advantage
Candidates with HR Change Management experience would be advantageous.
Possess good experience and exposure in client facing and implementation roles
Able to work under pressure in a fast-paced environment

Roles & Responsibilities
Company Background:
OOm Group comprises two distinct entities: OOm Marketing Agency and OOm Institute. OOm Marketing Agency is dedicated to providing innovative digital solutions and impactful strategies to drive client success. OOm Institute focuses on education and training, fostering industry-leading skills and knowledge. Together, we’re committed to excellence, growth, and building a diverse team that shares our passion.

Job Overview:
As an In-House Talent Acquisition Specialist at OOm Group, you’ll play a crucial role in identifying and securing top talent, helping shape a team that aligns with our organizational goals and values. You will lead recruitment strategies, actively source candidates, conduct interviews, and partner closely with hiring managers to fulfill their hiring needs.
Key Responsibilities:
Recruitment Strategy
Develop and implement targeted recruitment strategies to attract high-quality, diverse candidates.
Collaborate with hiring managers to understand hiring needs and craft comprehensive job descriptions.
Leverage multiple recruitment channels, including job boards, social media, professional networks, and employee referrals.
Candidate Sourcing and Screening
Proactively source candidates from various platforms, industry databases, and networking events.
Review resumes, assess applications, and pre-screen candidates to shortlist top talent.
Conduct interviews to evaluate candidates’ skills, experience, and cultural fit.
Partner with hiring managers to prepare competitive job offers and negotiate terms with selected candidates.
Manage the background and reference check processes for successful candidates.
Recruitment Metrics and Reporting
Track and report on recruitment metrics, such as time-to-fill, cost-per-hire, and candidate conversion rates.
Provide monthly recruitment reports, including budget allocation for recruitment channels and tools.
Analyse recruitment data to identify improvement opportunities.
Offer insights and recommendations to refine talent acquisition strategies and enhance hiring outcomes.
Job Requirements
Min. 1 - 2 years of experience in either Agency or In-House recruitment.
Strong knowledge of recruitment best practices, sourcing techniques, and employment laws.
Excellent organisational and time-management skills to juggle multiple priorities.

Roles & Responsibilities
Location: Alexandra
Salary: $11,000 - $12,000

Job Descriptions:
Marine:
* Assist in coordinating, arranging and timely follow up Oil Major Vetting Inspections as directed.
* Attend vessels to conduct Marine Inspections and pre-vetting inspections or vetting assistance as directed. Ensure follow-up of all deficiencies noted during vessel attendance is recorded and filed in the common drive.
* Conduct annual onboard navigation audits, preferably during a short voyage. Input navigation audit results into the navigation audits database and follow up on all deficiencies and defects to closure.
* Assist in the investigation and root cause analysis of accidents.
* A member of ASL Emergency Response Team.
* Assist in arranging external safety audits and onboard training by co-coordinating with the appointed auditor training company.
* Follow up in cosmetic upgradation (Painting)
* Monitor and support all vessels (In coordination with OPS) on operational issues (Loading / discharging / tank cleaning / grade change.

Quality & Compliance:
* Assist in the implementation of ASL Ship Management’s Health, Safety, Security, Quality and Environmental Policies including sailing onboard for short voyages for onboard implementation of the HSSEQ System for new vessels.
* Assist in periodical management review of ASL HSSEQ system, record findings from the reviews and propose actions if necessary.
* Assist in maintenance and updating of the HSSEQ Management System.
* A member of the internal Marine & HSSEQ audit team.
* Assist in establishing annual ISM & ISPS audit plans, arrange and co-ordinate internal audits, take part in audits and follow-up correction actions.
* Assist in the investigation and root cause analysis of accidents, marine casualties and near misses.
* Assist in preparation, implementation and maintenance of office and vessel’s contingency plans.
* Liaise with the vessels in safety, navigation, operations, health, quality, security and environmental matters, including monthly response to vessels relating to Vessel Monthly Safety Reports and Near Miss Reports.
* Assist in reviewing all safety-related reports from the vessels and other similar reports from other sources.

Job Requirements:
* Minimum 10 years' experience (at sea)
* Minimum 3-year sailing experience as Chief Officer on Chemical Tankers (with preference for sailing experience on parcel tankers)
* Hold relevant maritime certifications such as Chief Officer’s certificate or Master’s license (added advantage)
* Experience in Ship V Operations
* Experience with cargo changes/tank cleaning for IMO class 2 & 3 cargoes
* Knowledge of maritime regulations vetting by majors, Ship and Terminal
* Strong sense of responsibility, initiative and willingness to travel.

Roles & Responsibilities
Amaris Consulting is an independent technology consulting firm providing guidance and solutions to businesses. With more than 1,000 clients across the globe, we have been rolling out solutions in major projects for over a decade – this is made possible by an international team of 7,600 people spread across 5 continents and more than 60 countries. Our solutions focus on four different Business Lines: Information System & Digital, Telecom, Life Sciences and Engineering. We’re focused on building and nurturing a top talent community where all our team members can achieve their full potential. Amaris is your steppingstone to cross rivers of change, meet challenges and achieve all your projects with success.

At Amaris, we strive to provide our candidates with the best possible recruitment experience. We like to get to know our candidates, challenge them, and be able to give them proper feedback as quickly as possible. Here's what our recruitment process looks like:

Brief Call: Our process typically begins with a brief virtual/phone conversation to get to know you! The objective? Learn about you, understand your motivations, and make sure we have the right job for you!

Interviews (the average number of interviews is 3 - the number may vary depending on the level of seniority required for the position). During the interviews, you will meet people from our team: your line manager of course, but also other people related to your future role. We will talk in depth about you, your experience, and skills, but also about the position and what will be expected of you. Of course, you will also get to know Amaris: our culture, our roots, our teams, and your career opportunities!

Case study: Depending on the position, we may ask you to take a test. This could be a role play, a technical assessment, a problem-solving scenario, etc.

As you know, every person is different and so is every role in a company. That is why we have to adapt accordingly, and the process may differ slightly at times. However, please know that we always put ourselves in the candidate's shoes to ensure they have the best possible experience.

We look forward to meeting you!

ABOUT THE JOB
The Quality Operations Specialist plays a critical role in overseeing the quality system within manufacturing and production areas. This includes monitoring, documenting, and addressing quality-related issues to ensure compliance with company standards and regulatory requirements. The role involves collaborating with various teams to uphold the highest quality standards for released batches.

Key Responsibilities:
Ensure manufactured products adhere to company policies, processes, and procedures.
Provide quality oversight for GMP manufacturing, including technical operations, engineering, QC labs, and supply chain activities.
Review and approve incoming material inspections, batch records, manufacturing logs, and line-clearance activities.
Manage the release of materials and product batches.
Investigate non-compliance issues in materials, QC testing, manufacturing, warehousing, and products.
Support change management processes to ensure compliance with policies.
Conduct routine inspections of manufacturing, engineering, warehouse, and QC areas to maintain compliance.
Contribute to new product introductions, operational excellence initiatives, and other management-assigned tasks.
ABOUT YOU
Bachelor’s degree in Natural Sciences (Biology, Chemistry), Pharmacy, or Engineering.
2+ years of experience in a pharmaceutical or biopharmaceutical quality/compliance environment (GxP).
Familiarity with quality regulations and standards affecting APIs/Biologics.
Experience with SAP and Trackwise is a plus.
Strong knowledge of GxP requirements and regulatory standards.
Ability to quickly understand products and processes to address quality issues effectively.
Commitment to maintaining high-quality standards with integrity and a strong work ethic.
Excellent planning, scheduling, and communication skills.
Strong interpersonal skills for effective collaboration.
WHAT WE OFFER
An international community bringing together diverse perspectives and expertise.
Opportunities for continuous professional development through our robust training programs.
A vibrant workplace with frequent internal events fostering collaboration and innovation.
Commitment to Corporate Social Responsibility through our sustainability initiatives.
Equal Opportunity
Amaris Consulting is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to promoting diversity within the workforce and creating an inclusive working environment. For this purpose, we welcome applications from all qualified candidates regardless of gender, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, beliefs, age, marital status, disability, or other characteristics.

Roles & Responsibilities
Members of Marina Bay Sands Butler Services Team offer contemporary ultra-luxurious butler service with a strong commitment to create unforgettable memories for our very important guests within the Marina Bay Sands.
The new hire will be expertly trained to carry out tasks to highest standards in a dynamic environment to become a one-stop service for the VIP guests within the Hotel. The new hire will learn how to anticipate guests’ needs, acquire an attention to detail, to personalize interactions and applying creativity to craft unforgettable experiences for our guests. The main duties of the Butler include but are not limited to preparing VIP suites and rooms for arrival, be available for in-stay and departure arrangements as well as execute tasks typically carried out by departments such as Front Office, Concierge, In-room Dining, Housekeeping and Customer Service.
Members of the Butler Services team perform their duties with utmost integrity and purpose to delight our VIP guests and create unforgettable memories in ultra-luxurious settings.
JOB SCOPE
Supervise Day to Day OperationsAssist to carry out all business operational activities including customer experience, legal and safety matters, adequate manpower coverage, sufficient supplies, functional equipment and first to know of all the up-to-date information for a seamless operation.
Engage the Team Members to ensure their high competency and commitment to perform their specific job roles.
Resolve issues pertaining to guest’s negative feedback and manages the complaint efficiently to maximize guest satisfaction.
Collaborate closely with all internal team and relevant departments to ensure seamless guest experience.
Assist in monitoring to ensure adherence to organizational operating procedures and service standards are met.
Assist the execution of enhancement projects and new processes and follow-through with detailed evaluation.
Supervise the manning to ensure that operation is covered with sufficient manning.
Conduct regular audits and inspections with detailed report to relevant department.
Lead Service and Operational Excellence
Conduct service audit to ensure Service Quality Standards are met.
Innovate new ideas to enhance guest experience and revenue generation.
Manage guests experience consistently according to OneMBS purpose, vision, and mission.
Be directly involved in any service enhancement or review of service measurement index such as Net Promoter Score (NPS), this includes the action plan and follow through to improve the score.
Respond, resolve, and review guest comments, requests, and complaints in a timely and professional manner.
Supervise Operational Risk Adverseness
Supervise Marina Bay Sands Workplace Safety and Health Policy practices.
Ensure that all TMs are complying to all MBS policies and guidelines.
Report any work incidents; may include vandalism, fight, fire, abuse, accidents, etc.
Monitor activities in both front and back of the house; report any suspicious characters, items and/or activities to Security Department.
Supervise emergency situations.
Achieve Employee Engagement
Be the mentor to guide TM on their career and personal goals.
Establish learning and development plans and opportunities to enhance TM work performance.
Ensure that all TMs including self are well groomed as per company standard.
Hold regular meetings such as daily briefing to communicate departmental updates and review of operational standards.
Create a pleasant working environment that inspires the team and cultivate OneMBS culture.
Assist Documentation, Financial and report management
Attend scheduled departmental meetings as required.
Prepare scheduled reports as stipulated by management.
Manage cost control to keep departmental operating expenses within budget includes forecasting to better facilitate manpower and costing allocations.
Review systems and processes for workflow and productivity improvement.
Lead in supporting Sands Cares and Sustainability programmes.
Perform any other duties and responsibilities as and when assigned by Management.
JOB REQUIREMENTS
Education
Minimum GCE O Level.
Diploma or bachelor’s degree in hospitality management from a recognized institution is an advantage.
Required Experience
Minimum 1 year experience in the same or similar capacity.
Be ready to work on weekend, public holiday, and every shift, including night shift.
Competencies
Proficient in the use of Property Management System.
Capable to use Microsoft Office applications and presentation skills.
Proven leadership skills and ability to operate independently.
Having a good command of spoken and written English, and any additional language is an advantage.
Pays attention to details and have strong customer service skills.
Mature, meticulous, resourceful, organized, and able to work independently.
A team player and takes initiative to assist other Team Members when required.
Have impeccable follow-through; and “Can Do” attitude and mindset.
Be ready to work every day and every shift.
Good guest relation and problem-solving skills.
Good planning and execution skills.

Job Title: Assistant Director / Senior Manager of Operations (5*Hotel / Healthcare)
Job Description:
Roles & Responsibilities
A pivotal role in our client’s new setup. Reporting directly to the General Manager (GM), you will oversee and integrate operations across our hotel and hospital services, ensuring exceptional guest and patient experiences.
Key Responsibilities
Strategic Coordination
Lead and execute operational strategies across hotel and hospital functions, aligning with organizational goals.
Collaborate closely with the GM and executive leaders to ensure seamless integration between hospitality and healthcare services.
Serve as the primary liaison between hotel and hospital teams, fostering effective communication and synergy.
Operational Excellence
Oversee daily operations, including guest/patient services, housekeeping, food & beverage, facilities, and healthcare management.
Monitor performance metrics to uphold the highest standards in hospitality and healthcare operations.
Ensure compliance with industry regulations, policies, and standards.
Guest and Patient Experience
Cultivate a culture of excellence in service delivery, catering to the unique needs of guests and patients.
Develop initiatives to enhance satisfaction and build loyalty.
Resolve escalated guest and patient concerns promptly and effectively.
Team Leadership and Development
Lead, mentor, and inspire departmental heads across hotel and healthcare operations.
Promote collaboration and accountability within the team.
Implement training programs to enhance operational skills and elevate service delivery.
Financial Management
Manage budgets for hotel and hospital operations, focusing on cost optimization and revenue growth.
Prepare and present financial reports to the GM and senior leadership.
Identify opportunities to improve efficiency without compromising service quality.
Innovation and Compliance
Introduce innovative solutions to enhance operational efficiency and satisfaction.
Stay updated on industry trends and regulatory changes in hospitality and healthcare sectors.
Qualifications and Requirements
Education
Bachelor’s degree in Hospitality Management, Healthcare Administration, Business Administration, or a related field.
Experience
5 to 10 years of senior leadership experience with significant exposure to both hotel and healthcare operations will be advantage
Proven track record of managing large teams in high-performance environments
Skills
Strategic leadership and operational management expertise.
Strong communication and interpersonal abilities.
Financial management skills and regulatory compliance knowledge.
Preferred Candidate Profile
Demographics: Singaporean or Permanent Resident (PR)
Lanuguages: Ability to converse in Mandarin as required to liaison with Chinese clients
Cultural Fit: In-depth understanding of Singapore’s hospitality and healthcare sectors

Job Description:

We are seeking an experienced Assistant / Manager, Finance to lead our finance team and oversee all aspects of financial reporting, compliance, and strategic planning. The ideal candidate will ensure financial accuracy, regulatory adherence, and the implementation of robust financial controls to support our organization's growth and stability.

Financial Reporting:
Prepare accurate and timely financial reports for internal and external stakeholders.
Ensure compliance with accounting standards and regulatory requirements.
Conduct in-depth financial analysis to provide actionable insights into the organization's financial performance.
Monitor financial trends and assess their impact on organizational stability.
Cash Flow Management:
Manage cash flow to optimize resource utilization.
Forecast and analyze cash requirements to support operational needs effectively.
Compliance:
Ensure adherence to local and international financial regulations and accounting standards.
Coordinate with external auditors during audits and regulatory inspections.
Financial Controls:
Establish and maintain robust financial controls to safeguard company assets.
Regularly review and update financial policies and procedures.
Team Leadership:
Lead and develop a finance team of 4-5 members, fostering professional growth and a culture of continuous improvement.
Provide mentorship and guidance to team members.
Tax Planning and Compliance:
Oversee the accurate and timely preparation of tax returns.
Collaborate with tax advisors to optimize the organization's tax position.
Ensure timely and accurate quarterly GST submissions to IRAS.
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Accountancy, ACCA, or a related field.
Proven experience in statutory reporting and group consolidation is a plus.
Strong understanding of financial regulations, accounting principles, and financial analysis.
If you are a detail-oriented leader with a strong grasp of financial management and a passion for driving business success, we’d love to hear from you!

We strive to be the preferred employer by providing comprehensive benefits, a dynamic and exciting working environment, work-life balance and effort recognition.

We are seeking a self-motivated, solution-oriented and experienced Senior Software Engineer to join our Product & Engineering Team.

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related field, or equivalent training, fellowship, or work experience.

Developed and delivered software system for millions of users
Experience with debugging and diagnostic of distributed systems

Roles & Responsibilities
Job Responsibilities:

1. Developing Automation Solutions:
Design, develop, and implement automation workflows using RPA tools like UiPath, Power Automate, Automation Anywhere, etc.
Build bots to automate repetitive, rule-based tasks by translating business requirements into technical solutions.
Write and test code for RPA bots and work on deploying them in production environments.
2. Collaboration with Business Analysts:
Work closely with business analysts or process owners to understand automation requirements and gather process requirements and convert it into RPA documents (PDD&SDD).
Help in identifying the processes that can be automated and optimize them for efficiency.
Ensure the automation aligns with business goals and objectives.
3. Troubleshooting and Debugging:
Identify and fix issues with RPA bots during the development and post-deployment phases.
Debug and troubleshoot errors, ensuring that automated workflows run smoothly and meet expected outcomes.
Help with monitoring bot performance to ensure the automation processes are reliable and error-free.
4. Testing and Quality Assurance:
Conduct thorough testing of automated processes to ensure they function as intended.
Verify that the bots handle edge cases and exceptions correctly.
Assist in performing unit testing, integration testing, and user acceptance testing (UAT) of RPA solutions.
5. Support and Maintenance:
Provide ongoing support for RPA bots in production, including maintenance, updates, and troubleshooting.
Assist in optimizing automation processes to improve efficiency, reduce errors, and enhance performance.
Help with the regular monitoring of deployed bots to ensure they run without interruption.
6. Documenting Work:
Create detailed technical documentation for RPA solutions, including design, workflows, and troubleshooting steps.
Maintain accurate and updated records of all RPA processes, changes, and updates.
Provide user manuals or help guides for business users interacting with RPA bots.
7. Collaboration with Senior RPA Developers:
Work under the guidance of senior developers or RPA architects to improve skills and knowledge of RPA tools and methodologies.
Participate in code reviews, providing and receiving feedback to improve coding practices.
Learn and apply best practices for RPA development, deployment, and maintenance.
8. Process Optimization:
Review existing business processes and look for opportunities to improve them through automation.
Suggest enhancements to RPA solutions to improve performance or increase functionality.
Contribute to streamlining workflows and improving the overall efficiency of automated processes.
9. Learning and Skill Development:
Continuously improve skills related to RPA technologies and development methodologies.
Stay updated with the latest trends in RPA and automation technologies.
Take part in training programs and certifications related to RPA development.
9. Adherence to Coding Standards:
Follow coding standards and best practices to ensure high-quality, maintainable code.
Work with version control systems like Git to manage and track changes in the codebase.
Requirements:
Preferred Candidates
- Development experience in RPA tools (UiPath, Power Automate, Automation Anywhere, etc.)
- RPA Certification (UiPath, Power Automate, Automation Anywhere, etc.)
- Hands on experience in Python, VB .Net, Macros
Good understanding in SDLC process
Understanding of databases and SQL
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Self-motivated in a highly demanding environment & Good Team Player
Positive work attitude & Excellent communication skills

Company: VANGUARD INTERNATIONAL SEMICONDUCTOR SINGAPORE PTE. LTD.
Job Description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The key functions of Semiconductor Engineer is to:
Manage manufacturing process of the products, including technology yield and performance of the products
Develop test programmes and procedures to ensure the products meet their performance specifications
Provide advice on aspects of semiconductor process technology and maintain and repair semiconductor equipment
Design and develop the layout for integrated circuits according to electronics engineerings principles, using software to create design schematics and diagrams

Provide 24x7 support for all Diffusion Wet Equipment Tools and Issues
Task:
Possess knowledge on SPC, DOE, FDC, ECMS and all the statistical analysis tools to help optimizing equipment robustness..
Able to coach junior engineers in performing hardware trouble-shooting for daily operations
Establish Preventive Maintenance (PM) plans for all implant equipment and optimize PM for quality, cost, and productivity.
Liaise with vendors to resolve equipment issues and improve equipment performance
Initiate meeting with both process and manufacturing Engineers to ensure work is carried out efficiently to meet module objectives and analyze low yield and WAT issues
Establish stock levels of essential spare parts and consumables to support equipment maintenance based on forecasted manufacturing volume. Liaise with vendors to minimize / eliminate over-stock or under-stock
Manage new equipment start-up to support production, from facilities hookup, vendor startup, to acceptance of equipment for production
Develop continuous improvement and Implement equipment improvement projects to improve equipment efficiency, cost reduction and reliability of equipment
Forecast financial budgets for equipment expenditures. Setup tracking system to monitor expenditures
Set targets, goals, and projects for the section to minimize wafer scrap, equipment cost per wafer, optimize equipment capability and utilization to meet operational needs
Provide feedback / training to AEs and TAs on their troubleshooting skills, equipment knowledge, decision making, risks assessment
Follow up on SPSR, MRB, 8D, TECN, and ECN documentation for closure of issues / events. Provide guidance to Junior Engineers
Self audit and update specifications to meet TS16949 Quality Standard requirements
Set Expectation and carry out performance appraisal for Technician or AE as instructed by Section Manager. Help the AE or Engineer on their career path development
Provide long term solutions to address daily issues. Resolve department hardware chronicle issues.
Create and maintain implant operation SOP and PM OI
Develop continuous improvement to enhance equipment reliability and cost of ownership, Able to plan implant cost budget
Requirements:
Degree in Electrical / Electronics / Mechanical / Mechatronics / Microelectronics / Chemical / Material Science / Material Engineering
Min 7 years of relevant work experience in Diffusion Wet / Wet Etching Equipment
An excellent team player with good interpersonal, communication and written skills
Strong logical thinking capability and good analytical skill
High level of integrity with strong leadership attributes to lead and coach a team
Highly committed with good ownership and accountability
Able to adapt in a fast pace environment and work under pressure
Proficient in MS Office Applications

Experience with accounting systems (e.g., SAP, Workday) and system implementation, including User Acceptance Testing (UAT).

Excellent interpersonal, written, and presentation skills.

Roles & Responsibilities
Position Overview:
The Operations Manager is responsible for the overall strategic management and execution of core operational functions within the company. This includes leadership over Trip Support, Medical Evacuation Sales and Operations, Aircraft Owner Accounts, Crew Logistics, and the coordination of suppliers and vendors. The Operations Executive will ensure that the company's services meet the highest standards of efficiency, safety, and client satisfaction, while maintaining compliance with regulatory requirements and optimizing cost-efficiency.

Key Responsibilities:
Strategic Management of Trip Support Functions
Oversee the planning and coordination of flight operations, including route planning, overflight permits, ground handling, and fuelling.
Ensure seamless execution of client trips by maintaining close communication with internal teams and external service providers.
Monitor regulatory updates in international aviation to ensure compliance
Medical Evacuation Sales and Operations
Lead and manage the Medical Evacuation (Medevac) division, ensuring rapid response capabilities and adherence to medical and aviation protocols.
Establish partnerships with hospitals, insurance companies, and other service providers.
Oversee pricing strategies and service level agreements (SLAs) for MedEvac operations.
Management of Aircraft Owner Accounts
Serve as the primary point of contact for aircraft owners, ensuring client satisfaction and operational transparency.
Manage aircraft scheduling, utilization, and financial performance of owned aircraft.
Conduct regular reviews of aircraft maintenance status and liaise with technical teams for upkeep and service.
Crew Logistics
Oversee the coordination and management of all crew-related logistics, including commercial positioning flights, accommodation, and catering.
Ensure efficient crew rostering and duty time management in compliance with regulatory standards.
Manage relationships with vendors providing crew services such as transportation and lodging.
Executive Coordination and Vendor Management
Lead the selection, negotiation, and management of contracts with key suppliers and vendors, including handling, catering, fuel, and other critical operational services.
Develop and maintain strategic relationships with suppliers to ensure service continuity and cost-effectiveness.
Oversee the procurement process and ensure it aligns with company standards and budget constraints.
Safety and Compliance
Ensure that all operations are conducted in accordance with international and domestic aviation safety regulations.
Maintain strong working relationships with aviation regulatory bodies and ensure that safety audits and compliance checks are conducted regularly.
Implement and monitor a robust safety management system (SMS) across all operations.
Budget and Cost Control
Develop and oversee the operations budget, ensuring that all functions operate within budgetary constraints.
Conduct regular financial reviews to identify cost-saving opportunities without compromising service quality or safety.
Monitor expenditure on vendors and service providers, ensuring that financial objectives are met.
Team Leadership and Development
Lead, mentor, and develop a high-performing operations team, ensuring alignment with company goals and operational excellence.
Foster a culture of continuous improvement, identifying areas for process optimization and innovation.
Facilitate training and professional development opportunities for team members.
Crisis Management and Problem Resolution
Act as the point of escalation for operational challenges, resolving issues related to trip disruptions, client concerns, or vendor service failures.
Oversee the development and execution of contingency plans to manage disruptions, ensuring minimal impact on clients and operations.
Lead emergency response coordination in the event of operational crises.
Reporting and Performance Metrics
Develop and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) related to operations, trip support, vendor performance, and client satisfaction.
Provide regular reports to the executive leadership team on operational performance, including recommendations for improvement.
Ensure that data analytics are used effectively to enhance decision-making and operational efficiencies.

Working Conditions:
Full-time position, typically Monday to Friday, with occasional overtime as needed.
Office-based with occasional site visits as required.
Required Skills and Qualifications:
Extensive experience in aviation operations, preferably within the private jet or corporate aviation sector.
Strong understanding of international aviation regulations, safety protocols, and best practices.
Proven experience in vendor management, contract negotiation, and strategic supplier relationships.
Exceptional leadership, communication, and problem-solving skills.
Strong financial acumen with experience managing budgets and cost control.
Ability to thrive in high-pressure environments and manage multiple tasks simultaneously.

Job Title: Head of Operations / Manager (5* Hotel / Healthcaare)
Job Description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Senior Manager/Head of Operations, a pivotal role in our client’s new setup. Reporting directly to the General Manager (GM), you will oversee and integrate operations across our hotel and hospital services, ensuring exceptional guest and patient experiences.
Key Responsibilities
Strategic Coordination
Lead and execute operational strategies across hotel and hospital functions, aligning with organizational goals.
Collaborate closely with the GM and executive leaders to ensure seamless integration between hospitality and healthcare services.
Serve as the primary liaison between hotel and hospital teams, fostering effective communication and synergy.
Operational Excellence
Oversee daily operations, including guest/patient services, housekeeping, food & beverage, facilities, and healthcare management.
Monitor performance metrics to uphold the highest standards in hospitality and healthcare operations.
Ensure compliance with industry regulations, policies, and standards.
Guest and Patient Experience
Cultivate a culture of excellence in service delivery, catering to the unique needs of guests and patients.
Develop initiatives to enhance satisfaction and build loyalty.
Resolve escalated guest and patient concerns promptly and effectively.
Team Leadership and Development
Lead, mentor, and inspire departmental heads across hotel and healthcare operations.
Promote collaboration and accountability within the team.
Implement training programs to enhance operational skills and elevate service delivery.
Financial Management
Manage budgets for hotel and hospital operations, focusing on cost optimization and revenue growth.
Prepare and present financial reports to the GM and senior leadership.
Identify opportunities to improve efficiency without compromising service quality.
Innovation and Compliance
Introduce innovative solutions to enhance operational efficiency and satisfaction.
Stay updated on industry trends and regulatory changes in hospitality and healthcare sectors.
Qualifications and Requirements
Education
Bachelor’s degree in Hospitality Management, Healthcare Administration, Business Administration, or a related field.
A Master’s degree is an advantage.
Experience
5 to 10 years of senior leadership experience with significant exposure to both hotel and healthcare operations.
Proven track record of managing large teams in high-performance environments.
Skills
Strategic leadership and operational management expertise.
Strong communication and interpersonal abilities.
Financial management skills and regulatory compliance knowledge.
Preferred Candidate Profile
Demographics: Singaporean or Permanent Resident (PR).
Cultural Fit: In-depth understanding of Singapore’s hospitality and healthcare sectors.

Roles & Responsibilities
We are seeking a creative and results-oriented Marketing and Event Manager (APAC) to drive internal employee engagement initiatives and external partnership events, enhance employer branding, and create impactful content for both internal and external stakeholders. This role is pivotal in fostering a positive work environment, strengthening employee engagement, and positioning the company as a top employer and partner in the Asia-Pacific (APAC) region. The ideal candidate will have a passion for creating engaging events, designing compelling visuals, and producing high-quality content that aligns with the company's goals and culture.
Responsibilities
Internal Employee Engagement and Communication
Collaborate with Office Management team to plan and execute internal engagement events such as team-building activities, holiday celebrations and cultural initiatives to promote a positive workplace environment.
Design office decorations for key celebrations, company milestones, and themed events to enhance workplace aesthetics and morale.
Develop and distribute engaging internal newsletters to keep employees informed about company updates, achievements, and upcoming events.
Collaborate with HR to create programs that recognize employee achievements and foster a sense of community.
Act as the primary owner of internal communication channels, ensuring timely and engaging dissemination of company updates, policies, and initiatives.
Partner with leadership to craft messages that align with the company's vision and values.
External Sales Partnership Events
Organize and manage external events, such as partner summits, industry conference and networking sessions to strengthen relationships with sales and technology partners.
Develop event strategies and logistics, including venue selection, budgeting, and coordination with vendors to ensure seamless execution.
Create visually appealing event materials such as invitations, brochures, and presentation decks to support partnership events.
Act as the point of contact for external partners to ensure alignment on event objectives and outcomes.
Content Creation and Design
Create high-quality marketing materials, including posters, videos, white papers, infographics, and presentations to support both internal and external campaigns.
Design and produce visually appealing content for social media platforms, company websites, and newsletters to enhance brand visibility.
Maintain brand consistency across all communication channels.
Employer Branding
Develop and execute employer branding strategies to position the company as an employer of choice in the APAC region.
Collaborate with Talent Acquisition team to create campaigns that highlight company culture, employee success stories, and career opportunities.
Leverage social media, career fairs, and industry events to attract top talent and build the company's reputation.
Marketing Campaigns and Strategy
Develop and implement marketing campaigns for key company initiatives, ensuring alignment with business goals and regional market dynamics.
Monitor campaign performance and provide data-driven insights to refine strategies and improve results.
Work closely with cross-functional teams to align marketing efforts with organizational priorities.

Qualifications
Bachelors degree in Marketing, Communications, Design, or a related field.
Minimum 5-7 years of experience in marketing, event management, or content creation, preferably in the technology or system integration industry.
Proven experience in planning and executing both internal and external events.
Expertise in creating engaging visuals, videos, and written content tailored for different audiences.
Proficiency in design tools such as Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, Premiere Pro) or Canva.
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills to effectively engage internal employees and external stakeholders.
Strong understanding of strategies to enhance employer branding and attract top talent.
Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously, ensuring timely delivery within budget.
Knowledge of social media management, email marketing, and basic analytics tools to track campaign performance.
Creative thinker with a strong eye for design and attention to detail.
Collaborative team player with the ability to work across departments and regions.
Highly organized with excellent time management and problem-solving skills.
Enthusiastic and proactive with a passion for creating engaging experiences for employees and partners.

Roles & Responsibilities
We are seeking a skilled and detail-oriented BIM Coordinator specializing in ACMV systems to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for managing and coordinating Building Information Modeling (BIM) processes for ACMV projects, ensuring that all designs are accurate, efficient, and aligned with project requirements. The BIM Coordinator will work closely with project managers, engineers, and other stakeholders to optimize workflows and ensure successful project execution.

BIM Management and Coordination:
Develop, manage, and maintain BIM models for ACMV systems throughout the project lifecycle.
Coordinate with multidisciplinary teams, including MEP engineers, architects, and contractors, to ensure seamless integration of ACMV systems within the overall design.
Review, verify, and ensure compliance with project BIM execution plans and standards.
Model Creation and Detailing:
Generate detailed 3D models for ACMV systems, including ductwork, piping, and ventilation components, using software like Revit, AutoCAD, and Navisworks.
Create accurate shop drawings, schematics, and installation layouts based on the BIM models.
Clash Detection and Resolution:
Conduct clash detection and resolve conflicts between ACMV systems and other building systems using tools like Navisworks or BIM 360.
Provide solutions to design issues, ensuring efficient coordination and conflict-free models.
Project Documentation and Standards:
Ensure all BIM models comply with industry and company standards, as well as project-specific requirements.
Maintain up-to-date project documentation, including revision tracking and as-built models.
Collaboration and Communication:
Act as the primary point of contact for ACMV-related BIM coordination.
Facilitate regular BIM coordination meetings to address issues, update stakeholders, and ensure project milestones are met.
Provide technical support and guidance to team members on BIM-related processes and software.
Training and Development:
Train and mentor junior team members in BIM processes and best practices.
Stay updated on the latest BIM technologies, tools, and trends to continually improve workflows.
Requirements

Roles & Responsibilities
POSITION SUMMARY
The Legal Counsel will provide comprehensive legal support to our manufacturing and oilfield services operations, which span across six countries. This role is crucial for ensuring that our global operations comply with relevant laws and regulations while addressing legal matters that arise in our diverse business environment. The Legal Counsel will work closely with various departments to maintain accurate legal documentation, conduct thorough legal research, and manage legal risks associated with commercial contracts, intellectual property, employment law, data privacy, and regulatory compliance. If you're driven to navigate complex legal challenges and eager to grow in a dynamic, global industry, this role offers an excellent opportunity to make a significant impact. The ideal candidate will be detail-oriented, analytical, and able to effectively manage multiple legal matters.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Legal Documentation & Records: Maintain accurate and up-to-date legal documentation, records, and databases to support the company's global operations.
Legal Research: Conduct research on a variety of legal topics relevant to the company’s operations, including commercial contracts, intellectual property rights, employment law, data privacy, and regulatory compliance.
Compliance Monitoring: Monitor changes in laws, regulations, and industry standards to identify potential legal risks and ensure ongoing compliance with applicable requirements.
Cross-Functional Support: Collaborate with various departments to address legal issues impacting their operations and provide solutions that align with company objectives.
Contract Management: Draft, review, and negotiate a wide range of contracts, including non-disclosure agreements (NDAs), supplier agreements, and service contracts, ensuring they align with the company’s interests and legal standards.
Document Preparation: Assist in creating, formatting, and proofreading documents, including letters, reports, memos, and presentations, to ensure accuracy and professionalism in all written materials.
Regulatory Guidance: Provide guidance on regulatory compliance and legal risks associated with the company’s global operations.
Risk Management: Identify and address potential legal issues proactively to mitigate risks and safeguard the company’s interests.
Deadline Management: Record and monitor deadlines, update status, and track internal databases/reports of relevant tasks and projects to ensure timely completion.
External Coordination: Coordinate with external legal advisors and service providers as necessary to support legal operations and obtain expert advice.
Ad-Hoc Tasks: Carry out other ad-hoc tasks and projects as assigned by the CEO, demonstrating flexibility and a willingness to support various initiatives.
QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor's degree in Law or related field required; Juris Doctor (JD), LLM or equivalent degree preferred
3-5 years of experience in a legal role. Experience in the manufacturing and oilfield services industry is preferred.
Proven experience in handling legal matters related to commercial contracts, intellectual property, employment law, data privacy, and regulatory compliance.
Strong analytical skills and the ability to manage multiple legal matters simultaneously.
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to explain complex legal concepts to non-legal professionals.
Proficiency in legal research tools and software.
Self-starter, ability to work independently and as part of a global team, maintaining a proactive and results-oriented approach.

Roles & Responsibilities

Job Title: Project Coordinator
Job Summary: As a Project Coordinator, you will play a crucial role in coordinating all operations and projects related matter with various team. You will work closely with internal and external stakeholders to ensure reports and requests are delivered on time. This role requires strong organizational skills, attention to detail, and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment.

Job Responsibilities:
1. Assist in the planning and coordination of project activities, including scheduling meetings, preparing agendas, PowerPoint presentation and documenting minutes.
2. Coordinate with internal and external stakeholders, to ensure timely delivery of project deliverables and resolve any issues or conflicts that may arise.
3. Monitor project progress and identify potential risks or deviations from the plan, escalating to Service Delivery Manager (SDM), Project Director (PD) any necessary requirement from customers.
4. Plan, track and monitor the tasks assigned to the managers, team leaders and members
5. Clear and open communication with customers on operations and project issues or clarifications.
6. Assist in creating of PowerPoint presentation and Excel documents.
7. Provide administrative support as needed, such as managing project-related correspondence and other ad-hoc duties.

Job Skills and Qualifications:
• Diploma or equivalent
• Proven 3 years’ experience in project coordination or project management support roles, preferably in a fast-paced environment.
• Strong organizational skills and attention to detail, with the ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously and meet tight deadlines.
• Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written in English
• Exceptional interpersonal skills with the ability to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams and external stakeholders.
• Analytical mindset with the ability to identify issues, analyse data, and propose solutions.
• Advance skill sets in Excel and PowerPoint
• Adaptability and flexibility to navigate changing project requirements and priorities.
• Experience in Government IT projects is a plus.

Roles & Responsibilities
Requirements for IT Infra Engineer
We are requesting for 1-3 augmented resources (Associate Consultant/Consultant) for a minimum of six (6) months to create comprehensive user guide documentation to configure their systems to pipe logs to Government Cyber Security Operations Centre (GCSOC).
This documentation is crucial to enhance the self-help capabilities of Whole-of-Government (WOG) agencies, leading to more efficient and adoption of GCSOC services.
By providing clear, detailed user guides, we anticipate a reduction in support requests, faster onboarding times for agencies, and improved standardisation of practices across Government.
The scope of work encompasses approximately 150 products, including operating systems, servers, networking security, databases monitoring, cloud native services etc.
Scope of Works /Job responsibilities
Create clear, concise, and comprehensive user guides for WOG ICT products (Operating Systems, Servers, Firewall, Database, Cloud Service, etc) to send required logs to central monitoring service provided by GovTech.
Develop step-by-step instructions for ICT product configuration and/or setup required, to achieve GCSOC outcome
Conduct own research or setup to gather accurate technical information
Ensure documentation adheres to GovTech standards and best practices
Update and maintain existing documentation as products evolve
Incorporate user feedback to improve guide clarity and usability

Required Skills:
Must have experience in creating technical documentation (user guide, product guide, etc)
Familiarity with ICT concepts, including operating systems, networking, databases, and security
Understanding of SIEM systems and log management
Able to setup temporary system using virtualisation technology to collect relevant information or visual contents required for documentation
Ability to translate complex technical information into user-friendly content
Self-reliance and ability to work independently on creating the documentation
Knowledge of technical documentation best practices and standards (optional)

Company: JONES LANG LASALLE PROPERTY CONSULTANTS PTE LTD
Job Description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Senior Facilities Manager

Role Purpose
An exciting opportunity has arisen for a Senior Facilities Manager who will manage all high performing operational aspects of the assigned sites within the account owned and/or occupied portfolio in accordance with the requirements of all local requirements. The Senior FM will oversee the teams in APAC supporting all on account. This role is client facing and candidate must be able to exhibit exceptional customer and stakeholder service and communication.
What this job involves

The key focus for this role will be to support the team in APAC to ensure clear management and ownership in driving the internal operations of stakeholders and its clients. Ensuring services to the highest possible standards are delivered within adequate timeframes as well as representing the client and JLL values in appearance, presentation and manners throughout the APAC portfolio.

In this role, you will bring your people focused skills including strong stakeholder management and relationship building, continuous engagement and communications as well as your ability to proactively support the needs of our staff, clients and business partners.

You will be instrumental in ensuring the APAC workplace delivers a great experience for visitors and staff whilst also overseeing some remote sites. Your ownership of these multiple sites and people management to ensure you have happy customers in your whole community and your ability to proactively resolve queries and issues will be the cornerstone to your success in this role.
Promoting high level of satisfaction among client users by promptly responding to their service requirements.
Demonstrates leadership, gives direction and mentors the JLL team on site to promote engagement and excellency in customer service and delivery
Responsible locally for Building Management Systems, PPM Schedules, Task System, EHS and Quality Compliance
Ensures compliance with JLL and client best practice, policies and procedures including statutory compliance, Quality and EHS compliance.
Acts as go-to person in relation to all facilities/project/fit out/crisis management activities on site ensuring timely solutions and identification and removal of potential roadblocks
Develops a close working relationship with Client Key Stakeholders, Landlord, Managing Agents and all of the FM vendors to ensure that they fully understand the Client culture and become partners in delivering a high-quality service
Monitor PPM schedules, O&M’s, warranties, Task System, Asset & Life Cycle Registers
Responsible for Health & Safety during events, including contractor supervision, reviewing of H&S documentation and working closely with the Health & Safety Manager
Monitors and ensures office housekeeping and cleanliness is delivered to highest standards and that soft services functions are delivered in a timely efficient and customer orientated fashion
Proactively manages spend and budget locally in line with JLL policies and procedures including the processing of PO’s, invoices, budgets, service charges, rates, rent, insurance and local taxes etc. as applicable
Sound like you? To apply you need to be able to demonstrate the following skills and experience:
Bachelor's degree or equivalent facilities or property management experience.
Strong FM Background with a proven ability to understand and interrogate hard service / soft service delivery.
Ability to react quickly and decisively when faced with a problem or issue
Able to work off their own initiative and with minimal direction
Strong team player with a commitment to support their colleagues
Able to demonstrate superior people management skills
Ability to work under pressure and to tight deadlines
Knowledge of building systems, HVAC, electrical, mechanical, and plumbing services.
Superior client relationship management skills.
Strong leadership, supervisory and people management skills across multiple service lines.
Ability to work without supervision and drive positive outcomes.
Experience in a customer facing environment within technical FM services.
Experience with event management and planning.
Must be able to demonstrate flexibility in relation to type of works carried out and availability.
Excellent written and oral communication skills, including presentation and negotiation skills.
Ability to display initiative, confidence, and professionalism at all times
Must be prepared to travel in order to support region wide delivery
Ability to plan and manage financials within budget and time constraints as well as identify cost savings and avoidance opportunities.
Experience with contract management, vendor management and small capital projects.
Computer proficiency with MS Office and Computerized Maintenance Management System (CMMS).
Able to demonstrate knowledge of local health and occupational safety requirements
Experienced in dealing with critical facilities and vendor management for specialized services
Strong written and verbal English as a second language
You also need to be:
Self-motivated; confident & energetic
Flexible – able to adapt to rapidly changing situations
Goal-oriented – able to focus on meeting all performance targets
A strong communicator – good presentation skills and possess strong verbal & written communication skills (English & local language)
Critical Competencies for Success
Firm First mind-set
Able to cooperate and work well with others to meet targets
Support the team effectively as and when needed
Proven ability to commit to flawless execution while complying with firm’s procedures and standards
Client Focus & Relationship Management
Demonstrate and ensure to instil a culture in the team that match our ‘I am JLL’ core behaviours and values of being an Expert, Proactive, Innovative, Versatile, Team Player and valuing the Customer
Able to interact with the general client staff & vendors with ease
Ability to manage conflict and conflicting priorities
Demonstrates ability to work with vendors to deliver efficient services
Demonstrates proactive & professional approach to customer service
Project Management & Organizational Skills
Proven ability to manage multiple and complex operational matters on a daily basis
Demonstrates ability to prioritize and manage the completion of projects in an efficient and timely manner

Roles & Responsibilities
Main Purpose of Job
To manage the overall process of inducting new Partners and their support staff in relation to the SJP systems and processes. You will support the Partnership to ensure that they are able to process new business efficiently and will identify any improvements that can be made to the process. Roles & Responsibilities
Duty and Responsibility
Procurement engineers oversee the purchase of technical equipment for industrial operations.
They collaborate with designers/Site to determine the equipment needed to complete manufacturing or construction projects according to specifications, research vendors for that equipment, then order it.
These engineers negotiate purchase agreements with vendors and award contracts to vendors for equipment.
They also monitor any adjustments to the equipment needed to maintain an optimum supply of equipment to complete projects on time and within budget.
A procurement engineer must possess high-level organization and record-keeping skills to maintain a consistent flow of equipment to the company’s factories or worksites and ensure vendors are fulfilling the terms of their contracts. Influencing and negotiation skills are also crucial for procurement engineers, as it’s up to them to negotiate the purchasing agreements for engineering equipment and hire vendors for projects.

Roles & Responsibilities

Minimum of 4 years of relevant experience, particularly with hands-on involvement in outsourcing and BCP management, within organizational or operational risk management in financial institutions.
Proficient in Microsoft Excel.
Basic understanding of financial markets and risk processes, including risk reporting and post-approval monitoring.
Solid understanding of the risk management process and experience in implementing process controls. Demonstrated experience in applying these methods effectively.

Roles & Responsibilities
Junior Radio Frequency Design Engineer
About Doodle Labs
Doodle Labs is the global leader in high-performance private wireless systems. We build cutting-edge mesh networks for robotics, drones, and the Industrial Internet of Things. Doodle Labs has experienced rapid growth over the past five years as our radio systems have been adopted by Fortune 500 companies (e.g. Airbus, General Electric) and industry-leading innovators (e.g. Boston Dynamics, FLIR).
Your Opportunity
Doodle Labs develops market-leading broadband mesh radios. Products include handheld mesh hotspots (Wearable Smart Radio) and tiny embedded multi-band radios for robots (Helix). Your opportunity is to build novel RF products while implementing Doodle Labs’ patented RF techniques. You will design and develop next generation wireless communication systems utilizing Wi-Fi 4/5/6/6E chipsets and protocols.
Job Description
· Perform detailed radio frequency translation plans and architectures
· Evaluate gain, noise parameters (NF, SNR), dynamic range, linearity, and power consumption analyses to execute a predictable, robust design
· Collaborate with CAD engineers and drive PCB implementation of the design with emphasis on clean power supply design, interconnect design for required EMI and RF transmission performance
· Participate in design reviews and prepare design documentations at every stage of development until the final prototype test and characterization
· Perform parametric evaluation of transceivers, like Pout, IMD/IP3, EVM, noise parameters with spectrum analyser, modulation analyser and perform wireless link level functional evaluation to complete the product characterization
· Collaborate with product engineers for various certification procedures and NPI, followed by the Transfer of Technology (ToT) for large quantity production
Job Requirements
· Bachelor’s, Master’s, or PhD in Electronics Communication Engineering or Digital Communication Engineering
· Minimum 4 year of experience as a RF system hardware with proven track record of meeting industry delivery standards in the relevant areas
· Good interpersonal and creative skills with the ability to multitask in a demanding and fast paced environment
· Hands-on experience in the design and integration of RF, Analog, and Mix signal blocks such as PA, LNA, mixer, frequency synthesizer, filter, coupler, detector, microcontroller, etc., supplemented with knowledge of specification derivation from system level requirements
· Experience working with basic CAD tools and competence in evaluation flow and operation of appropriate test equipment to evaluate product performance
· Experience in script writing such as Bash, python etc., will be a plus as it is used in test automation

Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description
Doodle Labs is the global leader in high-performance private IEEE 802.11 wireless networking systems. We provide cutting-edge Smart Radio mesh networks for robotics, drones, and the Industrial Internet of Things. Doodle Labs has experienced rapid growth over the past five years as our products have been adopted by Fortune 500 companies (e.g. Airbus, General Electric) and industry-leading innovators (e.g. Boston Dynamics, FLIR).
We’re looking for strong software engineers to join our talented team of software, hardware and RF engineers. The ideal candidates will be responsible for designing, developing, and implementing wireless broadband firmware features and applications. They must be able to write clean code and push the capabilities of our Smart Radio as well as respond to customer needs and problems. They will also perform prototyping and application tests to support the production process.

Requirements

· At least 2 year working experience with Linux, C
· Strong communication skills and ability to engage with a cross-functional team.
