Company: JONES LANG LASALLE PROPERTY CONSULTANTS PTE LTD
Job Description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Property and Asset Management

What this job involves:

Being the glue that binds
Working as part of a team and assisting the headquarters portfolio managers, you’ll play a key role in our delivery of quality property management services to clients. You’ll drive initiatives that help improve our capabilities in achieving the highest service levels expected by our clients. You’ll achieve such an outcome by building strong relationships not only with your team members, but also with the property’s council members and residents.

Beating the daily grind
You’ll plan the daily operations and ensure the general maintenance of the condominium. Preparing and implementing an emergency/crisis management plan will also be part of handling the operations. Handling daily operations should be in compliance with the relevant building statutory requirements.

Creating an operation rhythm
In this role, you’ll ensure that your team gets through the daily grind of managing condominium properties. Particularly, you’ll be on top of the planning to achieve optimal daily operations—from the basic stuff to the nitty gritty details such as emergency/crisis management plan preparation and rollout. While all these sound like routine on the surface, getting everything in compliance with the relevant building statutory requirements should keep things exciting.

Going into the details
You’ll keep all details in check, specifically in terms of budget and financial transactions. You need to be on the lookout for the vendors’ intention to renew their contracts, as well as ensure proper delivery of all their invoices and insurance. You’ll have to be as accurate as possible as you may have to discuss such details during monthly council and annual general meetings.

Sound like you? To apply, you need to be:
If you’re a residential property management professional, with at least three to five years’ experience, come talk to us. We’re keen to know more about you. It’s also helpful if you have a working knowledge of condominium management software and a knack for keeping up with the latest tools of the trade. You should also have the capability to deal with an up-tempo work environment, where you can put your strong business, marketing, and management sense into great use.

An active, team-oriented leader
Do you have what it takes to build a strong and flexible team? Can you embed strong work ethics in people’s values, while at the same time keeping them well trained and motivated? If your answer is yes, then you might be the one we are looking for.

A critical thinker with consummate communications skills
You must be a problem solver who can get your message across. Additionally, having effective interpersonal skills will help you make sure everyone understands what needs done exactly. You must be level-headed during difficult times, and flexible and capable enough to carry your team through. You’re one who never gets tired of learning, as you need such an attitude to adjust in a fast-paced work environment.

What you can expect from us
At JLL, we make sure that you become the best version of yourself by helping you realise your full potential in an entrepreneurial and inclusive work environment. We will empower your ambitions through our dedicated Total Rewards Program, competitive pay and benefits package.
Apply today!

Role
We are looking for an experienced Senior HR Executive/HR Manager with a genuine interest in improving the landscape for education. You will work closely with the Founders to oversee and execute the full spectrum of HR functions, ensuring the alignment of HR strategies with organisational objectives.

Responsibilities
Talent Acquisition and Recruitment
Develop and execute recruitment strategies to attract and retain top talent.
Manage the end-to-end recruitment process, including job posting, sourcing, interviewing, selection, and onboarding.
Build and maintain a talent pipeline for future hiring needs.
HR Operations
Oversee payroll processes, ensuring accuracy and compliance with statutory requirements (e.g., CPF, tax submissions).
Maintain accurate HRMS records and prepare regular HR reports for management.
Oversee leave management, claims processing, and work pass applications for foreign employees.
Streamline HR workflows and implement process improvements for efficiency.
HR Policies and Compliance
Develop, implement, and update HR policies and procedures in line with local regulations.
Ensure compliance with employment laws and labour standards
Performance Management
Drive the performance management process, ensuring timely completion and alignment with organisational goals.
Work with Business Unit heads to develop Individual Development Plans (IDPs) and monitor employee progress.
Employee Engagement, Learning and Development (L&D)
Identify trainng needs and curate learning programmes for different roles and levels.
Promote a positive workplace culture through engagement programmes and initiatives.
Strategic HR Initiatives
Partner with leadership to align HR initiatives with business objectives.
Provide insights and recommendations on workforce planning, succession planning, and organisational development.
Requirements
Degree or Diploma in an HR-related qualification is advantageous but not a prerequisite
At least 5 years' experience dealing in full spectrum HR
Payroll experience is a must
Strong understanding of local employment regulations and HR best practices
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
Strong problem-solving and decision-making abilities.
Proficient in HRMS tools and comfortable learning new tech platforms
Ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.
Immediate availability is preferred
Working arrangement: Hybrid working arrangement can be arranged

Why Join Agora
We embrace input from our team members and encourage fresh ideas and continuous improvements, whether you are an educator, an events host or a part of our front of house team.

Here's why you should join us:
Innovative Environment: Work in an environment where your ideas matter and you have the opportunity to drive real change within a tech-enabled setting
Collaborative Culture: Join a team that values open communication and mutual respect.
Growth Opportunities: Benefit from professional development and courses to advance your career.
Flexible Work Options: Enjoy flexible arrangements to fit your lifestyle, whether full-time, part-time, or freelance.

Become part of a forward-thinking team that’s passionate about creating a better place to learn and grow. If this resonates with you, reach out to us.

Roles & Responsibilities
About Agora Colearning

We are an education startup dedicated to transforming learning experiences for children of all ages.
We combine our own programmes with an education marketplace offering tuition and enrichment programmes, both at our own centers and at schools.
Our mission is to simplify access to great educational opportunities and empower families to tailor their child's unique learning journey, with a strong emphasis on using technology in all aspects of our business.

Role

We are looking for a Centre Admin with a genuine interest in improving the landscape for education. You will work closely with the Founders to ensure smooth operations by managing daily administration, vendor coordination, facilities maintenance, inventory, and financial processes to maintain a safe and welcoming environment.

Responsibilities:
Cleaning & Maintenance: Liaise with cleaning and pest control vendors; schedule deep cleaning and routine maintenance; ensure facilities are well-maintained.
Facilities Management: Maintain asset lists; implement monitoring checklists for equipment; liaise with landlord on maintenance and compliance.
Inventory & Supplies: Monitor inventory levels and coordinate supply orders for various business units
Finance & Administration: Support invoicing; process withdrawals; handle overdue payments and invoices; support month-end reporting.
Safety: Maintain First Aid certification records.
Requirements:
Strong organisational skills are a requirement
Proficiency in using excel / google sheets / task management software
Basic accounting knowledge preferred
Attention to detail, problem-solving, and teamwork are key

Working Arrangement:
Part-time working arrangement, 20-hour work week (on-site)

Why Join Agora

We embrace input from our team members and encourage fresh ideas and continuous improvements, whether you are an educator, an events host or a part of our front of house team.
Here's why you should join us:
Innovative Environment: Work in an environment where your ideas matter and you have the opportunity to drive real change within a tech-enabled setting
Collaborative Culture: Join a team that values open communication and mutual respect.
Growth Opportunities: Benefit from professional development and courses to advance your career.
Flexible Work Options: Enjoy flexible arrangements to fit your lifestyle, whether full-time, part-time, or freelance.

Become part of a forward-thinking team that’s passionate about creating a better place to learn and grow. If this resonates with you, reach out to us.

Roles & Responsibilities
Who We Are
As Singapore's first institute for lifelong learning, the Singapore University of Social Sciences (SUSS) champions inclusivity to bring education to all and ensure that they are given equal opportunities to develop to their fullest potential in our diverse learning environment.
We advocate for the same for our people. We believe everyone should have equal opportunities and develop to their fullest potential in their careers.
Embark on an exciting lifelong journey with us in making a positive difference in your career and serving our society.
For more information on Singapore University of Social Sciences, please visit www.suss.edu.sg
About the Job
The Graduate Studies office is responsible for the governance and development of the University’s graduate programmes, which include Graduate Certificates, Graduate Diplomas, Master's Degrees and Doctoral Degrees. In addition, the office manages admissions and recruitment of graduate students, working in close collaboration with the Schools and various academic and administrative units across the University. The Graduate Studies office also directly oversees two cross-disciplinary degree programmes: the Master of Social Sciences and Doctor of Philosophy.
What You Will Be Doing
• Assist in developing and executing comprehensive marketing and outreach strategies across offline and online platforms.
• Organize and conduct dialogue sessions with external vendors, internal departments, partners, and prospective students.
• Create high-quality marketing collateral, including brochures, flyers, videos, and social media content.
• Host visitors, coordinate presentations, and showcase graduate program offerings.
• Manage stakeholder relationships to maximize the impact of outreach events and engagement activities.
• Collaborate with Success Academies on overseas outreach events and education fairs.
• Work with the marketing team to promote graduate programs on various social media platforms.
• Ensure timely updates of program information on websites and social media channels.
• Analyze data to refine outreach and recruitment strategies effectively.
• Stay updated on trends and best practices in student recruitment.
• Support the admissions process by addressing inquiries and providing assistance.
• Plan, coordinate, and support events and conferences locally and internationally, while monitoring public sentiment.
• Follow up on leads generated through various channels and devise strategies to maximize engagement.
• Develop and implement content strategies tailored to different platforms.
• Strategize and follow up on business account development opportunities.
• Participate in the selection and administration of scholarships, bursaries, and discretionary admissions.
• Manage admissions processes for international and transfer students.
• Oversee operations and processes related to graduate student admissions.
Job Requirements
A degree from a recognized university, preferably in marketing or related discipline
At least 2 years of relevant experience in admissions and student recruitment, or at least 2 years of digital marketing and social media marketing
A good understanding of the educational landscape of local and regional graduate studies and students’ preference
Strong marketing skills, as well as image and video editing skills
Experience in using various social media platforms
Strong communication and interpersonal skills
A good team player, problem-solver and multi-tasker
Good analytical and customer service skills
Able to occasionally work late
Able to travel overseas
Ability to meet tight deadlines and manage multiple tasks simultaneously
High attention to detail and the ability to work independently

Our Rainbow Centre Special Education Programme caters to students with multiple disabilities and autism spectrum disorder, aged from 7 to 18 years. With RC, you can expect a rewarding career in Special Education, making a difference in the lives of students with disabilities.

Job Description:
Roles & Responsibilities
JOB SCOPE
As a Pool Guest Service Agent, you will be part of the team operating one of the world’s most iconic and Instragramable Infinity Pool. Being a Pool Guest Service Agent, you will deliver the highest level of guest service to ensure guest experience a luxurious and leave them with an unforgettable memories.
The role will require you to perform and enhance multiple guest’s experience of the Infinity Pool from welcoming all guest, walking all guest to their sun beds area, setting up guest’s sun beds, providing guest with a fresh towel, introducing guest to the offerings / directional of the areas at the same time ensuring their stay at the Infinity Pool was a memorable and everlasting experience.
Operational Related
Warmly welcome and engage all guests visiting the Infinity Pool.
Share a quick introduction of the offerings available while escorting guests to their dedicated sun beds.
Provide exceptional service and create a memorable experience for all guests.
Set up and maintain the available sun beds, ensuring that they are ready for the next guests.
Take and process food and beverages orders.
Interact with guests and answer their inquiries appropriately.
Process guests’ requests. Own and communicate requests that are not directly related to the Infinity Pool, to the respective department and ensure that the requests are fulfilled.
Conduct tours at the Infinity Pool.
Ensure the availability of fresh towels, and present them to the guests.
Maintain and ensure that the towel distribution counter and return bins are neat and presentable.
Ensure that the Infinity Pool deck area is clean and presentable.
Ensure adherence to Company policy for access to the Infinity Pool
Bid all guests with a fond farewell upon their departure.
Departmental Related
Be familiar with the local community and major events in town, and make appropriate recommendations to guests to enhance their stay.
Maintains close liaison with all other Departments to have a good understanding of other Departments’ operational flow, thus ensuring seamless guest experiences.
Monitor activities in the Infinity Pool and report any suspicious characters, items or/and activities to the Manager.
Perform administrative duties as requested such as filing of reports.
Contribute ideas to improving the operations of Pools & Recreation.

Roles & Responsibilities
Mechanical Design Engineer
12 months contract, renewable
Work location: Depot Close
The Opportunity
Designs portions of engineering solutions for mechanical and thermal hardware, electronics enclosures, and production tooling based on established engineering principles and in accordance with development technology practices and guidelines.
Develops and implements parameters and test plans for existing designs, including validation of tolerances, form/fit/function, shock and vibration, electromagnetic interference, safety, reliability, developing fan curves, system power measurements & acoustics.
Conducts feasibility studies, design margin and validation analyses and empirical testing on new and modified designs.
Performs root cause analysis of defects, propose, evaluate and implement solutions.
Works in a collaborative environment to design, analyze, build and test mechanical components, devices, structures and assemblies, including mechanical ground support equipment.
Participates as a member of project team of other mechanical hardware engineers and internal and outsourced development partners to develop reliable, cost effective and high quality solutions for low to moderate to complex products.
Manages relationships with outsourced partners and suppliers, on mechanical and thermal design and development, including setting expectations regarding deliverables, product quality, schedules, and costs.
Manages design engineering change notifications/engineering change approval request processes, qualification tests, and schedule.
Manages value engineering project proposals, schedule, tests, and communication.
Impacts immediate team and acts as an informed team member providing analysis of information and limited project direction input.
Your Background
No experience required; must be four-year or graduate Degree in Mechanical Engineering or commensurate work experience or demonstrated competence.
Ideally has 2-4 years of work experience, preferably in engineering design and solutions, implementation across hardware development lifecycle, or a related field or an advanced degree with little or no work experience.
Knowledge & Skills: 3D Modeling, Ansys Simulation Software, Computer-Aided Design, Electromechanics, Engineering Design Process, Finite Element Methods, Injection Molding, Machining, Manufacturing Processes, Mechanical Design, Mechanical Engineering, Mechanical Systems, New Product Development, Product Design, Product Lifecycle Management, Prototyping, PTC Creo (CAD Suite), Sheet Metal, SolidWorks (CAD), Thermal Management

Roles & Responsibilities
About Agora Student Care

Agora Student Care provides care and supervision to primary school-going children after school hours. We provide a safe and supportive environment, support students' academic progress, as well as their social and emotional development. The curriculum includes homework supervision, online worksheets, guided research, and team sports.

Role

We are looking for a dynamic and experienced Student Care Teacher to join us as we look to build the future of student care at Agora Colearning.

Responsibilities
Implement class programmes in accordance with our pedagogical framework, including conducting the Agora Student Care enrichment programme, encompassing Learn to Learn, Life Skills and Physical Activity.
Supervise primary school children in preparing for, initiating, and completing their daily homework.
Observe and track evidence of children's academic and holistic development using educational tools provided by Agora Colearning, and contribute to reporting progress to parents.
Prepare, rearrange, and upkeep teaching resources and learning environment.
Ensure safety and security at all times, taking active initiative to identify and mitigate risks.
Model positive behaviour to ensure compliance and discipline.
Ensure smooth transfer of student custody between the parties (parents/guardians, drivers), quick checking-in and out of the Agora centre.
Requirements
Diploma or higher qualification. Diploma in Care and Programme (Student Services & Coaching) or WSQ Student Care Programme is an advantage
Minimum of 2 years’ relevant teaching experience
Ability to understand the primary school curricular content and supervise homework completion (accuracy and academic support are not expected, but minimum understanding is important)
Great communication and classroom management skills
Creative, enthusiastic, and energetic, with a positive mindset to learn and grow
Working days/hours
School term: Monday to Friday 11:00 am - 8:00 pm (Inclusive of 1 hour's lunch break)
School holidays and ad-hoc school closure days: Monday to Friday 9-hours shifts between 7:00 am and 8:00 pm)
Part-time Working Arrangement can also be arranged.
Why Join Agora

We embrace input from our team members and encourage fresh ideas and continuous improvements, whether you are an educator, an events host or a part of our front of house team.
Here's why you should join us:
Innovative Environment: Work in an environment where your ideas matter and you have the opportunity to drive real change within a tech-enabled setting
Collaborative Culture: Join a team that values open communication and mutual respect.
Growth Opportunities: Benefit from professional development and courses to advance your career.
Flexible Work Options: Enjoy flexible arrangements to fit your lifestyle, whether full-time, part-time, or freelance.

Become part of a forward-thinking team that’s passionate about creating a better place to learn and grow. If this resonates with you, reach out to us.

About Agora Playschool & Preschool
Agora Playschool is an enrichment programme for children aged 6 months to 3 years old that can be adult accompanied. It offers a complete sensory and educational experience for young children that prepares them for Preschool. Our teachers engage on a deep level with the children in order to discover their likes and dislikes, allowing them to display their true characters through imagination and exploration.
Agora Preschool places an emphasis on providing a genuinely personalised experience for each child. Our innovative and creative teachers, along with differentiated and tiered lessons, offer an opportunity that challenges each individual to reach their full potential. During a unique observation period, our teachers are given the time to comprehend the needs of their students and gain insights from parents, enabling us to tailor an experience that thoroughly prepares each child for their next steps in education.

At Agora Playschool and Preschool, the teaching team create meaningful experiences through its play-based foundation to learning. We help children grow as whole persons, develop curiosity, and strive in the world around them.

Help prepare and maintain dynamic learning stations.
Meet regularly with the team to develop planning, assessment, and student progress across the curriculum strands.
Help to identify children that need extra support to meet class goals across development areas and assist the main class teacher by working 1:1 with specific children when necessary.

Creative, enthusiastic, and energetic, with a positive mindset to learn and grow

Roles & Responsibilities
About Agora Colearning
We are an education startup dedicated to transforming learning experiences for children of all ages.
We combine our own programmes with an education marketplace offering tuition and enrichment programmes, both at our own centers and at schools.
Our mission is to simplify access to great educational opportunities and empower families to tailor their child's unique learning journey, with a strong emphasis on using technology in all aspects of our business.

Role
We are looking for an Education Consultant to join our team. You will be the first point of call for managing parent enquiries. The ideal candidate will have had prior experience in education sales or business development, have a strong grasp of parent and student needs across a number of tuition and enrichment areas and be highly proactive in managing their pipeline.

Responsibilities
Managing new parent enquiries promptly and effectively through a variety of communication channels (email, telephone, chat, in-person)
Convert enquiries into customers of Agora Colearning by understanding parent and student needs, identifying suitable trials, scheduling face-to-face meetings, and promptly following up
Work closely with our Student Care and Early Years teams to understand the parents' and students' needs and advise on suitable programme follow-ups
Systematically manage our customer base to help identify learning needs and identify solutions from our range of offerings
Requirements
Strong interpersonal skills and prior experience in prior sales roles preferably within the education sector
Interest in working in an environment that is dedicated to promoting children’s development and happiness
Demonstrated ability to track performance, work with CRM systems (HubSpot experience a plus).
Comfort working in a fast-paced environment
Why Join Agora
We embrace input from our team members and encourage fresh ideas and continuous improvements, whether you are an educator, an events host or a part of our front of house team.
Here's why you should join us:
Innovative Environment: Work in an environment where your ideas matter and you have the opportunity to drive real change within a tech-enabled setting
Collaborative Culture: Join a team that values open communication and mutual respect.
Growth Opportunities: Benefit from professional development and courses to advance your career.
Flexible Work Options: Enjoy flexible arrangements to fit your lifestyle, whether full-time, part-time, or freelance.
Become part of a forward-thinking team that’s passionate about creating a better place to learn and grow. If this resonates with you, reach out to us.

Roles & Responsibilities
We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Clinical Director to lead and oversee our clinic providing osteopathy and physiotherapy services. The Clinical Director will be responsible for ensuring high standards of patient care, managing clinical operations, and supporting the professional growth of the clinical team. This role requires a blend of clinical expertise, operational management, and leadership capabilities to drive excellence and growth within the clinic.

Key Responsibilities

Clinical Leadership:
Provide strategic direction and leadership for all clinical activities within the clinic.
Ensure the delivery of high-quality, evidence-based care that aligns with the clinic’s mission and values.
Act as a mentor and resource for osteopaths, physiotherapists, and other healthcare professionals within the team.
Develop and implement clinical protocols, standards, and procedures to maintain the highest level of patient care.
Operational Management:
Oversee day-to-day clinic operations, ensuring efficiency and optimal patient flow.
Collaborate with administrative and support teams to enhance operational workflows.
Monitor and manage clinical budgets, resource allocation, and staff schedules.
Ensure compliance with all healthcare regulations and accreditation requirements.
Team Development:
Lead recruitment, training, and performance evaluations for clinical staff.
Foster a collaborative and positive working environment to support professional development.
Address any clinical performance or patient care concerns promptly and effectively.
Patient Care & Relations:
Handle complex or escalated patient cases, ensuring satisfactory resolution.
Monitor patient outcomes and satisfaction to identify areas for improvement.
Engage with patients and families to ensure their experience meets the clinic’s standards.
Business Development:
Contribute to the growth of the clinic by identifying opportunities to expand services.
Collaborate with marketing and outreach teams to promote the clinic’s offerings.
Build and maintain strong relationships with external stakeholders, including referral networks.

Requirements

Education & Certification:
Degree in Osteopathy, Physiotherapy, or a related healthcare field.
Relevant licensure or registration with the appropriate governing body.
Advanced certifications or postgraduate qualifications in healthcare management are a plus.
Experience:
Minimum of 5 years of clinical experience in osteopathy, physiotherapy, or a related field.
At least 2 years in a leadership or management role within a healthcare setting.
Proven track record of managing clinical teams and operations effectively.
Skills & Competencies:
Strong leadership and interpersonal skills with the ability to inspire and motivate a diverse team.
Excellent organizational and problem-solving abilities.
Deep understanding of osteopathy and physiotherapy practices and trends.
Knowledge of healthcare regulations, patient safety, and quality improvement processes.
Strong communication skills, both verbal and written, to liaise with patients, staff, and stakeholders effectively.

Collaborates with experts to solve problems on projects to ensure customer satisfaction.

Reviews job closing and approves billing, follows up on customer receipt of project, customer satisfaction and payment for customer, supports accounting in resolving invoice/payment problems.

Actively participates in the strategic planning process, focused on future customer need and initiates potential research and development projects to gain competitive advantage and fuel business growth
Provides accurate bookings/sales forecast to assist in asset and budget management

Participates in special projects or activities, carries out special duties and responsibilities as assigned.

Proven track record of maintaining profitability on complex machined parts and assemblies.
Strong ability to prioritize tasks and handle multiple assignments with urgency in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment.
High energy and initiative; adept at seeking out information and establishing strong relationships internally and externally.
Demonstrated capability in managing and leading project teams effectively.
Proficient presentation skills with the ability to engage and convey information clearly to stakeholders.

Job Title: Project Coordinator(Application Support) - Up to $5.5K - EAST - KT
Job Description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Your main role is to assist the Project Manager and to complement his/her
responsibilities.
Ensure all the applications systems remain in good working order.
Take on support of new application systems when they become operational.
Respond to production emergencies in a timely manner which includes bringing up the server (in a crash) or system processes, fixing problems or finding workarounds.
Perform routine checks and to escalate to the Project Manager should any anomaly be detected.
Alert and troubleshoot together with other system engineers, database administrator (DBA) and outsourced vendors.
Follow through every issue / problem to closure, and complete the necessary documentation as required.
Assist users and answer queries regarding the supported operational systems.
Interface with the helpdesk agents, end-users and external vendors during application support and problem resolution.
Besides application support, you are expected to make some code changes/enhancements that arise from service requests.
Follow the technical standards and update the necessary documentation.
Report to the Project Manager in tracking and managing the project timelines and resources that he/she has been assigned to undertake.
Understudy and undertake the development of new applications and maintenance of any existing systems as assigned by the Project
Manager.
Requirements
Possess at least a Degree in Information Technology (IT), Computer Science or equivalent qualification.
Candidate shall have at least two (2) years of working experience in the IT or Infocomm industry, with exposure to end-to-end software development lifecycle (SDLC).
Good command of English and effective communications skills to interact and coordinate with end-users. This includes gathering user requirements, communicating proposed vendor solution, supporting user acceptance testing, supporting end-user training, and resolving issues with helpdesk agents and external vendors.
Ability to work independently with minimum supervision.
Work effectively as a team member among the system support and application development teams.
Demonstrate competency in Microsoft applications including Word, Excel and Outlook.
Must have competency in Project Management tracking tools such as Confluence, Jira.
You may be expected to be on standby support on weekends / public holidays.
In the event of scheduled downtime or during a crash, you are required to be in office during off-office-hours to support the systems.
*This is a 1-year contract(renewable) position.

Roles & Responsibilities
JOB SCOPE
Summary of Job Responsibilities
Acting as MBS’s representative within the contractual terms applicable, this role is to direct, co-ordinate and supervise assigned projects with the Project Team. The Project Manager will oversee and provide day-to-day direction for a team of Consultants, Contractors, and Assistant Project Managers.
The Project Manager will ensure that MBS’ briefs, designs, specifications and relevant information are made available to, and are executed as specified with due regard to cost and time by, the Design Team, Consultants, Construction Manager, Contractors, etc. (i.e. the Project Team), so that MBS’ objectives are fully met.
The Project Manager will maintain control of project schedule, budget and risk issues. This responsibility also includes facilitating timely decisions to maintain Project schedule and budget, as well as provide senior management with regular project updates, identify project risks early, and communicating prudent and timely recommendations for risk avoidance.


Job Responsibilities
The Project Manager duties would include, but not be limited to:
Responsible for the preparation and application of the Project Execution Plan.
Monitor and control the progress and development of all related project deliverables through the various stages of the project in accordance with the MBS’s policy.
Lead Project Management teams. Provide expertise, guidance, advice, support and motivate project teams.
Report to senior management via meetings or by regular written reports the progress of related project matters together with the status of related issues.
Manages routine client interaction. Sets and manages client expectations.
Manage and prepare all reporting activities required for the Project Stakeholders.
Attend meetings as required to ensure the compliance with the overall project standards, procedures and requirements.
Ensure that projects for which you are responsible are delivered on time, on budget and to the prescribed standards.
Ensure the prompt delivery of all project deliverables.
Find resolution to and preempt problems during the various stages of the project.
Communicates effectively with Operations Teams to identify needs and evaluate alternative Project solutions.
Assistance in the selection of the Consultants as well as in the negotiation of their terms and conditions of engagement with the Procurement team.
Assistance with the appointment of Contractors/Subcontractors, including giving advice on the most suitable forms of tender and contract.
Oversee that the review of all relevant submissions are in line with the project schedule.
Oversee and ensure that Change Management as it relates to budget, revised design and potential schedule impact is carried out in line with MBS procedures.
Assist the Design team with design management, design coordination and design delivery to meet the project schedule.
Work and liaise with the Design team on project matters, and also initiate value engineering initiatives to ensure that the project develops within the recognized cost and time constraints.
Regularly inspect the progress of the work on site and provide guidance to the project and construction management teams on best practices and potential efficiencies on scheduling and processes.
Oversee and support the Construction Management Team to ensure the adequate and timely flow of information, designs, technical data and feedback, to meet the stringent construction schedule requirements on the project.
Plan and Implement Procedure and Quality Checks for assigned projects.
Assisting the Director of Project Management as directed in any other Project Management related activities.

JOB REQUIREMENTS
Tertiary Degree in a Construction/Building/Project Management/Engineering related field.
Minimum 10 years working experience in the field of Project Management. Experience in the Hospitality field is preferred.
Sound knowledge of Project Management procedures.
Strong communication skills, as well as the ability to visualize issues and communicate them to others.
Outstanding organization, coordination and leadership skills – ability to coordinate groups of Consultants/ Contractors.
Ability to work in a team environment.
Marina Bay Sands is committed to building a diverse, equitable and inclusive workforce, providing equal opportunities as we grow our talent base to match our growth ambitions in Singapore. Our employees are committed to adhere to and abide by all rules, regulations, policies and procedures, including the rules of conduct and business ethics of the Company.

n this role, you will lead incident response (IR) efforts, integrate automation into security operations, and oversee the Security Operations Center (SOC) to ensure a robust and proactive defense against evolving threats. Roles & Responsibilities
My investment management client is keen to fill the below position. If keen please send your details to malvika@kstalentsolutions.com


Job Overview: As a Fundraising Specialist you would be responsible for raising capital and cultivating relationships with prospective investors, including institutional clients, high-net-worth individuals (HNWIs), and family offices.
This role involves developing and executing fundraising strategies, managing investor relationships, and supporting the marketing efforts to promote the firm’s investment strategies and products. The ideal candidate will have prior experience in the investment management industry, a keen familiarity with financial products, capital raising, and investor relations.

Key Responsibilities:
Fundraising Strategy Development:
Develop and implement capital-raising strategies for the firm's investment funds, tailored to institutional investors, family offices, and high-net-worth individuals.
Assist in setting fundraising targets and timelines in collaboration with senior leadership.
Collaborate with the firm’s portfolio managers and other teams to ensure the marketing of investment products is aligned with investor needs and market trends.
Investor Outreach and Acquisition:
Identify and target potential investors such as pension funds, endowments, foundations, family offices, wealth managers, and sovereign wealth funds.
Conduct outreach through meetings, calls, and events to generate interest and secure commitments for the firm’s investment products.
Lead investor onboarding and facilitate initial meetings between prospective investors and senior leadership.
Investor Relations and Communication:
Build and maintain strong, long-term relationships with both new and existing investors.
Act as a primary point of contact for investor inquiries, providing detailed and up-to-date information on fund performance, strategy, and market outlook.
Fundraising Campaigns and Materials:
Create compelling marketing and fundraising materials, including pitch decks, offering memorandums, quarterly reports, and updates.
Develop digital and traditional marketing campaigns to promote the firm's investment strategies to target investor segments.
Due Diligence Support:
Guide investors through the due diligence process, providing the necessary documentation, financial reports, and strategy information.
Coordinate with legal, compliance, and finance teams to ensure all regulatory requirements are met.
Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Finance, Business Administration, Economics, or a related field (Master’s degree or CFA designation is a plus).
Minimum of 5 years of experience in fundraising, capital raising, investor relations, or business development in the investment management or financial services industry.
Strong understanding of the investment management industry, including private equity, hedge funds, private credit, fund of funds, and other alternative investment products.
Proven experience in client acquisition, relationship management, and capital raising, particularly with institutional investors and family offices.
Exceptional communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to tailor messages for different types of investors.
Preferred Skills:
Experience with fundraising for specific asset classes, such as private equity, private credit, or alternative investments.
Deep understanding of regulatory compliance related to investment management and fundraising.
Strong network of institutional investors, family offices, and wealth management firms.

Roles & Responsibilities
Our client is an established Offshore Facilities and Components provider, serving the offshore energy companies, operating all over the world.
It is currently looking for a Lead Piping Design Engineer for its Singapore’s office.

Job’s Highlight:
· Global company in O&G industry
· Competitive salary
· Medical insurance included Vision & Dental insurance
· AWS/ Bonus
· Equal opportunity| conductive and productive working environment
· Location: North Buona Vista Drive| Nearest MRT Station: Buona Vista MRT

Role:
· The Lead Piping DESIGN Engineer is to have a strong background in piping design engineering, with the ability to lead and mentor a team of engineers and designers.
· The Lead Piping Design Engineer is to be conversant with widely recognized piping design requirements, codes and standards which is to be applied to Single Point Mooring (SPM), Topside and Subsea systems. Furthermore, shall be conversant in subsea pipeline design and selection, able to understand load interfaces of the subsea pipelines as well as other interfaces like soil and structural interactions.
· The Lead Piping Design Engineer is to have a strong background in piping engineering, with the ability to lead and mentor a team of engineers and designers.
· The Lead Piping Design Engineer is to be conversant with widely recognized piping design requirements, codes and standards which is to be applied to Single Point Mooring (SPM), Topside and Subsea systems. Furthermore, shall be conversant in subsea pipeline design and selection, able to understand load interfaces of the subsea pipelines as well as other interfaces like soil and structural interactions.
· The Lead Piping Design Engineer should ideally have experience of working in a shipyard environment and have shipyard experience.

Core Responsibilities:
· Technical Lead in developing Piping system design on Single Point Mooring Systems and other product offerings.
· Lead, mentor, and develop a team of piping engineers and designers, fostering a collaborative and high[1]performance work environment.
· Provide technical guidance and support to team members, ensuring adherence to industry standards and best practices.
· Conduct regular team meetings to review project progress, address challenges, and share knowledge. Manage the entire lifecycle of piping systems design deliverables, from the Tendering phase and Front-End Engineering Design (FEED) to EPC (Engineering, Procurement, and Construction) execution.
· Ensure that designs comply with project requirements and that all milestones and deadlines are achieved.
· Continuously monitor project progress, identify potential risks, and implement effective mitigation strategies to ensure successful completion of the project.
· Lead the preparation of essential PIPING SYSTEM DESIGN calculations and deliverables for EPC projects. This includes, but is not limited to, piping and instrumentation diagrams (P&IDs), piping specifications, datasheets, sizing, stress, and pressure drop calculations. Possess some knowledge of process engineering to enhance the integration and effectiveness of piping system designs.
· Oversee the entire piping system vendor requisition process, such as preparation of technical specifications and requirements, from quotation, evaluation, selection, installation, and delivery. Implement cost-saving initiatives and value engineering practices to optimize project budgets. Drive continuous improvement efforts within Piping discipline.
· Travels occasionally to sub-contractor facilities to attend Factory Acceptance Tests and fabrication support respectively.

HSEQ Requirements and Code of Conduct:
HSEQ: Complies with the client's HSEQ Code of Conduct as described in the HSEQ Policies, the 14 HSEQ Standards, and the HSEQ Procedures to always protect people and the environment. Has a duty of care to JOB DESCRIPTION ensure that all personnel work in a manner that is not harmful to their own health and safety and the health and safety of others.

Compliance: Complies with the client's Group Policy Code of Business Conduct and Ethics and expected training at all times.

Financial and Operational Dimensions/Impact and Decision-making Authority:
No budget responsibility, however commercial attentiveness is required as the role requires handling of high value equipment as well as understanding the technical selection has financial consequences.
Minimal Supervision: Objectives, priorities and deadlines are defined
Due to the safety-critical nature of handling hydrocarbons within the client's product line, meticulous attention to detail and a strong sense of technical ownership are essential for ensuring the operational safety of our facilities.
The Lead Piping Engineer must exemplify these qualities, demonstrating exceptional commitment to safety and precision in all aspects of their work.

Work Relationships:
Cultivate good working relationships with technical professionals, including engineers and designers, both within the organization and externally. External relationships include interactions with clients, contractors, and vendors.
Able to guide the development of direct reports, as well as other technical or non-technical team members.
Willing to share opinions, ideas, resources with others and provide constructive feedback and coaching. Foster commitment in the face of major obstacles.
Must be able to communicate well with all parties this role interacts with.

Job Challenges and Problem Solving:
Basic understanding of SPM (Turrets and CALM Buoys) system design aspects is required to work with the relevant disciplines to solve issues which arise. In office and out-of-office self-study of SPM systems is expected to achieve a high level of competency.
Some off-office working hours are expected to communicate with Houston Head Office for project planning and solving issues.

Requirements:
· Educational Qualification: Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering.
· 10 to 15 years relevant experience in Piping/Mechanical Engineering.
· Relevant Experience: Possess hands-on experience of at least 5 years as Lead Piping Engineer of large sized FPSO/Offshore platform/Topsides Modules projects
· Language Proficiencies in English & Chinese as teh individual/ role needs to communicate with the Chinese speaking clients, stakeholders, vendors and staffs
· Software skills: Software: Aveva E3D, Advanced Autocad Skill, Caesar II, Microsoft Word and Excel
· Key Behaviors: Leadership, Good sense of Ownership, Communication, Commitment, Customer Focus, Team Player
· Working Conditions: Office Environment (Working Hours: 8 am to 6 pm). Possible exposure to hazards such as noise, heavy equipment, temperature extremes, chemicals, etc. if working in fabrication or installation sites.
· Can work effectively in a fast-paced atmosphere with multiple priorities and constant change.

Job Title: Lead Security Engineer (AWS Security | IAM | Vulnerability)
Job Description:
Roles & Responsibilities
We are looking for Cloud Security Lead to pioneer in developing, implementing, and managing cloud security solutions to safeguard the organization's data and infrastructure. This role entails collaborating with cross-functional teams to ensure secure cloud environments while addressing emerging security challenges.

Details
Working location: Central
Working hour: 9am to 6pm / 10am to 7pm (Flexible arrangement), hybrid work arrangement
Salary package: Up to 13K + AWS + Attractive Bonus Scheme
Others benefits: Group insurance, above industries standard leave benefits, good employee welfare, annual dinners, cruise events, overseas trip, learning & development etc.
Responsibilities:
Develop and execute cloud security strategies and roadmaps, provide leadership and direction to the cloud security team, aligning efforts with organizational objectives.
Promote security best practices and foster a culture of security awareness across the organization.
Design and deploy secure cloud architectures and solutions, evaluate and recommend security tools and technologies to enhance cloud security.
Develop and manage IAM strategies to ensure secure and compliant access to cloud resources.
Implement and enforce IAM policies, procedures, and controls for managing identities, roles, and permissions.
Establish, enforce, and monitor cloud security policies and procedures.
Ensure adherence to industry standards, regulations, and best practices (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA, NIST).
Conduct regular security audits and risk assessments to identify and mitigate potential risks.
Lead incident response efforts for cloud security incidents.
Conduct root cause analysis and implement corrective actions to prevent future incidents.
Partner with DevOps, IT, and development teams to integrate security into all stages of the software development lifecycle (SDLC).
Collaborate with external vendors and partners to ensure robust security solutions.
Regularly analyze security logs, alerts, and reports to detect and respond to threats.
Prepare and present security metrics and reports to senior management.
Requirements
Min 7years of experience in cloud security, with expertise in AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud Platform and min 2years in lead position.
Strong understanding of cloud security & cloud infrastructure architectures, frameworks, and best practices.
Relevant certifications such as OSCP, CISSP, CCSP, or AWS Certified Security – Specialty is a plus point.
Knowledge of container security, Kubernetes, and microservices architecture.
Hands-on experience with cloud security tools and services (e.g., AWS Security Hub, Azure Security Center).
Proficient in security technologies such as IAM, encryption, SIEM, IDS/IPS, and vulnerability management.
Familiarity with regulatory and compliance frameworks (e.g., ISO 27001, SOC 2).

Roles & Responsibilities
Infrastructure Development:
Design, implement, and manage scalable, secure, and reliable infrastructure on AWS EC2.
Utilize Docker, Kubernetes, and EKS for containerization and orchestration of microservices.
CI/CD Pipeline Management:
Develop and maintain CI/CD pipelines using GitLab and ArgoCD to automate the build, test, and deployment processes.
Integrate QA tooling into CI/CD pipelines, including Cypress for E2E testing.
Configuration and Automation:
Implement Infrastructure as Code (IaC) using Terraform for efficient resource provisioning.
Manage configuration management using Ansible to automate system configurations and deployments.
Networking and Security:
Configure and manage load balancers using Traefik to ensure optimal traffic distribution.
Implement service mesh technologies like LinkerD to manage service-to-service communication securely.
Ensure infrastructure security and compliance with industry best practices.
Monitoring and Logging:
Set up and maintain monitoring and alerting systems using tools like CloudWatch, Prometheus, Grafana, and Splunk.
Proactively identify and resolve system issues to maintain high availability and performance.
Collaboration and Support:
Work closely with development and QA teams to understand application requirements and ensure seamless integration.
Provide support for development and staging environments, facilitating efficient testing and deployment cycles.
Optimization and Cost Management:
Analyze system performance metrics to optimize infrastructure for cost and efficiency.
Implement strategies for resource optimization without compromising on performance.
Qualifications:
Education:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, or a related field.
Experience:
Minimum of 3 years of experience in a DevOps or similar role.
Proven experience with AWS services, particularly EC2, RDS, and networking components.
Strong expertise in containerization using Docker and orchestration with Kubernetes.
Past experience as a software developer is highly advantageous.
Technical Skills:
Proficiency in setting up CI/CD pipelines using GitLab and ArgoCD.
Hands-on experience with Infrastructure as Code tools like Terraform.
Familiarity with configuration management tools such as Ansible.
Knowledge of load balancing with Traefik and service mesh implementations using LinkerD.
Experience with logging and monitoring tools, specifically Splunk.
Scripting skills in Bash, Python, or Go for automation tasks.
Understanding of microservices architecture and RESTful APIs.
Familiarity with our tech stack is a plus: TypeScript, Go, ReactJS, ExpressJS, Gin-gonic, GraphQL with JWT authentication.
Soft Skills:
Strong problem-solving and analytical abilities.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced, agile environment.
Detail-oriented with a focus on delivering high-quality work.
Preferred Qualifications:
Certifications such as AWS Certified DevOps Engineer, Certified Kubernetes Administrator (CKA), or similar.
Knowledge of Redis, MySQL, PostgreSQL, and Elasticsearch.
Experience with QA tools integration, including Cypress and Pact.js.

Roles & Responsibilities
Kiztopia is a successful start-up and the biggest indoor children playground in Singapore! We are seeking a dynamic and experienced Regional Operations Manager to oversee our operations within the Asia Pacific region. The ideal candidate will be a strategic thinker with exceptional leadership skills and a proven track record of driving operational excellence and efficiency.

Highlights of what we offer:
· Dynamic, fun and rewarding working environment
· Close knitted team
· Good employee benefits (eg. medical insurance, on job training, etc.)
· Career growth and development opportunities

Roles & Responsibilities:
1. Lead the preparation of new outlets, working with the local operations team to ensure everything is set for a successful launch.
2. Design and implement standard operating procedures tailored to each new outlet.
3. Develop and conduct training programs for the local operations team to ensure they are well-prepared for business-as-usual activities.
4. Set and enforce operational requirement standards, ensuring consistency and quality across outlets.
5. Assist the head office in developing business review reporting templates for regional performance tracking. Act as a liaison between the head office and operations managers in each region, ensuring continuous follow-up on business strategies and instructions.
6. Willingness to travel frequently and stay at new outlet locations for extended periods to oversee operations readiness.

Job Requirements:
1. At least 5 years of experience in operations management, preferably in retail or service industry.
2. Proficient in developing and implementing SOPs, have experience in training and team development.
3. Excellent verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills.
4. Excellent organizational and multitasking skills, able to work independently and effectively under tight deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
5. Able to travel overseas frequently with extended period of stay.

Qualifications Requirements:
1. Bachelor’s degree in Operations Management, Business Administration, or a related field.

* We thank all applicants for your interest but regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Roles & Responsibilities
Job Responsibilities
Culinary Operations Management
• Provide quality food products for our guests and support in achieving all goal designated by the Management team
• Provide direction for menu development and implementations
• Monitor the quality of raw and cooked food products to ensure that standards are met
• Develop interesting, exciting and balanced menus on a timely basis that are appropriate and responsive to the market
• Assist marketing efforts by creating and being known for an Unique Selling Point
• Taste food regularly and express informed and constructive suggestions to Chefs and team regarding food preparation and presentation
• Oversee the annual budgets and review sales and food cost on a regular basis to achieve budgetary goals
• Estimate food consumption to schedule purchases and requisition of raw materials while developing and implementing guidelines to control procedures for procurement and receiving areas
• Maintain a good knowledge of industry trends and changes
• Ensure non-standard culinary requests are met, in particular due to special dietary needs of guests
• Provide reviews on menus, analyse recipes, determine food, labor, and overhead costs; and assign prices to menu items
• Work with Facilities Management to ensure adequate preventative maintenance programs are being executed to keep kitchen equipment in good working order while maximising their life span
• Investigate and resolve guest complaints in a prompt, courteous and professional manner with proper documentation and resolutions
• Ensure a cooperative and professional rapport is maintained with all external controls
• Ensure overall efficiency in food production and general cleaning of kitchens, equipment, and utensils
• Work closely with the General Manager as a partner of the business
• Work in a kitchen set-up and continuously maneuver in and around all areas of offices

Hygiene and Sanitisation Management
• Ensure local regulations particularly in respect to food and refuse transportation around kitchens and service corridors are followed
• Ensure that periodic programs such as pest control, grease trap and kitchen hood cleaning are in place
• Coordinate equipment needs, cleaning schedule/project status, health/safety and sanitation follow up with the Executive Chief Steward
• Comply and ensure hygiene policies are strictly adhered to on a daily basis
• Conduct training on hygiene standards and performs regular inspections with outlet chefs and stewarding

Job Requirements
Education & Certification
• Degree / Diploma / Certification in Culinary or Management

Experience
• Minimum 5 years of experience in relevant restaurant concept and 5 years of experience as a leader in large culinary operations

Other Prerequisites
• Must have a comprehensive and diverse culinary background that suggests a well-developed set of skills to cope in large, diverse kitchen and restaurant environment
• Knowledge of fine dining cantonese cuisines and their preparation and services, with dynamic understanding in the latest culinary concepts in a broad range of cuisines
• Good knowledge in accounting and calculation of food costs

Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description:
We are searching for a curious and charismatic Sales Consultant to help us place crystal into the hearts and hands of our client's customers, to join a team with passion and enthusiasm and make the dreams of our client's customers come true.

Roles & Responsibilities
Software Engineer (Java)

Working Location: Central
Working Hours: Office working hours / Hybrid working arrangement
Salary Package: Up to $7,200 + AWS + Variable Bonus

Are you a talented Java developer eager to tackle complex business applications and system integrations? Join our dynamic team where you’ll play a crucial role in developing, testing, and maintaining essential software solutions. We’re looking for someone who thrives in a collaborative environment and is committed to best practices throughout the software development lifecycle.

Key Responsibilities:
Software Development: Design, develop, test, and maintain business applications and systems integrations critical for operational success.
Lifecycle Management: Apply best practices in all phases of the software development process to deliver high-quality solutions.
Collaborative Planning: Work alongside software engineers, business analysts, and architects to crea1te robust and scalable applications.
Code Review: Participate in peer-reviews to ensure quality and effectiveness in solution designs and code.
Deployment & Support: Deploy systems to production environments and provide ongoing post-implementation support, addressing any issues that arise.
Troubleshooting: Analyze and resolve technical problems, and provide maintenance support by investigating and fixing issues as needed.
System Optimization: Understand and enhance the inter-dependencies between applications, systems, and databases to boost overall efficiency.
What We’re Looking For:
Java Expertise: Strong proficiency in Java and related technologies.
Web Skills: Experience with front-end technologies such as HTML5, CSS, JavaScript, jQuery, and Ajax.
Framework Familiarity: Knowledge of Spring Framework, including its security, MVC, and cloud integration components.
API Understanding: Experience with RESTful APIs and SOAP/Web Services.
Database Skills: Proficiency in SQL and databases such as Oracle, MySQL, and PL/SQL.
Messaging Systems: Exposure to messaging technologies like RabbitMQ, ActiveMQ, or JMS is advantageous.
Testing Experience: Familiarity with unit testing tools, such as JUnit and Spring Test.
Version Control & CI/CD: Proficiency with Git and CI/CD tools like Jenkins and Jira.
Nice-to-Have Skills:
Cloud Experience: Experience with cloud solutions and Amazon Web Services (AWS).
Database Proficiency: Advanced skills in MySQL.
Containerization: Knowledge of Kubernetes.
Big Data Technologies: Familiarity with Kafka, Hadoop, Spark, or Elasticsearch.
Front-End Development: Experience with Bootstrap and ReactJS.
If you’re passionate about Java development and looking to make an impact in a supportive and innovative environment, we’d love to hear from you!

Roles & Responsibilities
Activate Interactive Pte Ltd (“Activate”) is a leading technology consultancy headquartered in Singapore with a presence in Malaysia and Indonesia. Our clients are empowered with quality, cost-effective, and impactful end-to-end application development, like mobile and web applications, and cloud technology that remove technology roadblocks and increase their business efficiency.
We believe in positively impacting the lives of people around us and the environment we live in through the use of technology. Hence, we are committed to providing a conducive environment for all employees to realise their full potential, who in turn have the opportunity to continuously drive innovation.
We are searching for our next team members to join our growing team.
If you love the idea of being part of a growing company with exciting prospects in mobile and web technologies that create positive impact on people’s lives, then we would love to hear from you.
What will you do?
We are looking for software developers that are open and enthusiastic about end to end software delivery and trying out new technologies.
Be part of a cross-functional development team that values quality, automation and user experience of the software we deliver.
Mainly responsible for software design and development of web frontend and backend applications
Write automated functional and unit testing for the code you write
Develop backend APIs & databases supporting the applications
Design and develop applications leveraging cloud technologies
Assist DevOps Engineer on build and release automation
Work closely with fellow developers in pair programming and code review
Work closely with Business Analyst, Quality Engineer, User Interface/User Experience Designers to deliver features
What are we looking for?
Experience in modern web applications development using NextJS, TypeScript and Kotlin/Java
Experience in development of CI/CD pipeline and applications deployment using cloud services such as AWS
Experience in database migration will be an added advantage
Working experience in an Agile/SCRUM setup will be an added advantage
Excellent verbal communication and listening skills
Proactive, self-driven and motivated
A Pass in ICT Assessment Certification for Solution Architect or Software Developer by NUS-ISS is a plus
What do we offer in return?
Fun working environment
Employee Wellness Program

Roles & Responsibilities
Activate Interactive Pte Ltd (“Activate”) is a leading technology consultancy headquartered in Singapore with a presence in Malaysia and Indonesia. Our clients are empowered with quality, cost-effective, and impactful end-to-end application development, like mobile and web applications, and cloud technology that remove technology roadblocks and increase their business efficiency.
We believe in positively impacting the lives of people around us and the environment we live in through the use of technology. Hence, we are committed to providing a conducive environment for all employees to realise their full potential, who in turn have the opportunity to continuously drive innovation.
We are searching for our next team members to join our growing team.
If you love the idea of being part of a growing company with exciting prospects in mobile and web technologies that create positive impact on people’s lives, then we would love to hear from you.
What will you do?
As a Full Stack Developer, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining web applications across both front-end and back-end technologies.
You will work closely with our customers and teams which consist of Software engineer, DevOps specialist, Data analyst/scientist to deliver easy to use application to help improve developers experience and accelerate application delivery while using our runtime platform.
Design and develop responsive web applications using modern front-end frameworks and back-end technologies.
Integrate third-party APIs to enhance the functionality and user experience of our applications.
Implement security best practices to protect user data and prevent unauthorised access.
Optimize application deployment cycle through improvement of application design and automation workflow.
Collaborate with cross-functional team from Development, Platform, and Product management teams to achieve common objectives.
Participate in code reviews, sprint planning, and secondary SRE-role rotation for better understanding of runtime platform.
What are we looking for?
Bachelor's degree or Diploma in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent experience).
Minimum 5 years of experience as a Full Stack Developer or similar role, preferably with background in containerization, orchestration, and cloud-native technologies.
Proficiency in front-end technologies such as HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and modern frameworks like Next.js, React, Angular, or Vue.js.
Experience in DevOps
Strong understanding of back-end technologies including Node.js, Express, Python, or Go.
Solid understanding of Git, RESTful APIs, and Agile methodologies.
Hands-on Experience with developing application in cloud platforms (AWS, Azure) or PaaS platforms (Vercel, OpenShift, Heroku, or similar offerings).
Experience with database systems such as PostgreSQL, MySQL, MongoDB, or similar offering from cloud providers.
Experience with microservices architecture or serverless computing is preferred.
Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams.
Familiarity with runtime technologies (ECS, Lambda), and infrastructure-as-code (Pulumi, Terraform) is advantageous.
Familiarity with DevOps tools and practices, including Docker, and CI/CD (e.g. GitLab CI/CD, Github Action) is advantageous.
Familiarity with implementing AI/ML based application, BI solution, Data warehouse, analytics, or visualisation is a plus.
Certifications such as AWS Certified Developer or AWS Solutions Architect is a plus.
A Pass in ICT Assessment Certification for Solution Architect or Software Developer by NUS-ISS is strongly preferred.

Fun working environment

Roles & Responsibilities
Activate Interactive Pte Ltd (“Activate”) is a leading technology consultancy headquartered in Singapore with a presence in Malaysia and Indonesia. Our clients are empowered with quality, cost-effective, and impactful end-to-end application development, like mobile and web applications, and cloud technology that remove technology roadblocks and increase their business efficiency.
We believe in positively impacting the lives of people around us and the environment we live in through the use of technology. Hence, we are committed to providing a conducive environment for all employees to realise their full potential, who in turn have the opportunity to continuously drive innovation.
We are searching for our next team members to join our growing team.
If you love the idea of being part of a growing company with exciting prospects in mobile and web technologies that create positive impact on people’s lives, then we would love to hear from you.
Build prototypes to demonstrate technological opportunities
Design system architectures
Write production quality code
Manage deployments to cloud infrastructure
Because our team focuses on pushing new initiatives, you will also have to:
Identify potential projects that improve the public good
Design novel systems that work around bureaucratic constraints
Advocate and explain these technical ideas to other government agencies
Additionally, more senior engineers will be expected to:
Establish best practices for developer operations
Share your expertise and mentor other engineers
Help with recruiting
You’re not just here to write code, but also to figure out what we should be building and how we should build it.
Your job will be to bring expertise and capability to the public sector. Sometimes this means coding new systems from scratch. Other times this means using the best solutions the development community has to offer. We use cloud services, open source software, and commodity hardware as far as possible. These often include, but are not limited to: GitHub, AWS, React Native, MongoDB, and Stripe amongst others. Knowing what to build and what to reuse: let us avoid wasting time on solved problems and focus on delivering actual value.
You will work on meaningful projects that solve problems pertinent to our society, from transportation, to education, to healthcare. The public sector is full of opportunities where even the simplest software can have a big impact on people’s lives. You will have direct ownership of your work with over 70% of our projects starting as ground up initiatives. Rather than work on commercial ventures commonly found in the startup scene, we’re here to improve how we live as a society through what we can offer as a government.
We work mostly in Javascript with some Python on the backend. However, we don’t require experience in any specific programming language or technology. Core competency in at least one language and the ability to learn is what matters to us.
What are we looking for?
At least 2 years experience of Javascript and Python
Have a demonstrated ability to build software
Prior work and personal projects count for much more than specific degrees
Write code to solve abstract programming problems
Clear thinking, the ability to debug, and understanding the limits of an approach matter much more than getting the “correct” answer
Talk and reason about code with other engineers
We work as a team so you need to be able to not just solve problems, but have other people understand your solutions
Take initiative to make things happen
Our job is to push for change in government, so we need to challenge the status quo and not wait for instruction
Want to work for the public good - We are public servants, we serve the public.
This sometimes means ignoring political pressures and misguided policies.
We need people who will push back if something is not in the public interest
Overall we look for people who have ability, initiative, good communication, and strong values.
What do we offer in return?
Fun working environment
Employee Wellness Program

Roles & Responsibilities
Activate Interactive Pte Ltd (“Activate”) is a leading technology consultancy headquartered in Singapore with a presence in Malaysia and Indonesia. Our clients are empowered with quality, cost-effective, and impactful end-to-end application development, like mobile and web applications, and cloud technology that remove technology roadblocks and increase their business efficiency.

We are searching for our next team members to join our growing team.

As a Quality Engineer, you have the opportunity to accelerate the delivery and to improve the quality of the software we build.
You will be responsible for designing, implementing and maintaining the product testing coverage from development to production environments. You will be part of an Engineering team that is working on problems in a number of areas, including design, plan, execute acceptance criteria define in user stories, detecting security vulnerability or application performance issues and conduct extensive exploratory testing to reduce the potential risks will be encountered by end users. Your focus is developing automated test scripts rather than finding bugs. Your job is to accelerate product development by helping developers help themselves.
You will typically work in small, nimble teams that collaborate on common problems across projects and across focus areas. As a result, you will have exposure to a broader set of problems, which allows for fast career growth and proximity to abundant technical problems.
Quality Engineers are focused on the hardest, most interesting aspects of delivering high quality software. For someone who wants to learn and grow as an engineer, having access to all of cutting edge technologies and platform, along with the vast compute infrastructure provides a unique opportunity.
Build advanced automated test suites to exercise our world-class applications.
Work with the development and other engineering teams to automate testing, applying risk-based strategy.
Conduct static and dynamic application security testing (SAST) and (DAST).
Conduct load and performance testing to identify application bottleneck.
Conduct research on emerging technologies related to application quality.
Analyse and decompose complicated software systems and design a strategy to test these systems.
Work with Product Owner and Business Analyst to craft out user story acceptance criteria.
Conduct application performance and security testing to ensure we have a robust and secured system in place.
Implement and maintain regression test suite in QA nightly build.
Actively refine smoke test suite in Development CI environment.
Lead system integration testing with other system owners.
Manage user acceptance testing/alpha testing and defect life cycle.
Drive continuous improvement in Agile testing practices and tools.
Ability to interpret the application source code and experience of using different cloud providers services such as AWS, AZURE and GCP
What are we looking for?
Degree or Diploma in Computer Science, Computer or Electronics Engineering, Information Technology or related disciplines.
Min 5 years experience in one or more of the followings:
Application exploratory testing and regression test automation
Application performance testing
Application security testing
Strong analytical skills.
Meticulous attention to details.
Good interpersonal skills such as tactfulness.
Good presentation and listening skills.
Experience in agile development environment will be an added advantage.
Experience with open source automated testing framework like Playwright, Cypress, Robot Framework, Cucumber, Appium, Selenium or enterprise level testing tools (Tricentis QTest/TOSCA, Micro Focus UFT or Micro Focus ALM/Quality Center) will be an added advantage.
Experience with open source performance testing tools like K6, JMeter, Locust or enterprise level testing tools (Micro Focus LoadRunner) will be an added advantage.
Experience with open source security testing tools like ZAP, Burp Suite, SQL Map, Clair, etc or enterprise level security tools (Mirco Focus Fortify On Demand, Prisma Cloud, Veracode, Nessus or CheckMarx) will be an added advantage.
Experience to setup the pipeline with CICD tools, such as GitLab, Bamboo.
Certified Software Testing Professional and/or Certified Software Quality Analyst and/or CREST/OSCP certification will be an added advantage.

Fun working environment

Roles & Responsibilities
About Us
SPH Media’s mission is to be the trusted source of news and lifestyle content in Singapore and Asia.
One of our core purposes is to produce credible, balanced, and objective news and analysis, always upholding the public good and fostering an informed, engaged citizenry.
We welcome talented individuals to join us and grow a career in a vibrant and collaborative environment built around a culture of respect and inclusivity.
As an employer, we are committed to rewarding our people fairly and developing them in their careers.

About Tamil Murasu
Started in 1935, Tamil Murasu is Singapore's only Tamil language newspaper. Tamil Murasu is the main information source for the Tamil-speaking Indian community with its coverage of wide-ranging news, from current affairs to local and foreign news, as well as the latest in sports and entertainment, in addition to its strong coverage on news from the Singapore Indian community and South Asia. The newspaper has established itself as a voice for the Tamil-speaking community in Singapore. It also has a robust digital presence and an active website. In addition, Tamil Murasu launched the TM App in late 2024, capturing much of the content created and its social media presence is strong.

Roles & Responsibilities
Select relevant news and features daily for both online and print
Help translate news stories from trusted sources for both online and print
Write using content from various sources such as Press Releases, other publications, etc.
Write original content such as features, commentaries, op-eds, editorials
Provide insight on various thematic contents and relevance to TM audience
Be digitally savvy to use the Content Management System and other related tools
Review and edit Tamil Murasu’s editorial content for accuracy.
Craft appropriate headlines and captions in Tamil with relevant details.
Assist, when required, in the creation of visual content based on the stories
Ensure the timely filing of the story for publishing
Job Requirements
Minimum degree/diploma holder from a recognised university/Polytechnic
At least 5 years experience in communications, policy writing or publishing field
Good news sense with a good understanding of trending news relevant to Tamil Murasu readers of digital and print versions
Effectively bilingual in English and Tamil
Familiar with Tamil translations of official names, terms and technical words
Familiar with local and regional matters
Able to work in a fast-paced environment
Able to work on weekends/public holidays
