Roles & Responsibilities
A. Overall Purpose Of The Job
As a member of the Service Desk team, this position serves as a single point of contact for all IT issues and requests reported by users through the different support channels (phone, email, Self-Service Portal, Tech Concierge Desk). It is responsible for providing support (remotely or onsite) on company supported computer software, applications, and platforms.

B. Key Responsibilities
The scope of responsibilities includes the following:
Serve as the first point of contact for users experiencing technical issues via different support channels (phone, email, Self-Service Portal, Tech Concierge Desk).
Diagnose, troubleshoot, and resolve hardware, software, and network issues efficiently. ● Log incidents and requests accurately in the service management tool, categorizing and prioritizing them based on urgency and documenting with event timeline.
Escalate unresolved issues to relevant next level support team (L2/L3)
Ensure effective management of all incident priorities including Major Incidents, Priority 1,2,3 and 4 and service requests through various communication channels, including phone, email, and in-person interactions at the concierge desk .
Act as an Incident Manager and drive end-to-end Major Incident and Priority 1 incident management process
Monitor ticket, email, chat, phone queues and agent performance to ensure adherence to service level agreements (SLAs) and quality standards
Handle user account lifecycle management (Joiner, Mover & Leaver), access provisioning in accordance with company IT security policies.
Perform regular out of office hours on call duties as per operational needs
Oversee DSAT feedbacks and take corrective action
Handle account provisioning across various system platforms (Active Directory, GSuite email account, Windows, Linux etc) for staff and generic accounts such as service accounts, admin account or FTP.
Oversee daily cessation activities and evaluate any potential issues to ensure compliance with audit requirements.
Provide reports upon stakeholder requests to list the active users or users associated with a specific application.
Manage and process IT service requests, assist in projects including user profiling setup, software installation, and system configuration
● Assist in DWS (Digital Workplace Services) BAU tasks and projects such as but not limited to the following:
OS imaging, deployment, upgrade, and tracking (Windows and Mac)
Endpoint device management
Hardware refresh
Maintain up-to-date knowledge base articles for common issues, troubleshooting steps, and SOPs used by the Service Desk team
Collaborate with cross-functional teams (Product Managers, Engineering, Architects, etc.), and business stakeholders and ensure proper escalation to improve service delivery and user experience.
Communicate effectively with end-users, keeping them informed of the status of incidents and requests.
Monitor alerts triggered from servers, databases, or systems and inform the respective teams for necessary actions.
C. Job Profile
Required Qualifications
Degree/Diploma in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field • Proven work experience in an IT support function such as a Service Desk Agent, Desktop Support Engineer, or other similar roles
Working knowledge and experience on ITSM ticketing tools (ServiceNow, etc.) • Working knowledge and experience on computer hardware, OS, software, and applications both in Windows and Mac environments.
Comfortable in supporting users over the phone, onsite, or remotely using remote access tools such as Teamviewer
Possess an ITIL v3 and above Foundation certification is an advantage
Knowledge of user access management processes and tools such as Sailpoint or OKTA is a plus.
Required Competencies
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
A minimum of 5 years of experience in a 24X7 service desk or technical support role
Good interpersonal and problem-solving skills
Able to multitask and prioritize the tasks accordingly
Pragmatic and flexible mindset to succeed in an ever-changing and dynamic environment • Capacity to learn and adapt to new technologies fast
Ability to proactively carry out tasks independently or with minimal supervision
Clearly and calmly communicating with team members or stakeholders to manage expectations and coordinate efforts during high-stress situations.

We believe in positively impacting the lives of people around us and the environment we live in through the use of technology. Hence, we are committed to providing a conducive environment for all employees to realise their full potential, who in turn have the opportunity to continuously drive innovation.
We are searching for our next team members to join our growing team.
If you love the idea of being part of a growing company with exciting prospects in mobile and web technologies that create positive impact on people’s lives, then we would love to hear from you.
What will you do?
Tech design, development, test and operation of the platform including but may not limited to frontend, backend, mobile application (for both iOS and Android) and other services/components required
To support service-based architecture design and implementation for backend services.
Python is a must-have, Django framework experience is preferred
Experience with React Native, ReactJS is a plus
Tech design based on the requirement provided by business team
Implementation of applications, services and integration
Testing and quality management of the solution including but may not limited to unit test, functional test, e2e test, test automation, etc.
Security monitoring, enhancement and issue fix
Cloud environment and deployment management
Operation and maintenance of platform and tech support provisioning
Tech design documentations(e.g. architecture, ERD, API specifications, flow chart, etc.)
Operational runbooks (e.g. admin manual, deployment manual, backup & restore plan, etc.)
Security design documentations (e.g. security architecture design)
Test reports (e.g. test coverage report for unit test, e2e test report)
Release report
Other works required by the development and operation of the project.
What are we looking for?
Degree in software engineering, computer engineering, electrical engineering, or infocomm-related discipline.
At least 5 years of hands-on experience
Excellent verbal communication skills
What do we offer?
Fun working environment
Employee Wellness Program

Job Title: Assistant Manager, Payroll & Claims Management (HR Shared Services)
Job Description:
Roles & Responsibilities
We are seeking an Assistant Manager to oversee our HR Payment and Claims team. This is an exciting opportunity for an experienced HR professional to lead a dynamic team while ensuring the timely and accurate processing of various HR-related transactions. You will play a key role in ensuring that HR processes such as payments, claims, and billing are managed efficiently, meeting both internal standards and compliance requirements.

Key Responsibilities:
Oversee the timely and accurate processing of HR-related transactions across all institutions and departments.Key Areas: Manpower Billing, Honorarium, Payment Processing, Medical Claims, and related matters.
Ensure the team meets Service Level Agreements (SLA) and Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) in accordance with organizational policies and relevant legislation.
Analyze and improve work processes to enhance team efficiency and overall performance.
Mentor and coach team supervisors and members to foster personal development, collaboration, and high team performance.
Lead and manage system improvement projects across HR Group Shared Services (GSS).
Participate in taskforces that promote the HR GSS values of Quality, Service, and Efficiency.
Oversee various HR-related payments such as intercompany billing, medical claims, compensation, benefits, research grants, and internal training payments.
Manage payments for self-funded inpatient/outpatient medical claims and research grants, including payments to doctors for research-related work.
Handle ad-hoc payments, such as bank rejections and one-off payroll cycles.
Lead the Claims team in processing self-funded inpatient and outpatient claims, managing medical benefits for dependents.
Supervise a team of 2-3 junior executives, providing guidance and support for their professional growth.
Requirements:
Minimum of 6 years in HR operations, with at least 3 years in a people management role.
Proficiency in HR systems (e.g., SAP SuccessFactors) and MS Office (Excel & Word).
Knowledge of Robotic Process Automation (RPA) is a plus.
Strong project management experience.
Analytical mindset with excellent problem-solving abilities.
High initiative and the ability to lead a team effectively.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
Meticulous attention to detail, especially in payment allocation and claims management.
Experience in healthcare or Shared Services contexts is a plus.
Strong people management experience is highly preferred.
Why Join Us?
Impactful Role: Lead a team that plays a crucial role in the smooth operation of HR processes and payments.
Career Growth: Opportunities for professional development and coaching within a supportive team.
Collaborative Environment: Work with a motivated team in a fast-paced environment that fosters innovation and efficiency.

Roles & Responsibilities
We are seeking a seasoned Head of HR & Admin to lead and inspire our HR and Admin teams across Singapore and Indonesia. This role reports directly to the Regional Head of HR and indirectly to the MD, making it a unique and pivotal position within our organization. We're looking for a strategic, results-driven leader who can align HR strategies with our business goals, foster a high-performance culture, and enhance employee engagement and operational excellence.

Position Title: Head of HR & Admin
Reports To: Regional HR HEAD, Indirect - MD
Location: Singapore & Indonesia
Team Size: 3 direct reports; oversight of teams in both locations
Overview
The Head of HR & Admin leads the HR function for Singapore and Indonesia, aligning human resources strategies with business objectives to drive employee engagement and organizational effectiveness. The role encompasses recruitment, employee lifecycle management, training, compliance, office administration, and ensuring adherence to local laws and corporate guidelines.
Key Responsibilities
Strategic Leadership
Implement local HR strategies that align with global objectives.
Establish HR department accountabilities including talent acquisition, training, benefits, career development, and succession planning.
Forecast labor costs and other HR requirements to support business growth.
Drive organizational design initiatives to sustain a High-Performance Organization (HPO).
Operational Management
Lead an integrated HR and Admin team in Singapore and oversee the HR team in Indonesia.
Oversee recruitment, onboarding, training, performance management, and employee development.
Ensure effective implementation of health, wellness, safety, and office management programs.
Serve as a business partner for internal stakeholders, promoting customer and partner orientation.
Enhance employer branding and employee retention through targeted initiatives.
Compliance and Risk Management
Maintain compliance with local laws and internal policies.
Work with regional HR functions to align local practices with global standards.
Oversee safety and occupational health measures.
Transformation and Change Management
Facilitate organizational and cultural transformation to uphold a high-performance culture.
Lead HR projects and initiatives to drive continuous improvement.
Leadership and Talent Development
Provide strategic HR support to management, identifying and nurturing talent across entities.
Motivate and mentor teams, fostering an environment of continuous learning and growth.
Project Management
Manage HR and organizational projects, ensuring timely and efficient outcomes.
Professional Development
Stay updated on industry trends and developments through conferences and continued learning.
Key Interactions
Internal Interfaces: Sales/business associates, Regional Internal Audit, Tax/Treasury, IT, Financial Services, and other regional teams.
External Interfaces: Recruitment agencies, payroll and tax advisors, HR consultants, training vendors, local regulatory authorities.
Qualifications and Experience
Education: Bachelor's degree in Human Resources Management or equivalent.
Experience: Minimum 10 years in managerial HR roles within multinational environments, with experience in the automotive, financial, or mobility sectors preferred.
Skills: Excellent communication, leadership, strategic thinking, stakeholder management, and change management skills. Ability to work across cultures and lead distributed teams effectively.
Attributes: Self-motivated, resilient, forward-thinking, capable of operative and strategic work, and adept at motivating teams.
If this sounds like you and you'd like to learn more, please contact Komal Mehta at komal@kstalentsolutions.com

Roles & Responsibilities
Direct, monitor and supervise the day-to-day activities of all sections within the Front Office and other services rendered by other operational departments of the Hotel, and to ensure smooth operations and customer service satisfaction in line with the established standards and policies of the Hotel.

Primary Responsibilities:
Supervise sections in Front Office, such as reception, cashier, telephone, reservation and baggage services. Monitor the junior staff’s conduct and job performance and to ensure that all staff project a positive corporate image to guests.
Ensure that guests are attended to with promptness, courtesy and efficiency and that guest complaints are handled with tact and diplomacy. Assist in checking in / out of guests.
Assist to inspect rooms assigned to VIPs before their arrival. Meet and show VIPs to their rooms and ensure that the complimentary amenities are provided. Ensure that GM, Sales and other relevant Departments are informed of the VIPs.
On commencement of shift to check on the handover log for messages and follow up actions. Ensure keys in custody are issued only to authorised personnel. Initiate correspondence regarding enquiries, reservations, and complaints. Check housekeeping discrepancy report; report any variance and take corrective actions.
Perform duties pertaining to security such as directing guests reporting incidents, thefts, or any offences to the Security department for assistance and handle matters concerning guest’s undesirable conduct in rooms / public areas or undesirable persons loitering around in co-ordination with the security department.
Maintain cash float amount in accordance with expected occupancy. Authorise rate and room changes, paid outs, cash advances, acceptance of cheques according to procedures and credit policies.
Responsible for training of all reception staff including planning, organising and conducting OJT.
Monitor room inventory closely to ensure maximum utilisation of rooms to generate higher revenue. Assist Sales to maximise revenue and occupancy from group allotments.
Directly responsible for the evacuation of staff and guests during a fire in the absence of the Safety & Fire Manager.
Conduct random checks on hotel driveway to ensure smooth traffic flow.
Handle all tasks/duties as directed by the Management.
To log in the DM log on any incidents or complaint from the guest.
To ensure a smooth flow of check in and check out
To create and assign room for last minute reservation outside Reservation hours.
Night shift support required
Job Highlights
We provide equal opportunities to learn and develop skill sets
We identify and build our talents
We foster friendly working relationships built on mutual trust

*We regret only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

*This role is for 2 properties - Novotel Singapore on Kitchener (nearest MRT: Farrer Park) & Mercure ICON Singapore City Centre (nearest MRT: Chinatown).

Company: ICE DATA SERVICES SINGAPORE PTE. LTD.
Job Description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description
Intercontinental Exchange, Inc. (ICE) presents a unique opportunity to work on cutting-edge technology and business challenges in the financial sector. The ICE Network Engineer provides leadership in network design, deployment, maintenance, and operational supports. The successful candidate will be able to multitask in a dynamic team-based environment demonstrating strong problem-solving and decision-making abilities and the highest degree of professionalism.
The Lead Network Engineer is an important role within the organization serving as a technical leader for Analysts and Engineers. The lead engineers are subject matter expert in parts of the network eco-system enabling them to handle complex issues. The engineer is fully involved in the project work, taking ownership of large network deployments from the design phase to the implementation, documentation, and support handover.
Along with having larger domain knowledge and advanced trouble-shooting skills. The Lead Engineer will be looked upon as an informal trainer to Analyst and Engineers, using every encounter to share knowledge and recovery tips with Engineers, better equipping them to handle similar issues in future. All interactions with the clients, colleagues and vendors must remain highly professional, helpful, and proactive.
Responsibilities
Design, deploy, support, and maintain mixed vendor network infrastructure.
Assist ICE staff with problem solving and escalation procedures.
Understand and follow operational policies/procedures and promote adherence to same
Provide technical knowledge needed to ensure safe, effective, and efficient changes to the network infrastructure.
Assist with development of policies and procedures for maintaining network infrastructure.
Collaborate and work closely with all other IT teams.
Lead Incident investigations, diagnosis, and service restoration and always give priority to the resolution of incidents.
Provide consultation (troubleshooting, designing, on-boarding, risk mitigation, operational improvement) for areas of domain strength.
Informal Trainer to Level II; ensures Level II skills are constantly growing through support and guidance.
Participation in 24/7 on-call rotation if needed.
Knowledge and Experience
Advanced knowledge of Cisco, Juniper, Arista and other vendor equipment and configuration
Advanced knowledge and experience with Routing Protocols (BGP, ISIS, OSPF, etc.)
Strong experience in MPLS and Traffic Engineering
10+ years’ experience hands on support and troubleshooting of networks.
6+ years’ experience with design and implementation on complex networks
Understanding of network management, security, and monitoring
Excellent writing and documentation skills
Excellent customer service attitude
Ability to operate effectively and professionally under pressure.
Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Technology, or a related field
Preferred
Experience working on financial and HFT networks.
Strong experience in Multicast in switched and routed networks
Expert level network certifications: CCIE, JNCIE. Etc.
F5, Checkpoint, or Palo Alto advanced certification
Automation and scripting experience
Unix/Linux system administration
Running and analyzing sniffer traces with deep TCP/IP protocol understanding.
Ability to grasp very complex architectural concepts.
In-depth hardware knowledge of switches and routers: (Internal chipsets specifications, TCAM and memory details, buffering capabilities and multicast replication details).
Master’s degree in computer engineering or related field preferred but not needed.
Schedule
This role offers work from home flexibility of one day per week.

Roles & Responsibilities
Responsibilities
Engage customers to understand their requirements and future IT plans.
Provide innovative solutions and value-add to our customer helping them to fulfill their business requirements.
Provide help and consultancy to our customers in addressing their technical concerns with respect to our product and solutions.
Propose solutions and innovations to customers via presentation, demo or Proof-of-concept.
Pre-requisites
At least 2 years of relevant pre-sales experience in system integration.
At least 1 year of relevant experience in system integration and implementation in Web-based and J2EE environment.
Good knowledge of databases, Object-orientated and web application concepts.
Proficiency in JSP, Java, Javascript, SQL Web Services, HTML, AJAX, as well as in one or more of the following platforms: Unix, Win NT and Linux.
Exposure to the following will be preferred:
J2EE
Web & Application Servers
Database Servers
Business Process Management
Web Services (e.g. SOAP, WSDL)
Confident and dynamic self-starter, with a good command of English, excellent customer relationship management and presentation skills.

Roles & Responsibilities
Position Overview
We are seeking a motivated and experienced Partner Manager to develop and lead our partner program. As the Partner Manager, you will play a pivotal role in driving business growth by establishing and managing relationships with resellers and implementation partners. You will develop a structured partner program and build a robust partner network that aligns with our business goals.
Key Responsibilities
Develop the Partner Program:
Design and implement a comprehensive partner program, including onboarding processes, training, certifications, and incentive structures.
Define tiers, benefits, and requirements for partners to encourage engagement and growth.
Build and Manage Partner Network:
Identify, recruit, and onboard resellers and implementation partners globally or regionally.
Establish and nurture strong relationships with partners, ensuring alignment with business objectives.
Act as the primary point of contact for partners, addressing their needs, resolving issues, and facilitating collaboration.
Drive Partner Sales and Growth:
Collaborate with the sales and marketing teams to create co-marketing initiatives and campaigns for partners.
Set and monitor partner performance metrics, including sales targets and customer satisfaction levels.
Provide regular reporting and insights on partner contributions to revenue and market share.
Support Partner Enablement:
Equip partners with the tools, training, and resources needed to effectively promote and implement our software product.
Organize and oversee partner events, webinars, and workshops to ensure continuous learning and engagement.
Strategic Development and Market Analysis:
Conduct market analysis to identify opportunities and gaps in the partner ecosystem.
Develop strategies to expand partner reach in key markets and industries.
Continuously refine the partner program based on feedback and evolving business needs.
Qualifications and Experience
Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Marketing, or a related field.
Proven experience (5+ years) in partner management, channel sales, or business development within the software or IT industry.
Demonstrated success in building and scaling partner networks.
Strong understanding of reseller and implementation partner dynamics.
Excellent interpersonal, negotiation, and relationship-building skills.
Strategic thinker with strong problem-solving capabilities.
Proficiency in CRM systems and partner management tools.
Willingness to travel as required to meet with partners and attend industry events.
Why Join Us?
Opportunity to shape and lead the growth of a key business channel.
Collaborative and innovative work environment.
Professional development and career advancement opportunities.
If you are passionate about building partnerships and driving growth, we would love to hear from you!

Job Title: Counterparty Onboarding Specialist, Partnership, KYC, CDD S$7500 (ID: 663174)
Job Description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Responsibilities

Responsible for managing the onboarding process of counterparties and financial institution (FI) partners. This role involves conducting due diligence, preparing documentation, collaborating with internal teams, maintaining databases, and supporting institutional business operations. The specialist will also assist with management reporting and handle interoffice collaboration and document safekeeping.

Counterparty Onboarding
Conduct due diligence for counterparty reviews and seek committee approval for onboarding.
Prepare KYC documentation and other necessary documents for authorized signoffs.
Liaise with legal, compliance, and Backoffice teams to review agreements and set up internal operations for trading.
Update and maintain internal databases related to counterparties.
Ensure proper filing and safekeeping of counterparty-related documents.
FI Partnership Onboarding
Liaise with the sales team to understand partner requirements and incorporate them into agreements
Work with various internal departments to perform due diligence, review, and draft necessary changes for agreements.
Establish procedures for new partner onboarding, including filing documents and maintaining updated records.
Update and maintain internal databases with partner information.
Ensure safekeeping of documents in the internal database.
Coordinate with counterparties and the IT department to set up data feed arrangements.
Regional Offices Collaboration
Collaborate with regional offices and address their queries or requests related to interoffice business matters.
Support regional offices in terms of interoffice documentation and maintaining updated records in the central database.
Institutional Business Support
Attend to sales inquiries and provide timely support.
Calculate quarterly and yearly incentives for sales and research teams.
Compute the annual profit and loss (P&L) for the institutional business unit.
Prepare and process KYC documentation, participation letters, and commission/research agreements for authorized signoffs.
Management Support
Assist management with data retrieval, analysis, and ad-hoc reporting tasks when required.
Support internal management reporting, ensuring timely and accurate submission of required information.

Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Business Administration, or related field.
3 years of experience preferably in counterparty onboarding, KYC compliance, and financial institution partnership management.
Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple tasks and deadlines.
Attention to detail and accuracy in document preparation and data management.
Possess problem solving skills to identify issues and implement effective solution
Analytical mind to assess data and provide insights to support decision-making and process improvement.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to liaise effectively with various internal and external stakeholders.
Proficient in Microsoft Office - Excel, Word, PowerPoint.
Familiar with database management and document filing systems.

Roles & Responsibilities
Job Details
Location: Maxwell
Working Hours: Mon-Fri, Office Hours

What you will be working on?
The role involves assembling 3D models of buildings in different BIM formats (e.g., RVT, IFC, GIS) through a suite of CAD/BIM authoring software to support the organization of planning data.
You will be required to understand and interpret planning and development records by synthesizing various data sources including approved plans in various formats (e.g., CAD, PDF, Bentley), as well as performing quality checks to ensure the accuracy of assembled data.

Singaporean only

Company: ONE WORLD INTERNATIONAL SCHOOL PTE. LTD.
Job Description:
Roles & Responsibilities
We are an equal-opportunity employer and value diversity among our teachers, staff and students.
At One World International School (OWIS), we are looking for passionate, adaptable educators who enjoy teaching students from diverse cultures. OWIS provides an individualised approach to learning that nurtures every aspect of child development. In addition to versatile learning spaces and a variety of extracurricular activities, we offer rigorous curricula that prepare students to be future innovators and leaders. We're an IB

Primary Years Programme (PYP) World School, a Cambridge International School and an IBDP School. All teaching positions require a high proficiency in spoken and written English, a degree, teaching qualifications and ICT literacy.

Overall Responsibilities:
To teach and educate students according to guidelines provided by the school’s curricular programmes - IB PYP, IGCSE and IB Diploma.
To teach and educate students according to the educational needs, abilities and attainment potential of individual students entrusted to his/her care by the Head of School.
To promote the attributes and attitude of the IB Learner Profile and the school values.
Includes the below but not limited to -
Teach across the whole age range.
Design, prepare and deliver lessons to teach basic knowledge, techniques, support and enhance learner’s understanding.
Assess and monitor the progress of learners and set goals for improvement, including writing students reports and attending parents meetings.
Lead or be involved in extra-curricular activities, school events, assemblies, staff trainings, meetings, etc.Promote the health, safety and wellbeing of all students.
Requirements:
Minimum two (2) years or more relevant full-time teaching experience as a qualified teacher.
Candidate must at least possess Bachelor's degree in Education and a Professional Degree in Teaching/Teaching qualification certificates (PGDE, PGCE, PGCEi, NIE Diploma)/Valid Teacher License/QTS.
Must have strong knowledge and experience of teaching IB PYP curriculum.
Experience in an international school environment (preferred).
A passionate educator with the ability to deliver student-centred, inquiry based learning.
Working Location: Punggol Campus

Planning, development and execution of marketing communication strategies and campaigns.

Job Description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The key roles and responsibilities are as follows:
Create Client Strategy – Develops effective strategies to drive profitable and sustainable growth. Maintain effective communication with country account team.
Execute Client Strategy – Responsible for implementing the strategic account strategy to maximize new service opportunities while acting as the client trusted advisor.
Achieve set portfolio/ account targets – including revenue, contracts signed, customer satisfaction and profitability. Responsible for to maximize operational excellence, drive profitable growth and minimize risk for FB.
Navigate Political Environment – Identifies, understands, and leverages the political dynamics in the client organization and within company to effectively achieve your goals. Develop a network of appropriate executive relationships.
Engage Senior Executives Through Thought Leadership – Establishes position of business advisor as well as creating potential growth opportunities with client executives by demonstrating thought leadership and strategic thinking.
Business Value Communication – Responsible for communicating and leveraging the value delivered to expand the client relationship and increase the business growth opportunities.
Represent the One Face of FB – Creates opportunities for selling unique, value-added solutions through the effective positioning of the full spectrum of the FUJIFILM portfolio. Architect & present bid and negotiate terms to gain contract.
Lead Virtual Bid team(s) – Leads, motivates, and inspires virtual teams to successfully execute client strategies and tactics to maximize sales effectiveness and increase win rates. Follow established pursuit process and gain defined approvals.
Innovation - Seeks opportunities for different and innovative approaches to addressing problems and opportunities.
Interpersonal Skills - Establishes and maintains effective working relationships with people; successfully addresses conflicts and problems involving people.
To succeed in this role, the candidate should possess the following qualifications, skills and experience:
Post Graduate Degree preferably in Management with more than 8 years working in IT consulting preferred, experience in Print Industry would be a plus, with significant experience in client engagement activities.
Strong presentation skills with effective spoken and written communication
Demonstrated the ability to develop value-based relationships within clients and leveraging them into multi-million dollar account relationships.
Led many business development cycles by using service-based solutions, demonstrating consultative selling and demonstrating closing skills.
Established a track record of achieving financial targets.
Superior engagement skill in managing lifecycle of complex sale and multiple client engagement.
Demonstrated ability to motivate and manage team, as well as mentor / coach individuals in the team.
Co-develop relationship expectations with key client executives.
Financial skills to construct business case based on decision making criteria.
In-depth industry knowledge in print and related industry
Strong knowledge of “Managed Print Services” and “Transaction Print Cycle” are desired skills.
Negotiation and commercial acumen
Use of Salesforce.com

Roles & Responsibilities
The successful candidate will support the development and implementation of a comprehensive compliance and governance framework to ensure ongoing adherence to relevant IT legislative and regulatory requirements (e.g., PDPA, MAS TRM, PCI). They will report regularly to IT Management on compliance status and engage with various teams to promote a strong organizational security posture.
Key Responsibilities:
Compliance & Governance Framework Development: Assist in the creation and implementation of a compliance framework to maintain ongoing adherence to relevant IT legislative and regulatory requirements. Prepare and submit reports to IT Management on the framework’s effectiveness and any compliance gaps.
Policy Compliance Monitoring: Support the development of a governing framework to uphold organizational information security policies, standards, and procedures, and report compliance status to IT Management.
Risk Management for Emerging Technologies: Contribute to the evaluation and formulation of a risk management framework that addresses new technologies, such as the Internet of Things (IoT).
Policy Review & Recommendations: Review and recommend updates to information security policies, standards, and procedures, accounting for deviation requests and audit findings.
Information Security Scorecard Development: Develop and maintain an Information Security scorecard framework that assesses and reflects the organization’s compliance level against established policies, standards, and procedures.
IT Risk Management & Assessment: Assist in developing the organizational IT risk management framework, performing periodic risk assessments.
Awareness & Phishing Programs: Support the design and execution of information security awareness and phishing simulations to strengthen organizational security culture.
IT Security Project Support: Collaborate on the evaluation, planning, and implementation of IT Security projects, ensuring alignment with compliance requirements.
Requirements:
Experience: Minimum of 2 years in Information Security, with a focus on consultancy and IT risk management.
Certifications: Security certifications such as CISSP, CISM, or CISA are preferred, with solid knowledge of IT legislation (e.g., PDPA, MAS TRM, PCI) and industry best practices.

Job Title: Relationship Manager /  Senior Relationship Manager, Private Banking
Job Description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Our client, a leading Indian bank is looking to hire Relationship Manager/ Senior Relationship Manager within their Private Banking group.

Responsibilities:
Client Relationship Management:Understand client requirements to ensure superior service delivery.
Provide regular updates to clients on financial market developments and their portfolios.
Acquire new high-net-worth clients and deepen relationships with existing ones.
Investment Advisory:Offer investment advice tailored to client needs and risk profiles in alignment with the institution's house views on products and asset classes.
Map clients' financial needs by analyzing risk profiles, asset allocations, investment horizons, and liquidity requirements.
Design customized portfolio proposals incorporating diverse products across debt, equity, and other asset classes.
Portfolio Management:Actively review and rebalance client portfolios based on buy/sell/hold triggers or recommended allocation changes.
Facilitate FCNR/INR deposits within the product framework as part of comprehensive asset allocation strategies.
Revenue and AUM Growth:Drive growth in assets under management (AUM) and revenue generation through effective client engagement and relationship management.
Compliance and Regulations:Ensure full compliance with local regulatory frameworks, in-country sales and marketing guidelines, and institutional policies.
Leadership:Lead a team of Relationship Managers (RMs) and Client Service Managers (CSMs), if assigned.
Undertake additional tasks or projects as directed by the reporting manager.
Qualifications & Requirements:
CACS Certification: Mandatory qualification.
Candidate should have 3+ years of relevant banking experience (RM) or 5+ years of relevant banking experience (SRM)
Customer Relationship Management skills
Knowledge of Financial Markets & Products (eg: Bonds, Equities, FX, etc.)
Knowledge and understanding of Indian banking landscape, India market and macroenvironment.

Company: PLAZA PREMIUM LOUNGE SINGAPORE PTE. LTD.
Job Description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The Assistant Finance Manager is the finance business partner for the organisation and has responsibilities covering all aspects of financial management, performance management, financial accounting, budgeting, corporate reporting etc. He/she has sound technical as well as management skills and be able to lead a team consisting of finance professionals with varied, in-depth or niche technical knowledge and abilities; consolidating their work and ensuring its quality and accuracy, especially for reporting purposes.
The Assistant Finance Manager is expected to provide sound financial advice and counsel on working capital, financing or the financial position of the organisation by synthesising internal and external data and studying the economic environment. He/she often has a key role in implementing best practices in order to identify and manage all financial and business risks and to meet the organisation's desired business and fiscal goals. He/she is expected to have a firm grasp of economic and business trends and to implement work improvement projects that are geared towards quality, compliance and efficiency in finance.

Manage the organisation’s financial accounting and corporate reporting functions.
• Manage a documented system of accounting policies and procedures
• Supervise and review the preparation of financial statements, business activity reports and forecasts for management and external stakeholders.
• Monitor changes and emerging trends in accounting standards and regulation.
• Provide financial leadership and strategic thinking to support sustainable value-creation.
• Apply professional judgement to identify accounting treatments adopted in financial statements and assess their suitability and acceptability.

Manage taxation-related functions within the organisation.
• Supervise the calculation of taxable income and income tax liabilities of the organisation.
• Assess the chargeable gains and losses of the organisation, as well as capital gain tax liabilities.
• Resolve tax-related issues with external tax experts.
• Articulate to management all relevant tax issues to minimise the organisation’s tax liabilities.

Support the organisation as a business partner.
• Advise management on the organisation’s exposure to risks.
• Analyse current market trends and provide strategic input to shape the organisation’s key financial decisions.
• Analyse, compile and present management information for managerial decision making.
• Analyse and assess the impact of investment decisions on the financial position of the organisation.

Manage strategic planning initiatives.
• Identify and understand the financing needs of the organisation.
• Identify and calculate both financial and non-financial performance measurements for reporting on the organisation’s performance.
• Oversee the preparation of the organisation’s budget.
• Interpret, investigate and report to management on variances, as well as develop a full understanding of the inter-relationships between variances.

Manage the organisation’s management accounting and budgeting functions.
• Maintain banking relationships for accounts for day-to-day transaction as well as investments.
• Prepare for the use and implementation of integrated reporting.

Support internal and external audit activities.
• Plan and coordinate the annual financial audit process.
• Respond to internal and external auditors on audit data, variances and audit findings.
• Implement policies and procedures with emphasis on internal controls to prevent possible fraud and errors.
• Resolve issues and deficiencies arising from audit findings.

Drive the use and integration of information technology within the organisation’s finance function.
• Use management information systems strategically for effective management and control of the business.
• Evaluate the effectiveness of the organisation’s financial system and determine any areas of improvement.
• Ensure the appropriate set up of accounting rules in the organisation’s financial system.

Others
• Any ad hoc duties as assigned

Job Requirements
• Candidate must possess a degree in accountancy or any equivalent professional certification (CPA, ACCA, CMA and etc.).
• Minimum 5 years working experience, preferably with hospitality/F&B industry exposure and with audit experience.
• Good knowledge of finance/accounting policies and procedures, GST, Singapore tax, audit and accounting laws, practices and regulations.
• Excellent organisational, strategic planning skills, highly responsible and reliable with exceptional attention to details.
• An influential finance leader with good analytical and problem-solving skills.
• Team player with an ability to function effectively in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.
• Must be proficient in MS Office. Candidates experienced in using Sun accounting software would stand at advantage.
• Travelling may be required.

Roles & Responsibilities
Senior Trust Administrator

About the Role:We are seeking an experienced and motivated Senior Trust Administrator to manage a portfolio of trusts, companies, and other wealth structures. The successful candidate will be responsible for providing first-class service to clients, beneficiaries, and intermediaries, ensuring timely delivery and high-quality results. With the support of a Trust Officer, you will identify and mitigate risks while working collaboratively within the office to support your colleagues.

Key Responsibilities:
Client & Intermediary Management: Deliver high-quality service to all clients and intermediaries, ensuring strong relationships and long-term partnerships. You will regularly conduct trust reviews and work closely with Trust Directors to enhance client service, ensuring all commitments are met on time and to a high standard.
Commercial Focus: Meet personal targets for time recording, utilization, and working capital management. You will assist Trust Directors in analyzing the profitability of client portfolios, monitor work-in-progress, and ensure the prompt collection of fees.
Risk Management: Proactively manage and mitigate risks within your client portfolio, leveraging technical expertise and escalating issues as necessary. Ensure compliance with internal policies and regulatory requirements.
Qualifications & Experience:
Professional Experience: A minimum of 4 years’ experience in trust administration within the fiduciary sector, demonstrating strong client service skills and an understanding of high-net-worth clients' needs. Familiarity with the technical aspects of fiduciary administration is essential.
Personal Attributes: The ideal candidate will be client-focused, self-motivated, and able to work effectively under pressure. Strong organizational skills and the ability to manage time effectively are key to success in this role.
Language Skills: Fluency in both English and Mandarin is required.
Education & Certification: A degree in Finance, Accountancy, or a related field is required, along with a relevant professional qualification such as STEP or ICSA.
Why Join Us?This is an excellent opportunity for a seasoned professional to grow within a dynamic team, manage high-value clients, and contribute to a forward-thinking, client-focused organization.
How to Apply: Interested candidates should submit their CV to manisha@kstalentsolutions.com

Job Title: Digital Graphics Designer, The Straits Times
Job Description:
Roles & Responsibilities
About Us
SPH Media’s mission is to be the trusted source of news and lifestyle content in Singapore and Asia.
One of our core purposes is to produce credible, balanced, and objective news and analysis, always with a view to uphold the public good and fostering an informed, engaged citizenry.
We welcome talented individuals to join us and grow a career in a vibrant and collaborative environment built around a culture of respect and inclusivity.
As an employer, we are committed to rewarding our people fairly and developing them in their careers.

About the Role
The Straits Times interactive graphics team is looking for a creative Digital Graphics Designer to join our team in the newsroom. You would be working alongside journalists, developers, designers, and editors to create original digital content for our readers. If you have a passion for illustration, storytelling, journalism, and the craft of designing digital experiences, please apply to join our dynamic team.

Responsibilities
Collaborate with journalists and data visualisation developers to understand requirements and translate them into visual designs that accurately represent the underlying data, editorial angle or product request
Assist in designing, illustrating and prototyping data visualisations, visual stories, social media assets using various tools and technologies
Collaborate with the UX team to ensure that interactive graphics are user-friendly, responsive, and accessible across various devices.
Help to document the design process, including any issues or challenges encountered during the design stages
Stay up-to-date with industry trends and emerging technologies to continually improve and innovate our interactive content.
Carry out investigative journalism/research with journalists using data, including conducting interviews and finding/verifying data sources
Use various statistics and data science tools for data parsing, scraping and wrangling
Manage workflow and process for data-driven stories in the newsroom
Thoroughly test and troubleshoot interactive graphics to ensure functionality and performance standards are met.
Requirement
The ideal candidate will be proficient in: Figma, Adobe CC (Illustrator, Photoshop, After Effects), HTML, CSS and JavaScript (d3.js, WebGL and Svelte are a plus).
Proficiency in industry-standard 3D modelling and rendering software and familiarity with 2D illustration.
Proficiency in GIS software (e.g., ArcGIS, QGIS), spatial analysis tools, and data visualisation platforms are a plus.
Experience with augmented reality (AR) design is a plus.
Excellent creative and artistic abilities.
Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a team-oriented environment.
Attention to detail and a commitment to delivering high-quality, accurate work.
Familiarity with the news industry and an interest in current events.
Experience in managing time effectively to meet deadlines in a dynamic and fast-paced environment.
Able to work on multiple projects simultaneously while maintaining the quality of work.
Prior experience in a data visualisation role / visual storytelling will be preferred
If you are interested, please apply with your CV and portfolio showcasing relevant working experience, including interactive graphics, data visualisations, and other digital design projects to ngbeeqi@sph.com.sg.

Members of Marina Bay Sands Butler Services Team offer contemporary ultra-luxurious butler service with a strong commitment to create unforgettable memories for our very important guests within the Marina Bay Sands.
The new hire will be expertly trained to carry out tasks to highest standards in a dynamic environment to become a one-stop service for the VIP guests within the Hotel. The new hire will learn how to anticipate guests’ needs, acquire an attention to detail, to personalize interactions and applying creativity to craft unforgettable experiences for our guests. The main duties of the Butler include but are not limited to preparing VIP suites and rooms for arrival, be available for in-stay and departure arrangements as well as execute tasks typically carried out by departments such as Front Office, Concierge, In-room Dining, Housekeeping and Customer Service.
Members of the Butler Services team perform their duties with utmost integrity and purpose to delight our VIP guests and create unforgettable memories in ultra-luxurious settings.

Supervise Day to Day OperationsAssist to carry out all business operational activities including customer experience, legal and safety matters, adequate manpower coverage, sufficient supplies, functional equipment and first to know of all the up-to-date information for a seamless operation.

Collaborate closely with all internal team and relevant departments to ensure seamless guest experience.
Assist in monitoring to ensure adherence to organizational operating procedures and service standards are met.
Assist the execution of enhancement projects and new processes and follow-through with detailed evaluation.
Supervise the manning to ensure that operation is covered with sufficient manning.
Conduct regular audits and inspections with detailed report to relevant department.

Conduct service audit to ensure Service Quality Standards are met.
Innovate new ideas to enhance guest experience and revenue generation.
Manage guests experience consistently according to OneMBS purpose, vision, and mission.

Respond, resolve, and review guest comments, requests, and complaints in a timely and professional manner.

Ensure that all TMs are complying to all MBS policies and guidelines.
Report any work incidents; may include vandalism, fight, fire, abuse, accidents, etc.

Supervise emergency situations.

Establish learning and development plans and opportunities to enhance TM work performance.
Ensure that all TMs including self are well groomed as per company standard.
Hold regular meetings such as daily briefing to communicate departmental updates and review of operational standards.
Create a pleasant working environment that inspires the team and cultivate OneMBS culture.

Prepare scheduled reports as stipulated by management.

Mature, meticulous, resourceful, organized, and able to work independently.
A team player and takes initiative to assist other Team Members when required.
Have impeccable follow-through; and “Can Do” attitude and mindset.
Be ready to work every day and every shift.
Good guest relation and problem-solving skills.
Good planning and execution skills.

Job Description:
Roles & Responsibilities
We are an equal-opportunity employer and value diversity among our teachers, staff and students.

At One World International School (OWIS), we are looking for passionate, adaptable educators who enjoy teaching students from diverse cultures. OWIS provides an individualised approach to learning that nurtures every aspect of child development. In addition to versatile learning spaces and a variety of extracurricular activities, we offer rigorous curricula that prepare students to be future innovators and leaders.

We are an IB Primary Years Programme (PYP) World School, a Cambridge International School and an IBDP School. All teaching positions require a high proficiency in spoken and written English, a degree, teaching qualifications and ICT literacy.

One World International School is committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of the children. We are committed to recruiting candidates who share this commitment to safeguarding. Before an offer is given, candidates will undergo child protection screening and will be required to provide a Police Verification Check from their country of residence.
If you are looking to work with enthusiastic students from around the world and become part of our dynamic school community, we invite you to submit your application for the following position.

Overall Responsibilities:
Support the main classroom teacher in the implementation of daily programs to facilitate learning.
Work with groups of students under the teacher’s direct supervision.
Supervise the playing of educational games.
Work with students who have varying degrees of learning support needs.
Ensure that students adhere to the school’s behaviour policy.
Prepare work and activities in accordance with the objectives set by the teacher.
Assist the teacher in helping with the student’s physical needs, whilst also encouraging independence.
Responsible for the upkeep of teaching resources, prepare art and craft materials, arrangement, appearance, decorations, and learning environment of the classroom
Use positive discipline techniques at all times.
Maintain and build relationships with children and parents.
Being part of the team, you will participate in parents and community engagement activities.
Give feedback to teachers on students’ progress.
Any other related duties as requested by the Head of School.
Requirements:
Be a passionate educator with the ability to deliver inquiry based learning.
Creative and inspiring with loving energy.
Diploma in Early Childhood.
Care and Education preferred.
Prior experience in a classroom environment preferred.
Work Location: Punggol Campus

Roles & Responsibilities
**Summary:**
As a Workplace Safety and Health (WSH) Coordinator, you will be responsible for ensuring a safe and healthy work environment by implementing and monitoring safety protocols and procedures in compliance with regulatory requirements. This role is crucial in promoting a culture of safety within the workplace and minimizing risks to employees and the environment.

**Key Responsibilities:**
1. Assist WSH Officer on implement safety policies and procedures to ensure compliance with workplace safety regulations.
2. Conduct regular safety inspections to identify potential hazards and risks.
3. Provide safety training to employees on proper safety practices and procedures.
4. Assist WSH Officer and committee to investigate and report on workplace incidents, accidents, and near misses.
5. Conduct daily toolbox meeting and promote a culture of safety and risk awareness.
6. Monitor and maintain safety equipment and emergency response systems.
7. Stay updated on industry best practices and regulatory changes related to workplace safety.

**Required Skills and Qualifications:**
1. Must have WSH Level B certification.
2. Understanding safety training techniques and methodologies.
3. Communication and interpersonal skills to engage with employees at all levels.
4. 1or2 years of working experience in a related field is preferred.

**Other Details:**
- Job Type: Full Time
- Work Mode: On-site
- Country: Singapore
- State: Islandwide
- Salary Range: $2000 to $4000 per month

If you are passionate about workplace safety, have a keen eye for detail, and are committed to promoting a safe work environment, we invite you to apply for the position of WSH Coordinator.

Company: FUJIFILM BUSINESS INNOVATION ASIA PACIFIC PTE. LTD.
Job Description:
Roles & Responsibilities
PURPOSE:
The Legal Counsel is to provide assigned business units with legal advice, to provide legal support to business activities and any strategic and operational matters and issues. This will include but not be limited to providing legal advice, legal support and contract review in respect of all contractual transactions (including but not limited to regional tenders, bids and all contract management related matters. The Legal Counsel shall be part of the Asia Pacific Legal Team and shall provide legal advice and support on any projects and tasks assigned by the General Counsel (General Manager Legal) or designated team leader / supervisor. These projects can include but shall not be limited to matters relating to: corporate secretariat, governance & compliance, disputes & litigation as well as investigation and intellectual property matters.
RESPONSIBILITIES & TASKS
To provide competent and sound legal advice to the Company, the FB Group and its Affiliates in a practical, efficient and timely manner.
To review/draft contracts pertaining to the business including but not limited to supplier contracts, customer contracts, inter-company contracts as well as regional tenders, bids, international sales/service transactions as well contracts with a global / multi-jurisdictional perspective.
To negotiate with external parties (including but not limited to suppliers and customers of the Company) on legal issues and work to resolve any legal related matters arising between the Company and such external parties, suppliers or customers.
To provide legal advice. legal support and work with the Company’s internal customers and stakeholders (internal functions) including but not limited to the sales/marketing department and all corporate support functions.
To coordinate and co-operate with all related organizations including FB Asia Pacific affiliates, FB Japan, FF Japan, FUJIFILM Holdings and the overall FUJIFILM Group to work on contracts, legal matters and any other matters so assigned by the General Counsel.
To raise and highlight all and any material legal issues to the supervisor / reporting manager / General Counsel and/or senior management whenever necessary.
To provide legal support, guidance and work with the Company’s affiliates and any member of the overall FUJIFILM Group whenever so instructed, assigned and/or tasked to do so by the General Counsel.
To take on any projects or tasks deemed appropriate and assigned by General Counsel. This may include but shall not be limited to projects relating to corporate secretarial matters, mergers and acquisitions, governance, compliance, regulatory, organizational structure, data privacy or any directly or indirectly legal related matters.
To succeed in this role, you will need to possess the following qualifications, skills and experiences:
2 to 3 years of working experience will be ideal
Degree in Law
Strong grasp of legal and commercial concepts
Strong language capability in English legal terminology (MUST) and Mandarin (Preferred)
Contract review/drafting skills
Legal negotiation skills
Clear and concise communication skills.
Commercial and business awareness.
Experience in having worked on complex commercial contracts and contracts on international sales / service transactions
Good grasp of timeliness and work process management
Willingness to learn and adapt to challenging and evolving work scenarios
Collaborative and harmonious spirit to work with others
Co-operative attitude and willingness to be a team player
Legal experience in working in multinational companies and contract management experience would be an asset
Broad communication skillsets and abilities to work with a variety of stakeholders. (For example: Both external and internal customers, APAC affiliates, Japan HQ, Tokyo and international affiliates for the purpose of coordination of contracts and other legal matters)
Ability to work under time pressure sensitive scenarios and to work on multiple matters, dealing with a number of internal customers concurrently
Ability to receive and take on guidance and direction and also work independently to helm various projects as and when required

Roles & Responsibilities
Frontend Software Engineer (React.JS)

Location: Central
Working Arrangement: Hybrid
Remuneration Package: Up to $6,500 + AWS + Variable Bonus

About Us:
Join our innovative team as a Frontend Software Engineer and make an impact with your ReactJS expertise. We're looking for a creative and motivated individual to drive the development of engaging user interfaces and cutting-edge applications. In this role, you'll collaborate in a vibrant environment, shaping the future of our web applications while ensuring a seamless and enjoyable user experience.

What You'll Do:
Transform Designs into Code: Convert design wireframes and visual mockups into high-quality, responsive code using HTML5, CSS3, and WebSocket.
Develop and Maintain UI Components: Build, test, and maintain dynamic user interface components with a focus on performance and cross-device compatibility.
Enhance UI/UX: Work closely with our design team to refine and enhance the user experience of our applications.
Create Reusable Code: Develop modular and reusable front-end components and libraries to streamline future projects.
API Integration: Connect with RESTful services to ensure smooth and efficient data exchange.
Collaborate Across Teams: Partner with software engineers, business analysts, and architects to design and implement web-based solutions.
Support and Maintenance: Deploy applications, provide ongoing support, and resolve any issues that arise during or after hours as needed.
Optimize Systems: Improve the efficiency of applications, systems, and databases by understanding and enhancing their interdependencies.
Continuous Improvement: Identify opportunities for process improvements and document your recommendations for team and stakeholder review.
Ensure Quality: Follow best practices for high-quality development to deliver solutions on time and to specification.
What We're Looking For:
Educational Background: Degree in Computer Science or a related field.
Experience: Proven track record in developing web applications and workflows, with a solid grasp of modern JavaScript frameworks, especially ReactJS.
Technical Skills: Proficiency in HTML5, CSS3, WebSocket, and RESTful APIs. Experience with Git for version control and knowledge of CSS pre-processors (SASS, SCSS, LESS) and bundlers (webpack).
Collaboration: Ability to work effectively in a team setting, with strong communication and problem-solving skills.
If you're passionate about frontend development and eager to work in a collaborative and forward-thinking environment, we’d love to hear from you!

Roles & Responsibilities
About InfoCepts
InfoCepts is a global leader of end-to-end data & analytics solutions with nearly 20 years of experience, also named as Gartner’s 2020, 2021 and 2022 customers’ choice for Data & Analytics providers. We continue to grow rapidly year over year, now employing more than 1,200 people in offices across the globe. As we have grown, we have stayed true to our mission—to always help our customers stay modern that help them make smart, data-driven decisions. Since 2004, we have deployed hundreds of high performance analytics applications over web and mobile platforms, built several advanced analytics models, processed petabytes of data using Big Data technologies and delivered several high impact business solutions. Driven by our vision of delivering great customer experiences, we are looking for professionals who are passionate about making the world a better place by leveraging the power of data.

Location: Central
Working Arrangement: Hybrid

Assist in the design, deployment, and management of AWS cloud infrastructure to support applications and services.

Assist with managing security best practices in AWS, including access control (IAM), encryption, and network security (Security Groups, NACLs).
Help in monitoring system performance using AWS tools like CloudWatch, identifying issues, and assisting in troubleshooting.
Support the implementation of backup, disaster recovery, and business continuity processes for cloud systems.
Assist in automating routine tasks using scripts (e.g., Bash, Python) and configuration management tools.
Work with senior engineers to troubleshoot and resolve infrastructure issues in AWS environments.
Keep up to date with AWS services and best practices, continuously improving skills and knowledge.

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent work experience).
Basic knowledge of AWS cloud services
Familiarity with cloud or virtual environments.
Basic understanding of Infrastructure-as-Code (IaC) tools like Terraform or CloudFormation.
Some experience with scripting languages such as Python, Bash, or PowerShell.
Strong desire to learn AWS cloud infrastructure and willingness to work on challenging technical problems.
Good communication skills and ability to work in a collaborative environment.

Roles & Responsibilities
Position Overview
We are seeking a motivated and experienced Partner Manager to develop and lead our partner program. As the Partner Manager, you will play a pivotal role in driving business growth by establishing and managing relationships with resellers and implementation partners. You will develop a structured partner program and build a robust partner network that aligns with our business goals.
Key Responsibilities
Develop the Partner Program:
Design and implement a comprehensive partner program, including onboarding processes, training, certifications, and incentive structures.
Define tiers, benefits, and requirements for partners to encourage engagement and growth.
Build and Manage Partner Network:
Identify, recruit, and onboard resellers and implementation partners globally or regionally.
Establish and nurture strong relationships with partners, ensuring alignment with business objectives.
Act as the primary point of contact for partners, addressing their needs, resolving issues, and facilitating collaboration.
Drive Partner Sales and Growth:
Collaborate with the sales and marketing teams to create co-marketing initiatives and campaigns for partners.
Set and monitor partner performance metrics, including sales targets and customer satisfaction levels.
Provide regular reporting and insights on partner contributions to revenue and market share.
Support Partner Enablement:
Equip partners with the tools, training, and resources needed to effectively promote and implement our software product.
Organize and oversee partner events, webinars, and workshops to ensure continuous learning and engagement.
Strategic Development and Market Analysis:
Conduct market analysis to identify opportunities and gaps in the partner ecosystem.
Develop strategies to expand partner reach in key markets and industries.
Continuously refine the partner program based on feedback and evolving business needs.
Qualifications and Experience
Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Marketing, or a related field.
Proven experience (5+ years) in partner management, channel sales, or business development within the software or IT industry.
Demonstrated success in building and scaling partner networks.
Strong understanding of reseller and implementation partner dynamics.
Excellent interpersonal, negotiation, and relationship-building skills.
Strategic thinker with strong problem-solving capabilities.
Proficiency in CRM systems and partner management tools.
Willingness to travel as required to meet with partners and attend industry events.
Why Join Us?
Opportunity to shape and lead the growth of a key business channel.
Collaborative and innovative work environment.
Professional development and career advancement opportunities.
If you are passionate about building partnerships and driving growth, we would love to hear from you!

This role involves conducting due diligence, preparing documentation, collaborating with internal teams, maintaining databases, and supporting institutional business operations. The specialist will also assist with management reporting and handle interoffice collaboration and document safekeeping.

The Job
To support the fast-growing data analytics function, we are looking for a highly talented Data Analyst. The ideal candidate will be responsible for:
Building trust, relationship between the Data Team and our business stakeholders, and being responsible to further the maturity in Analytics in the business divisions he/she supports.
Collaborating and partnering with business units and external partners to identify, plan and prioritise descriptive and prescriptive analytics projects to foster a data-centric culture that produces business impact.

Partnering with other Data Units across the organisation such as the Data Science Team, Audience Engineering, Data Programs, and Innovation Teams in order to find and drive project synergies to drive value in data and analytics in the business lines.
Contributing to data growth within the organisation by being part of infrastructural project teams and providing a point of view from business unit analytical needs.
Hands on work on chosen data analytics projects where he/she thinks he/she can most add value to the team and the business. He/she is expected to be highly independent, and to lead business intelligence and analytics projects through the entire lifecycle. The ideal candidate will possess relevant domain, technical, critical thinking and interpersonal skills.
Thought leadership in advancing SPH Media’s digital transformation and advancing the maturity of the use of data and analytics across the organisation.
The team is highly diversified with members from completely different backgrounds, but we all believe in systematic approaches and we are always open to new solutions.

General Knowledge & Experience
At least 2-5 years of experience in a Data Analyst role
A good university degree in Statistics, Engineering, Economics, Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science, Business Administration or related fields. Or relevant experience in lieu of a degree.
Exposure and understanding of digital media industry metrics is a bonus

Job Title: Operation Analyst - Trade Reporting Support (Banking  /  West /  12 month contract)
Job Description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Position Overview
T&M Operations -TMO operates as a Regional Processing Center (Hub & Spoke) supporting T&M businesses in the region. The hub and spoke model allow T&M business to scale up while remaining agile in product and service offerings in the fast, evolving market environment. As T&M business expands product offerings in the region coupled with the dynamic regulatory environment, T&M Ops leverages on this unique advantage to continue to standardize processes to manage processing risk and to facilitate automation as well as governance of service level and quality.
Staff is given opportunities to undertake Trade Reporting support role, exposure to engage with the Legal & Compliance, T&M Business and Technology, Co-create and co-partner in our continual pursuit towards compliant and accurate Regulatory Reporting obligation to major Jurisdictions e.g MAS, ASIC, MiFID, EMIR, CFTC etc

Essential Job Functions
1. Provide end to end OTC transaction life-cycle reporting support for T&M derivatives products to fulfil regulatory reporting obligation
2. Ensure Data accuracy and timely reporting
3. Ensure Risk Control, risk architecture and completeness are adhered to
4. Be Data driven, build and measure TMO Performance Service, Quality and Data Analysis via DDOM (Data Driven Operating Model) Dashboards
5. Review legacy processes and exception handling to eliminate toil in processes and cultivate FO & L&C changing behavior

Trade Repository (TR) Reporting
1. Validate on the daily TR reports being House and or Client Delegation.
2. Investigate on any discrepancies and investigation on root cause
3. Monitor the report acknowledgement and investigate for any rejected trades.
4. Review the successfully submitted report in DTCC-GTR and EOD completeness
5. Engage on the build of TR Reporting (new, revise, update)
6. Keep abreast of regulatory updates
7. Support NPA (New Product Agreement) & Lite (inclusive of PIR), review all NPAs related to TR, raise any deviations for execution, monitor till launch & signoffs
8. Support on Delegate Reporting of CFTC end to end from issuing of SLA to tagging of system and reporting obligation

Requirements:
-Qualification or experience in related field.
-Experienced in banking and financial sector preferred.
-Proficient in Microsoft Office (VBA)
-Python proficiency is a plus.

Roles & Responsibilities
Job Scope: To contribute as part of a process safety team on a proposal / project, in collaboration with different departments and process safety section, to manage Major Accident Hazards (MAHs) and prevent and mitigate Major Accident Events (MAEs) throughout the lifecycle of the facility.

Responsibilities:
Develop / Support the development and review of HSSE Design Philosophy, and other process safety-related philosophies. Provide guidance to the proposal / project for compliance to company standards, client and regulatory requirements of safetyrelated systems.
Develop / Support the development of scope of work, perform safety consultant technical bid evaluation, participate in workshops, plan, review and deliver safety studies / deliverables. Deliver complete, correct, and on-time safety studies and deliverables to the proposal / project, demonstrating risks are As Low As Reasonably Practicable (ALARP).
Organise Bow-Ties workshops, define SCEs, communicate performance standards requirements, review SCE design, manage tracking and review of EPCI assurance tasks, as instructed by the Principal Engineer, to ensure that safety critical elements are designed, procured, constructed, commissioned, and installed in accordance with performance standards for the prevention and mitigation of MAEs.
Coordinate and manage risk consultant/subcontractor to ensure the risk of the facility is properly assessed in accordance with the scope of work and methodology, in a timely manner and on budget.
Collect risk assessment input data, review risk assessments, prepare deliverables, review other discipline deliverables, and collaborate with other disciplines and departments, as instructed by the Principal Engineer or assigned engineer. Issue accurate deliverables, minimizing mistakes and maximizing efficiency. Minimise / manage deviations from company standards, client and regulatory requirements of safety-related systems.
Contribute to the achievement of Project / Engineering Performance Goals defined for the year / project.
Collaborate with the proposal / project team, consistently check deliverables for compliance, attend / support audits and resolve non-conformities to deliver a regulatory compliant installation. Minimise non-conformities and delays to first oil.
Communicate professionally with the client, provide responses to client comments, as instructed by the Principal Engineer, such that the client is satisfied that hazards are managed appropriately.
Collaborate with the project team to ensure that changes are managed in accordance with the Management of Change Procedure and their impact on risk are properly evaluated.
Identify and communicate lessons learnt for improved management of MAHs and project execution.
Ensure technical competencies are met and guide the development of process safety engineers to improve technical competency and soft skills.
Comply with Group Policy, Code of Business Conduct and Ethics at all times.
Requirements:
Minimum 7 years of relevant working experience in Process Safety engineering in the oil and gas sector for a bachelor’s degree in Chemical / Environmental / Mechanical Engineering, or minimum 6 years of relevant working experience for a master’s degree, or minimum 12 years of relevant working experience for a diploma holder.

Rachel@oneconsulting-global.sg

Product Knowledge: Stay informed about new products and services offered by [Company Name]. Participate in training and development sessions to improve your knowledge and skills.

Job Title: Wealth Planning Manager (Banking  /  Training Provided  /  Perm)
Job Description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Summary:
You have our customers’ best interests at heart. It is you they look to for counsel when making decisions about their finances, big or small. Every decision of theirs matters to you, simply because it matters to them.
You see yourself as a companion on our clients’ journeys toward achieving their life goals. Given that no journey is ever the same, you take great care (and pride!) in tailoring your financial advice to meet each client’s unique needs and requirements.
You’re self-motivated, and always on the lookout for opportunities to grow – whether it is keeping up to date with industry trends, expanding your skill set, or building your network of customers through tele-prospecting, virtual or in-person interactions and customer outreach programmes. You are knowledgeable about the banks' products and services and can recommend financial planning solutions that address your customers' needs. With such drive and tenacity, it’s no surprise that you’re consistently meeting your personal goals and targets.
Last but not the least, you’re focused on building long-term relationships with our customers. It forms the foundation to all that you do. You seize every opportunity to excite new and existing clients by bringing them investment ideas and insurance solutions to help grow their wealth and protect their futures.
Benefits and Prospect
-Attractive remuneration and a comprehensive benefits package.
-Recognition program that provides qualifying employees the opportunity to travel to exciting overseas destinations.
-Structured training and on-the-job training to help you develop the skillsets you need for a career in financial planning and wealth management.
-Job scope consist of digital capabilities that enable hybrid work, giving you the ability to work from anywhere (from the branch/office, from home, while out meeting customers).
Requirements:
-Bachelor's degree from a recognized university or a diploma from a local polytechnic
-Interested in financial planning or wealth management.
