Job Description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The role holder is responsible to serve as a HR partner to the Principals, Country Director & Management on HR-related issues for
International School under GSG in Singapore. The role holder will play a crucial role in promoting a positive work environment and
supporting the success of the organization through effective HR practices. The role holder is also responsible for aligning human resource
strategies with the goals of the company.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

Leadership
 Leads the HR function within the country for all the campuses of the school.
 Supervises, develops, and provides guidance to the HR team for all the campuses.
Functional
 Advises the Principals and Country Director on HR matters in the country for all the campuses of the school.
 Manage all HR aspects: talent attraction and selection, recruitment, onboarding, performance management and rewards, talent management and learning and development, employee engagement, offboarding and regulatory laws of Singapore.
 Oversee all work pass applications, renewals and cancellations are done on time and guide business stakeholders on MOM guidelines and changes from time to time.
 Implements initiatives, action plans, procedures, policies, and processes in the country and ensures alignment with the Group.
 Drives the corporate engagements surveys in the campuses.
 Conducts regular engagement activities in all the campuses.
 Manages the rewards program.
 Manages the performance management process in the campuses and Support the Corporate HR in the organization-wide performance management process.
 Monitors and ensures appraisals are completed in accordance with the timelines.
 Leads the normalization process for the campuses in collaboration with the managers, Principals and Country Director and shares the results with the Management.
 Ensures HR Policies are up to date and in sync with the MOM guidelines.
 Maintains in-depth knowledge of country legal requirements relating to the day-to-day management of employees.
 Ensures compliance with statutory matters, such as application for employment passes, renewal of work permits, etc.
 Manages internal and external audits along with key stakeholders by maintaining comprehensive documentation of HR processes, policies, and procedures and ensures compliance, efficiency, and effectiveness within the HR function.
Financial
 Manages operations to hit performance metrics for the HR team in the country.
 Oversee and ensure timely processing of payroll for all employees.
 Work closely with the FC and country director to set employee related budgets at the beginning of each year.
 Ensure adherence to budgets; Undertake necessary actions to ensure compliance to budgets.
Interaction and People Focus
 Works closely with the Recruitment teams and hiring managers, sharing forecasting needs and role requirements.
 Supervises the recruitment, selection, orientation, and training of employees in the campuses.
 Work closely with Corporate HR team on various strategic projects.
 Works closely with the Training team, encouraging employees on various trainings and identifying training needs in the country.
 Addresses complex employee queries relating to HR.
Maintains networks and relationships with internal and external partners at the working level to keep abreast of the current industry climate and macroeconomic trends.
Collaborates proactively with Recruitment team to continuously increase competency within teams to meet future organisations needs through the development and recruitment of talent.
JOB REQUIREMENTS
Minimum Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in business or equivalent; Preferable Postgraduate/MBA in Human Resource Management
Experience 12-15 years of experience in HR with at least 5-7 years of HR experience handling an HRBP role within Singapore, preferably in the education industry.
Experience in managing a team.
Ability to manage multiple stakeholders and work in a fast-paced and diverse environment.
Working Days: 5.5 working days.

Roles & Responsibilities
At Ichor, Procurement and Material delivery is at the heart of what we do. Our Global Supply Chain team is investing in people, processes and technology and seeking to hire a highly motivated Material Project Manager. The role will actively participate in understanding customers’ requirements and passionately drive internal procurement processes and customers’ global supply chain to exceed internal and external customer expectations. The role will drive strategic initiatives to improve the overall efficiency and profitability of Ichor Systems.

Job Duties & Key Responsibilities
For assigned products and programs execute supply chain programs that support delivery, reduce supply risk, reduce costs, and optimize cash flow
Attend production meetings and represent shortages to internal and external stakeholders.
Troubleshoots and diagnoses and resolves root causes and corrective actions for misalignments such as planning errors, unplanned demand, ECO implementation, item attribute and external supply-related constraints.
Maintain DDMRP (Demand Driven MRP) programs such as Kanban and safety stock replenishment contracts inclusive of analyzing and updating quantities, maintaining proper ERP system set-up, keeping applicable contractual liabilities and amendments current, mitigating Ichor’s liability, resolving delivery discrepancies, providing forecasts to suppliers, and ensuring suppliers are performing to contractual service levels.
Understands and can demonstrate, diagram, and measure all value-add activities in a product value chain.

Bachelor's degree in Business or Engineering preferred
With at least 5 years of relevant experience in the manufacturing industry, preferably in more than one operational discipline.
Experience working in ERP & PLM systems; Oracle, SAP and Agile preferred
Advanced Excel knowledge

Strong leader, self-motivated, proactive, detail-oriented, hands-on and results-driven.

Roles & Responsibilities
ABOUT US
Cotton On is a global fashion and lifestyle brand that’s taking the Aussie lifestyle to the world. We do things our way. Laid-back and always lived to the fullest. We look out for our mates, wherever we are.
There’s nothing that excites us more than making a positive difference in people’s lives.
We stand for diversity, empowering people of all backgrounds to express their individual style and make their mark on the world.
We deliver the trends of the moment in womenswear, menswear and accessories, and inspire our community to have fun with it.

ABOUT THE ROLE
We are seeking a Merchandise Manager who will report directly to the Head of Merchandising Asia. If you have a strategic mindset, can steer the vision forward, possess a passion for retail, and excel in overseeing stock allocation and inventory optimization to enhance sales, gross profit, and minimize dilution, along with a strong commitment to achieving business objectives, we urge you to connect with us.

Roles & Responsibilities:
Drive merchandise strategy and seasonal plans across all channels
Lead our team with a customer-centric mindset, ensuring precise stock allocation
Analyze brand and channel performance to optimize sales and profitability
Oversee the exit plan for SKUs, optimizing Open to Buy and product freshness
Provide volume forecasting and DC projections to our partners
Collaborate closely with our DC to maintain stock availability and efficient inventory flow
Conduct regular site and store visits to fine-tune inventory and identify optimization opportunities
Share insights and data trends to influence product investment decisions
Attend brand milestones to ensure alignment with merchandise strategy
Collaborate daily with VM and Retail partners to execute plans effectively
Foster team growth and development at every stage
Set clear expectations, review performance, and provide feedback using our performance framework
Uphold COG principles and cultivate a team of passionate brand ambassadors
Prioritize safety and well-being in alignment with our Safety Matters Framework.

BENEFITS
We are committed to personal and professional development, which is supported by an ever growing and expanding structure. We believe our people deserve the best space to their best work and to support this we provide:
Local and Global career growth – progress your career across our Brands within the Group
50% off Cotton On Group Brands | Cotton On, Cotton On Body, Cotton On Kids, Rubi Shoes, Typo
Wellness support 24/7 – mental health, relationships, family + more
Flexible working – enabling you to find the right working rhythm to be at your best.
Team mingle celebrations, speaker’s series, surprise and delight moments – the magic happens when we get together.

At Cotton On, we are focused on building a culture centred in belonging, and we are committed to creating workplaces where each individual can show up as their whole self, having an equal opportunity to succeed with us.

We are proud of our diverse global workforce of 20,000 team members from countless nationalities, and we strongly welcome and encourage individuals of all backgrounds to apply with us.

We are focused on bringing more voices, experiences and backgrounds to our workforce as we drive diverse and inclusive outcomes for our team and our customers.

About the Role
The Channel Partnership Manager/Director is responsible for developing, managing, and enhancing partnerships between the publishers, its clients, channel partners, and other external partners. You will be responsible for driving growth by expanding our publisher network and building robust channel partnerships. Your role will focus on identifying and managing relationships with both publishers and strategic channel partners to increase our footprint, audience, and new revenue generation. This position requires a strategic thinker with a passion for digital media, channel and collaborative business development.

Key Responsibilities:
Acquisition & Onboarding
Identify and engage high-quality publishers that align with our content standards and audience goals.
Negotiate partnership agreements, including revenue-sharing terms, performance incentives, audience sharing opportunities and strategic growth initiatives.
Collaborate with partners to define key performance indicators (KPIs), establish clear partnership goals, and align on growth strategies.
Guide partners through a streamlined onboarding process, ensuring compliance, engagement standards and contractual requirements.

Management & Growth
Manage and nurture relationships with channel partners, acting as the primary point of contact to foster long-term collaboration.
Develop and implement joint business plans with each channel partner to ensure alignment on objectives, deliverables, and performance benchmarks.
Regularly evaluate partnership performance and identify optimization opportunities, ensuring each partnership delivers maximum impact.

Performance Tracking & Optimization
Establish and monitor KPIs to assess the performance of channel partnerships, focusing on audience reach, engagement rates, and revenue.
Use analytics and reporting to provide actionable insights, suggesting strategic changes to improve partner and network performance.
Share performance metrics and reports with channel partners, fostering transparency and a data-driven approach to ongoing improvements.

Market Analysis & Strategic Growth
Conduct regular industry and competitive analysis to stay current on trends, channel partnership models, and emerging platforms.
Identify new partnership opportunities and innovative growth channels based on evolving market needs and business behaviors.
Advocate for new partnership models within the company, sharing insights and recommendations with leadership.

Collaboration and Coordination
Work closely with marketing, sales, and product teams to ensure agency partnership and channel initiatives are well-coordinated.
Facilitate cross-functional collaboration to maximize the value of partnerships.

Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Marketing, Communications, or a related field.
Minimum of 5 years of experience in partnership development, business development, or a related role.
Proven track record of successfully managing and growing agency and channel partnerships.
Familiarity with ad tech, digital publisher, and digital marketing platforms.

Skills and Competencies
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Strong negotiation and contract management abilities.
Strategic thinking and problem-solving skills.
Ability to analyze data and generate actionable insights.
Proficiency in using CRM software and other relevant tools.
Strong organizational and project management skills.
Adaptability and flexibility in a fast-paced environment.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

About the Role
This position is part of a dynamic team, reporting to the Head of Ad Products.

The Digital Development Manager will be responsible for planning and executing audience-centric initiatives across digital touch-points through direct and programmatic channels to support digital revenue growth and deliver audience-solutions that excite our clients.

Your success means being able to increase the adoption of SPH Media’s audience-solutions among our advertisers. This will also require a basic understanding of audience / contextual targeting, audience cohorts, brand safety, IVT, programmatic advertising, ad-servers/ DSPs and digital campaign reporting

Key Responsibilities
Identify opportunities to create new audience segments that will increase adoption of first-party audience-solutions among our advertisers. Define the segmentation logic for the same.
Build digital first-party audience segments on Data Management Platform (DMP) partner and Contextual Targeting platforms in adherence to planned taxonomy, brand safety, and ensure their operational availability on all associated platforms (e.g. Point of sale, Ad server, CDP etc).
Closely monitor the scaling, inventory, and performance of all audiences and update periodically both to reporting manager and to stakeholders from Ad Operations and Ad Sales teams.
Report the usage of first-party audiences on a monthly basis to the Ad Products team, to Billing and Finance team for invoicing purposes, and to different Product teams for audience revenue recognition.
Create, maintain and automate reports on audience trends, inventory and performance across digital campaigns for sharing with our advertisers as well as internal stakeholders. Maintain digital performance benchmarks for targeted digital campaigns across different industries.
Be the custodian of the brand-safety guidelines for digital ad campaigns to ensure that our advertisers’ ads do not appear in a negative context. Align with the Sales team to create and maintain brand safety filters for ads from different industries and products, and work closely with the Ad Operations team to ensure correct usage of filters. Review and update the filters as required.
Support sales in audience built and recommendation for audience campaign
Stakeholder management: Work with existing and new partners, vendors to support the Ad Products team’s pilot assignments. Work an ongoing basis with internal Ad Operations, Ad Sales, Data, Tech, Product and Editorial teams.
Develop new audience related product(s) or packages.
Job Requirements
2+ years hands-on experience in digital ad-operations or in digital media agency or publisher operations.
Understanding of digital marketing concepts such as ad formats, page traffic, inventory, impressions, CPM, CPC, CPA, re-targeting, look-alike audiences, events tags
Familiar with ad servers and digital platforms (One or more of these : GAM360, GA360, DSPs, SSPs or DMPs)
Knowledge of digital campaign management workflows
Preferably exposure to Tableau, Datorama reporting, or other reporting and analytics tools.
Strong organizational skills and ability to be highly collaborative

Roles & Responsibilities
We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced Retail Store Area Manager to oversee multiple retail locations within a designated geographic area. The ideal candidate will be responsible for driving sales, managing store operations, and ensuring a high level of customer service and satisfaction.

Key responsibilities include:
- Developing and implementing strategies to increase sales and profitability across all stores in the area
- Monitoring and analyzing sales performance, inventory levels, and operational metrics to identify areas for improvement
- Setting goals and targets for individual store managers and providing coaching and support to help them achieve their objectives
- Conducting regular store visits to ensure compliance with company policies and procedures, as well as high standards of customer service
- Recruiting, training, and developing store managers and staff to create a high-performing team
- Collaborating with cross-functional teams, such as marketing, merchandising, and finance, to drive business initiatives and promotions
- Managing budgets and expenses for the area, ensuring cost-effective operations and maximizing profitability
- Handling escalated customer complaints and resolving issues in a timely and professional manner

Qualifications:
- Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Retail Management, or related field
- 5+ years of experience in retail management, with a proven track record of success in driving sales and profitability
- Strong leadership and communication skills, with the ability to motivate and inspire a team
- Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities, with a strategic mindset
- Proficiency in Microsoft Office and retail management software
- Willingness to travel within the assigned area and work flexible hours as needed
If you are a results-driven leader with a passion for retail and a desire to make a positive impact on a growing organization, we want to hear from you. Join our team as a Retail Store Area Manager and help us achieve our business goals!

Roles & Responsibilities
InfoCepts is a global leader of end-to-end data & analytics solutions with nearly 20 years of experience, also named as Gartner’s 2020, 2021 and 2022 customers’ choice for Data & Analytics providers. We continue to grow rapidly year over year, now employing more than 1,200 people in offices across the globe. As we have grown, we have stayed true to our mission—to always help our customers stay modern that help them make smart, data-driven decisions. Since 2004, we have deployed hundreds of high performance analytics applications over web and mobile platforms, built several advanced analytics models, processed petabytes of data using Big Data technologies and delivered several high impact business solutions. Driven by our vision of delivering great customer experiences, we are looking for professionals who are passionate about making the world a better place by leveraging the power of data.

We are hiring aspiring / proven data engineers to join us. We provide extensive training, bootcamps/on-the-job to prepare qualified candidates for an exciting career in Data Analytics in Government and Public Sector.

Location: Boon Lay
Work Arrangement: 4 days week WFO (Flexible Hours)

What is a Data Engineer?

The role of a data engineer can be defined as someone who has the knowledge and skills to design and build systems for collecting, storing and analyzing data at scale.

Roles and Responsibilities:
Work closely with the project team to develop and validate the data engineering applications
Drive the maintenance of data engineering pipelines
Implement data engineering pipelines as per business needs and technical specifications provided by stakeholders and work closely with the data engineering team to ETL the required data from source systems into datastore
Develop ETL jobs i.e. workflow packages, auto schedulers, in Informatica PowerCenter as per specifications and requirements
Monitor and ensure ETL jobs are successfully executed and handle troubleshooting of any related technical problems on-site
Skills Required:
A successful data engineer needs to have a combination of technical as well leadership skills. A background in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Information Management can serve as a solid foundation to build your career as a data engineer.
1 to 2 years of ETL experience
Strong proficiency in Python and SQL scripting skill
Prior experience with ETL operations using at least one other ETL software such as SSIS, Informatica and/or Talend is a major advantage
Knowledge of creating ETL packages and configuring workflows
Knowledge of at least one database tool such as MySQL, MS SQL and/or PostgreSQL
Adept at queries with good communication and stakeholder management skill

Roles & Responsibilities
Job Scope:
The main responsibilities of this position are to manage organisation and regional financial activities
Plan and implement measures to streamline and strengthen financial transaction processes in the AP region
Provide support for business investments in the Asia Pacific (AP) region as a financial expert
Develop advanced trade finance useful for business activities, and pursue a more advanced ALM system as the financial centre of the AP region.

Experience in Finance , from Bank, international trading firms or Treasury centre for more than 5 years

Process Engineer (Biologics) - Job Scope
The successful candidate will apply process engineering knowledge to support new product/process introduction and/or commercial protein biologics processes. Scope of work would include:
Data Analysis:
Compile and analyze process data using tools such as Excel and Minitab.
Verify data in technical reports and spreadsheets.
Process Optimization:
Consolidate and compare cell culture and purification process manufacturing practices for the purpose of facility fit and identification of areas for optimization and alignment across manufacturing sites.
Cross-functional Collaboration:
Participate in teams and collaborate cross-functionally with representatives from other functions and sites to support drug substance manufacturing process alignment.
Meetings and Presentations:
Organize and conduct meetings, actively creating, generating, and presenting data/conclusions at internal and cross-functional meetings.
Technical Documentation:
Support authoring of technical protocols and reports.
Lab Support:
Support small-scale cell culture or purification studies while ensuring safe operation of process development (PD) activities in the laboratory.
Qualifications
Educational Background:Degree in Chemical Engineering, Bioprocess Engineering, or Biochemistry.
Skills:Possess a basic understanding of biologics and chemical engineering principles.
Demonstrates independent motivation but also works well in a team environment.
Exhibits excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Job Title: *Entry Level* IT QA Engineer | Whitebox | Java
Job Description:
Roles & Responsibilities
*Entry Level* Quality Assurance Engineer | Java | Whitebox

Working Hours: Monday - Friday (Hybrid)
Working Location: Central
Remuneration Package: Up to $4,000 + AWS + Performance Bonus

Join our team as a Quality Assurance Engineer (Whitebox) where you'll play a critical role in ensuring the quality and reliability of our software products. Collaborate closely with development and project management teams, create comprehensive test plans, execute automated scripts, and track bugs to drive continuous improvement.

Responsibilities:
Review requirements, specifications, and technical design documents to provide timely and meaningful feedback.

Requirements:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field.
Good to have experience software quality assurance with strong knowledge of QA methodologies, tools, and processes.
Good to have experience in writing clear, concise, and comprehensive test plans and test cases.
Familiarity with Agile/Scrum development processes.
Good to have hands-on experience with both white box and black box testing is a plus.

Roles & Responsibilities
The Senior Officer, Security is responsible for protecting assigned premises, assets, and personnel. He is expected to detect and deter potential threats. His duties include performing access control, conducting security screening, attending to enquiries from stakeholders, patrolling and guarding premises, and loss prevention of guest/company assets as well as managing incidents and emergencies.

He may be required to work in rotating shifts and must be physically fit. He is expected to be vigilant, decisive, and possess effective communication skills. He must be well-groomed and pleasant when interacting with stakeholders.

Job Description
Perform access security functions
- Attend to enquiries a from guests
- Conduct security screening of visitors, property, or vehicle
- Authorise and facilitate access to property
- Arrange security rosters and duty posts to ensure all access point are being taken care of
- Assist in the manning of the Fire Command Centre

Detect security threats

- Conduct security patrols in premises
- Guard premises
- Handling of suspicious persons or items or cases
- Noted and report irregularities

Manage incidents
- Assist authorities and management in enforcement

Team mentorship
- Guide junior loss prevention officers and support them to achieve their targets

Roles & Responsibilities
Position Overview:
The Compliance Executive will be responsible for providing support to the Head of Infrastructure Operations, Sustainability and Compliance in the following areas: Standards Set-up, Document Control & Management, Data Analysis, Training Support, Internal Audits, Regulatory Research & Stakeholders Engagement.
Key Responsibilities:
Standards set-up: Assist in establishing, monitoring and ensuring compliance with ISO standards (e.g. ISO 9001, ISO 14001) and sustainability regulations.
Document Control & Management: Help to maintain and organize compliance documentation (i.e. policies, procedures, and audit reports).
Data Analysis: Analyze compliance metrics and sustainability initiatives data and help to develop reports for management review.
Training Support: Assist in the development and delivery of training programs on compliance and sustainability topics for employees.
Internal Audits: Support the planning and execution of internal audits to assess compliance with ISO standards and sustainability practices.
Regulatory Research: Conduct regular research on changes in relevant laws and regulations and assist in updating company policies accordingly.
Stakeholder Engagement: Collaborate with various departments to promote compliance culture and sustainability initiatives across the organization.

Key Requirements
Bachelor’s Degree in Environmental Science/Business/any other related field.
Advanced knowledge of ISO standards and sustainability practices.
Relevant certifications (e.g., ISO 9001, ISO 14001, ISO45001, LEED or EcoVadis) is a plus.
Previous experience in compliance, quality assurance, or sustainability roles is highly desirable.
Attention to detail; Strong analytical, organizational and problem-solving skills.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint).
Preferably to be able to start on short notice.

Roles & Responsibilities
About Us
SPH Media’s mission is to be the trusted source of news and lifestyle content in Singapore and Asia.
One of our core purposes is to produce credible, balanced, and objective news and analysis, always with a view to uphold the public good and fostering an informed, engaged citizenry.
We welcome talented individuals to join us and grow a career in a vibrant and collaborative environment built around a culture of respect and inclusivity.
As an employer, we are committed to rewarding our people fairly and developing them in their careers.

About the Role
Started in 1935, Tamil Murasu is Singapore's only Tamil language newspaper. Tamil Murasu is the main information source for the Tamil-speaking Indian community with its coverage of wide-ranging news, from current affairs to local and foreign news as well as the latest in sports and entertainment, in addition to its strong coverage on news from the Indian community and the sub-continent. The newspaper has established itself as a voice for the Tamil-speaking community in Singapore.
As a Video/Photojournalist, you would be required to shoot stills and videos for our multimedia platforms. You will come up with concepts and produce videos for web and mobile platforms, and also capture newsworthy events and people through the lens to make news reports more interesting. You may be expected to present or do voice overs in the videos they produce.

Your responsibilities include but are not limited to:
Collaborate with journalists and/or alone on news content assignments
Conceptualize, write script and produce videos
Post and manage all videos for publication on various media platforms, including social media.
Shoot and edit videos and photos
Job Requirements
Relevant Diploma or Degree in Marketing, Communications, Advertising, Video Production, Journalism, or any relevant fields
At least two years of relevant experience.
Ability to set up, light, write, shoot, appear as host and produce video packages.
Proficient in Adobe Premiere Pro, Adobe After Effects, Photoshop and Illustrator
Demonstrates ability to work collaboratively with various stakeholders.
Ability to produce quality work in a fast paced environment.
Well-organised and a self-starter, capable of managing multiple projects.
Experience in social media platforms and management systems
Effectively bilingual (English/Tamil) to be able to cater to the Tamil Murasu audience.
Willingness to work on weekends/public holidays

Roles & Responsibilities
A newspaper for the local Malay community, Berita Harian was established on July 1, 1957. It presents news and issues from home, the region and the world, featuring a wide spectrum of topics from sports to politics and religion. Other highlights include Malay culture and tradition, arts and heritage, family, hobbies and leisure. Berita Harian (BH) also provides a platform for the Malay community to voice their views on issues that concern them. It is a paper that speaks with authority and understands the needs of the Malay community.

About the Role
As a Video Journalist for Berita Harian, your primary role will be to execute the technical requirements for producing engaging video content. Your primary role is to film and edit creative visual content produced by journalists and social media producers. You will strategically craft video content from news packages and short-form vertical videos for news, current affairs, and sociocultural stories. Your secondary role is to produce your own content or co-produce content with journalists and social media producers.

Job Responsibilities
Plan, set up and execute media production work including videography, video editing and media production for social media, as well as conduct video shoots, and live-stream events.
Execute video production according to script and visual concept -duties include transcribing, scripting, filming, editing, producing and uploading content.
Craft creative video content for target audiences, and experiment with concepts and formats.
Stay on top of the latest news, audience and content trends.
Use data analytics to optimise video projects
As a secondary role, create your own video content and/or collaborate with journalists in the wider newsroom and cross-functional teams to develop video projects.

Job Requirements
Minimum diploma in Film and Video and Mass Communications or equivalent from a recognised institution
Highly creative and, meticulous, with high personal standards, ownership in his/her projects.
Have a track record in videography and editing, especially in social media.
Able to film with different devices, including mobile phones and cameras.
Proficient in editing software under Adobe Creative Cloud (i.e. Premiere Pro, After Effects, Photoshop) and other software like Canva and CapCut.
Positive attitude, detail and audience-oriented with good multitasking and organisational ability
Able to prioritize, multitask and work under tight deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
Ability to work independently with minimal supervision and as part of a team.
At least 2 years of relevant experience in video production
Effectively bilingual in English and Malay
Willingness to work on weekends/public holidays when required
This is a temporary contract position till March 2026.

Job Title: HR Business Partner (SEA) (Perm /  Hybrid /  Up to 7K)
Job Description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Purpose
We are seeking a dynamic HR Business Partner (SEA) to support our Marine business units across Singapore, Taiwan, Malaysia and Australia. In this strategic role, you will collaborate closely with key stakeholders in the SEA region, acting as a vital bridge between the Marine business segment and the HR function. Your focus will be on aligning HR initiatives with overall business objectives while driving organizational effectiveness, talent management, employee engagement and HR process improvements tailored specifically to the Marine entities in SEA.
HRBP
Partner with Marine business leaders in Southeast Asia to develop and implement HR strategies, programs, and initiatives that support business objectives and drive organizational growth in the Marine industry.
Provide coaching and guidance to the managers on a range of HR matters including performance management, employee relations, talent development, and succession planning specifically within the Marine industry.
Drive the talent acquisition process for Marine positions, partnering with recruitment teams to attract, assess, and select top talent with expertise in the Marine industry.
Collaborate with HR Centers of Excellence (CoEs) to ensure effective delivery of HR services specifically tailored for the Marine industry, including compensation and benefits, learning and development, and employee engagement.
Analyze HR metrics and trends within the Marine industry to identify areas for improvement and develop action plans to address them.
Lead change management initiatives within the entities to support organizational transformation and ensure smooth implementation of HR programs in the Marine entities in SEA.
Stay updated on HR best practices, legal requirements, and industry trends within the Marine industry to ensure compliance and drive continuous improvement specifically for the Marine business units in Southeast Asia
HR Operations
To boost onboarding employee experience and maintain high level of motivation of a new join. You will be accountable for onboarding process, as well coordination of orientation/new join training plan. This includes liaising with internal stakeholder to refresh information on orientation slides.
Application, maintenance, and termination of employees’ medical insurance.
Yearly renewal of employee benefit insurance and WICA
Responsible for monthly payroll of various entities in SEA (dealing with payroll vendors to ensure staff is paid correctly and on time)
Requirements
Bachelor's degree in HR management, business administration, or a related field. Master's degree is a plus.
Proven experience as an HR Business Partner or similar role, preferably in the Marine industry or related maritime sectors within SEA.
In-depth knowledge of HR principles, practices, and employment laws in Southeast Asia.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to build strong relationships at all levels of the organization
Demonstrated ability to influence and collaborate with stakeholders to drive change and achieve results.
Analytical mindset with the ability to use data and metrics specific to drive decision-making and measure the impact of HR initiatives.
Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to think strategically and propose creative solutions
Ability to handle sensitive and confidential information with professionalism and discretion
Willingness to travel within Southeast Asia as required to support the Marine business
To submit your application:
Interested candidates please submit your resume to belinda.ho@rmagroup.com.sg stating your availability, expected salary and reason(s) for leaving. We respect your privacy and all communication will be treated with confidentiality. We regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Roles & Responsibilities
About SBI Singapore
State Bank of India has been playing a major role in fulfilling the global aspirations of Indian corporations through its 235 foreign offices in 29 countries across the world. Our Singapore operations were set up in 1977 with an offshore banking license, equipping us with over four decades of experience in commercial and wholesale banking.
SBI Singapore achieved its Full Bank status with QFB privileges in the year 2008. With the grant of Full Bank status with QFB privileges. SBI Singapore now has 5 retail branches, 19 SBI ATMs and over 200 ATMs via the shared island wide ATM5 network. SBI has a suite of retail banking products which complement its existing corporate banking products thus enabling us to service both individual and corporate customers. SBI Singapore is now a member of FAST payment network facilitating instantaneous SGD fund transfer among the participating member Banks.
About the Role:
Sales & Advisory
Market a range of retail banking and investment products.
Upsell and cross-sell the Bank's suite of products and services.
Offer advisory service recommending suitable wealth management products for potential customers.

Supporting, contributing, promoting and driving technology initiatives like Internet applications, mobile applications, etc towards promoting customer convenience and service excellence
Customer Relationship Management

To act as a single point of contact for all customers under handling.
Operational Efficiency
Be responsible for 100% accuracy on the various forms submitted to Operations or to Partners for execution.
Jointly responsible for the up keep of the branch aesthetics as per the Corporate Identity guidelines.
You will need to have:
Bachelor's Degree or equivalent; preferably in Banking, Insurance & Financial Services
Minimum of 1-2 years of experience in sales and financial products and services.
CMFAS certified required - M5, M8, M8A, M9, M9A, HI, BCP, PGI.
Excellent customer focused mindset and strong interpersonal skills.
Sound knowledge of banking, wealth management and insurance products
Strong understanding of financial compliance and regulatory requirements in Singapore.

Competitive salary with performance-based commission
Continuous learning and professional growth opportunities.
Comprehensive medical coverage

Employee engagement activities

Roles & Responsibilities
The Senior Officer, Security is responsible for protecting assigned premises, assets, and personnel. He is expected to detect and deter potential threats. His duties include performing access control, conducting security screening, attending to enquiries from stakeholders, patrolling and guarding premises, and loss prevention of guest/company assets as well as managing incidents and emergencies.

He may be required to work in rotating shifts and must be physically fit. He is expected to be vigilant, decisive, and possess effective communication skills. He must be well-groomed and pleasant when interacting with stakeholders.

Job Description
Perform access security functions
- Attend to enquiries a from guests
- Conduct security screening of visitors, property, or vehicle
- Authorise and facilitate access to property
- Arrange security rosters and duty posts to ensure all access point are being taken care of
- Assist in the manning of the Fire Command Centre

Detect security threats
- Regulate crowd and traffic in property
- Conduct security patrols in premises
- Guard premises
- Handling of suspicious persons or items or cases

Roles & Responsibilities
We are seeking a meticulous and well-organized Logistics and Warehouse Assistant to join our team. The ideal candidate will assist in managing all aspects of logistics and warehouse operations, ensuring the efficient flow of goods.

Collaboration: Work closely with the other departments, particularly finance department, to ensure cohesive and streamlined operations.
Job Requirements:
Minimum GCE ‘N’ level qualification or equivalent.
Willingness to work beyond standard office hours, including rotating shifts, in a fast-paced, non-air-conditioned warehouse environment.
Must hold a valid class 3 license or above.
Previous experience in a warehouse or logistics setting is advantageous.
Willingness to work as part of a team.
Basic PC knowledge (e.g. Microsoft Office) and the ability to communicate with email.
Experience with the Microsoft Navision system is a bonus.
Proficiency in Mandarin would be beneficial for liaising with associates.

In this role, you will be responsible for providing strategic leadership in particular HR policy formulation, execution and review for the company and will closely coordinate and work with your stakeholders to reduce our manpower turnover rate, improving staff retention rate, reducing cost per hire and most importantly making sure all our outlets staffs are well trained in their jobs to perform their duties up to Takagi Ramen's high standards.

- Handle and administer the company's yearly insurance renewal

Job Responsibilities

• Help manage the day-to-day operations of the Housekeeping Rooms & Suites.

• Be proactive in safety and accident prevention. Ensure that all Team Members are adequately trained in the use of housekeeping cleaning and sanitizing chemicals as well as lifting techniques and other potentially hazardous parts of their daily work
• Ensure a clean, safe and pleasing environment for all Guests and Team Members
• Help manage operating costs, especially labour, productivity and operating supply consumption
• Help develop and implement clear, detailed training programs which match the needs of Team Members with a wide range of skills, languages and cultures
• Supervise, train, schedule, mentor, develop and evaluate Team Members
• Ensure all tasks are performed on time and according to safety standards
• Help monitor consumption and wastage of : equipment; guest supplies: cleaning supplies: and linen supplies
• Help ensure that linen and operating supplies are available in sufficient quantities, while minimizing the value of stock on hand
• Recommend the timely replacement of guest room and suite supplies and equipment
• Participate in research, development, evaluation and implementation of new products, services, technology and processes in anticipation of changing customer needs
• Maintain close liaison with all other Departments so that their Housekeeping operational needs are met by the Department
• Help manage periodic cleaning programs
• Conducts bi-annual and annual Performance Appraisals providing honest and appropriate feedback
• Ensures that team members are always fairly treated without favour or unfair expectations
• Ensures that team members are fairly and professionally rostered and are allocated work assignments which are appropriate for their rank and capability to meet the demands expected
• Ensures high standard of personal presentation and grooming, acting as positive role model
• Perform all duties in accordance with Marina Bay Sands policies and within the realm of the Marina Bay Sands Company vision, mission and values

Core Leadership Competencies
• Change Management – Generates activity and seeks new challenges to improve work performance. Demonstrates an optimistic outlook and recovers quickly from failure
• Decision Making – Makes sound decisions quickly under pressure. Takes calculated risks based on adequate information and analysis. Makes rational, balanced judgments on the basis of available information
• Managing the Work of others – Works with an orientation to the future. Sets clear, appropriate, and well defined, quality objectives. Encourages others to comply with legal and personal obligations. Plans while taking into account change and possible difficulties. Provides teams with clear direction and keeps them focused on tasks. Actively supports autonomy and empowerment through appropriate delegation of work. Sees projects through to completion; ensures key objectives are met
• Motivating and Influencing Others – Creates a climate of teamwork by encouraging harmony, co-operation and communication. Cares for others by monitoring their well-being; Inspires a positive attitude to work among subordinates and persuades others so that they can adjust their positions and readily gains agreement and support from others. Respects the contributions of others
• People Development – Encourages a culture of continuous personal and worked-related improvement through own actions and ensures learning from successes and failures. Guides and coaches team members. Passes on personal expertise and draws on the diverse backgrounds, skills and knowledge of people while defining and reinforcing standards and appropriate behaviour
• Problem Solving – Reconciles conflict and probes for information for more in-depth relevant information for decision-making. Analyses numerical data and relevant sources of information in order to draw appropriate conclusions and check facts to establish causes and effects. Produces new ideas and a range of solutions to meet the demands of the situation
• Time and Task Management – Manages time effectively and shows punctuality; completes tasks on time; structures work activities in a systematic way; respects and follows company policies; shows organizational commitment; ensures safety at the workplace. Shows receptiveness to being managed and co-operates willingly; demonstrates detailed job knowledge, manual ability and technical expertise in one’s own area
• Integrity – Acts consistently in accordance with clear ethics and values and models high standards of behaviour for others through one's own actions; maintains confidentiality and upholds agreements made with others; able to relate to people from different cultures; and maintains a balance between work and personal life so neither affects the other negativ

Job Description:
To assist the Project Manager in the daily execution of work including manpower deployment, materials on-site and work schedules.
Liaise with consultants, sub-contractors on day-to-day operations and technical issues
Responsible for all trades of works on-site, including structural, architectural, building, M&E etc
Ensure good quality of work and manage defect rectifications.
Ensure work is done in compliance with design, specifications, safety requirements and related local statutory regulations.

Roles & Responsibilities
SPECIFIC DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES
The Maintenance Supervisor is responsible to assist the Chief Engineer / Assistant Chief Engineer in the operation and maintenance of the building to ensure a high standard of upkeep and maintenance to the satisfaction of the building owner and guests / tenants.
To assist the Chief Engineer / Assistant Chief Engineer to carry alteration and addition works, major replacement of equipments, tenancy works of the building, etc, as may be required from time to time to meet the needs that have arisen.
This role reports directly to the Chief Engineer/ Assistant Chief Engineer/ Duty Engineer
Assist the Chief Engineer/Assistant Chief Engineer to executive preventive & corrective maintenance and restoration work as instructed.
To supervise all repairs and maintenance work as requested by the superior. Ensure that work is carried out safely, efficiently and with minimum disruption to Hotel guests and tenant of Hotel.
Liaise with other departments of the Hotel and shop tenants in providing engineering support.
Lead and provide guidance and hand-on training to all maintenance staff.
The ability to multi-task and prioritize work effectively is required.
Monitor junior staff performance and personal attitude
Ensure smooth supply of electricity, water and air-conditioning and lift in the building.
Distribute daily work to the junior maintenance staff, and monitor and completion of work.
Report all irregular incidents and faults to the immediate superior.
Ensure completion of all work orders received during his shift duty.
To maintain a proper personal grooming, smile and greeting to hotel guests and tenant.
Assist superior in troubleshoot and rectification in all engineering faults and defects.
Liaise and assist any contractor in any work done within the building.
Respond appropriately to emergencies or urgent issues as they arise such as fire emergency, power blackout and bursting of water pipe etc.
Co-ordinate and supervise all works carried out by the contractors and consultants within the building.
Any other duties which may be assigned from time to time by the Management.
Job requirements
Candidate must possess at least Nitec or Higher Nitec in Electrical, Mechanical or Building Services or equivalent.
Preferably with minimum 3 years of Supervisor experience in Engineering related industries or 5 years as a Senior Technician in Engineering or related industries.
Able to use Microsoft Word, Excel of computer for preparing reports
Possess skills in maintaining, troubleshooting and repairing of building equipment
Good communication skills (verbal and written), able to resolve any conflicts.
Good coaching skill, ability to lead the junior maintenance staff.
Willingness to learn and work as a team member
Possess high level of integrity and respect for others
Able to withstand huge pressure and stress towards work
Outgoing personality
Responsible to his work, hardworking, good initiative with cost saving in mind
Self-confident, self esteem
Good problem solving skills necessary
Able to put in long hours when required and 24 hours standby for any technical problem occurring
*We regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Roles & Responsibilities
This role will engage directly with customers to understand their requirements and will drive internal procurement processes & global supply chain operations to exceed both internal & external expectations. The position will lead strategic initiatives focused on enhancing efficiency and profitability at Ichor Systems, ensuring all deliverables meet customer needs.

Job Duties & Key Responsibilities
Implement supply chain strategies for assigned products and programs to support delivery, reduce supply risk, reduce costs, and optimize cash flow.
Attend production meetings and communicate shortage updates to internal and external stakeholders.
Identify, troubleshoot and resolve root causes of issues such as planning errors, unexpected demand, Engineering Change Order (ECO) implementations, supply constraints.
Maintain DDMRP (Demand Driven MRP) programs such as Kanban and safety stock replenishment, including quantity analysis, ERP system updates, contract maintenance, and forecast communication with suppliers, ensuring compliance with service levels and mitigating liabilities.
Demonstrate a comprehensive understanding of all value-added activities within a product's value chain, including diagramming and measurement.

Job Requirements
Degree in Procurement and Supply Chain Management or related. Fresh graduate are welcome to apply.
About 1-2 years of Planning experience in semiconductor or similar manufacturing industries would be preferred
Strong problem-solving skills, with the ability to work independently and perform well under pressure in a dynamic environment.
Proficient in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint, with additional knowledge of Visual Basic (VB) and Power BI is an added advantage.
Good interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills, capable of clearly escalating issues and requirements to suppliers, stakeholders, and team members.
Ability to influence cross-functional teams, including technical decision-makers, with a strong understanding of purchasing, supplier selection, cost analysis, and negotiation

Roles & Responsibilities
1 year renewable
Central area - Clarke Quay
Monday - Friday, office hours
Handle mailbox survey submissions, feedback, and requests from survey respondents within stipulated turnaround time.
Ensure consistent and detail cases notes updated in system after each liaison with respondents.
Responsible for inter-department liaison for correct assignment of respondents to the parties responsible.
Ensure prompt follow-up for survey cases under pending status.
Provides accurate daily report on mailboxes activities for the day to relevant stakeholders.
Ensuring all potential/actual complains are acted upon within stipulate timeline.

Roles & Responsibilities
Job Scope:
Ensure the execution and completion of electrical and instrumentation tasks in full compliance with current Good Manufacturing Practices (cGMP), Safety, Health and Environment (SHE) and Quality policies and standards.

Key Responsibilities
· Perform tasks as defined per the Maintenance Work Orders
· Perform troubleshooting through logical thinking process.
· Knowledge in Maintenance and Calibration Processes and Standards.
· Some knowledge in utilities system such as DI System, HVAC System, Boiler System, HVAC and Process Chiller System, Cooling Tower System, Compressor/ Compressed Air System, Clean Steam Process, and Cold room.
· Knowledge in Analytical and Laboratory Instrumentation.
· Participate in Root Cause Analyses and follow up on all corrective actions and preventive actions.
· Troubleshoot to resolve electrical and instrument problems, repair, calibration and return to service with minimal downtime.
· Comply with all Safety, Health & Environmental (SHE) requirements,
· Provide support to manufacturing and utility during routine and shutdown maintenance work; and product switch over in support of plant operations.

Qualifications
· Min Diploma/Higher NITEC in Electrical, Instrumentation Engineering or equivalent background in instrument calibration and electrical.
· 1-2 years related experience on electrical and calibration, preferably from pharmaceutical or chemical manufacturing environment.
· Team player, attention to details, accurate and thorough.
· Ability to read and comprehend instrumentation wiring, pneumatic and hydraulic schematic diagrams.

Roles & Responsibilities
We are searching for a UI/UX Designer to join our dynamic team to create engaging and on-brand graphics, contributing to the design and development of impactful software applications.
Competitive remuneration package. (Up to $5,000 + AWS + up to 3 months VB)
Hybrid working arrangement.
Embark on a journey of digital innovation and user-centric design, where your creativity is valued.

Responsibilities:
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to translate wireframes and prototypes into visually stunning and functional user interfaces.
Develop graphics, illustrations, logos and user interface elements (e.g. navigation, tabs and widgets) using Adobe Creative Suite.
Direct the planning and implementation of visual design strategies for digital products, ensuring a unified and aesthetically pleasing user interface on both web and mobile platforms, consistent with service standards and design guidelines.
Design and create concepts, mockups, prototypes and user journey that lead to intuitive user experiences for a wide range of platforms.
Promote user-centered design principles and align visual design with usability and accessibility standards.
Strategically create new features and functionality based on user stories and behavior.
Gather and evaluate user requirements in collaboration with product managers and engineers.
Identify, and troubleshoot UX problems and conduct layout adjustments based on user feedback.

Requirements:
Singaporean only.
Proven experience of at least 2 years as a Digital Designer, Visual UI Designer, Graphic Designer or similar role.
Bilingual in English and Mandarin to handle Mandarin-speaking clients.
Proficiency in design tools such as Adobe Creative Suite, Sketch, Figma, or similar applications.
Have a strong portfolio of shipped showcasing your graphic, web, UI or dashboard designs.
Strong knowledge of design systems, responsive design, and mobile-first design principles, committed to delivering accessible and inclusive digital experiences for diverse user groups.
Prior experience in FinTech industry/projects will be an added advantage.

Ensure the smooth operation of test environments and supporting software development, testing, and project teams. Your key responsibilities will include:
· Managing day-to-day UAT (User Acceptance Testing) environment operations and tasks.
· Providing application and test support to the software development team.

· MSMQ messaging service.
· Demonstrated proficiency in scripting, including mandatory expertise in PowerShell and Windows Batch scripting, with VB scripting considered advantageous.
· Programming proficiency in at least one language is an advantage.
· Additional scripting/programming skills are advantageous.

Roles & Responsibilities
Job Highlights
Well versed in ISO 9001, QA metholodogies & tools
Scope to innovate & develop continuous improvement processes
Job Description
Develop & implement QMS system & take the lead of continuous improvement process & initiatives
Provide root cause analysis & preventive action plans to resolve non-compliance issues
Analyze internal & external data to identify areas for improvement & communicate with relevant parties for quality improvements
Ensure the compliance with ISO 9001 & all relevant standards to both internal company policies & customer standards
Maintains and implements the Quality Management System (QMS) for the organization.
Manages Quality Assurance and Quality Control (QA&QC) by conducting audits for quality system conformance, and by liaising across departments to maintain good documentation control and management.
Conducts investigations into inconsistent quality processes and non-conformance and recommends preventive actions to eliminate recurrences of such issues.
Monitors product failure data and performance trends, and initiates remedial actions with relevant departments, where necessary.
Identifies opportunities and prepares recommendations for continuous improvement in quality, productivity and cost efficiency.
Handle Customer Complaint resolution, onsite & offsite
Lead supervise OQA production lot acceptance and FAI submission team for achieving OTD objective.
Job Requirements
Diploma/Bachelor Degree in Precision Engineering, Mechanical, Quality, Engineering or equivalent.
Meticulous, thinks systematically and is able to work independently.
Possesses good organization, problem-solving, interpersonal and communication skills.
Good knowledge of Quality Management System and ISO 9001-2015. Certified Auditor will be a plus.
Knowledge of LEAN Six Sigma and 8D Discipline methodology highly desirable.
MS Excel, PowerPoint a MUST and ERP knowledge an advantage.
Only Singaporean may apply.

Job Title: Digital Product Senior Manager, Technology Consulting
Job Description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The exceptional EY experience. It's yours to build.
At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.
The opportunity:
We are seeking a proactive and experienced Digital Product Manager to join our team. The successful candidate will manage the entire product line life cycle, from strategic planning to tactical activities, guide product development from conception to launch, and evaluate product functionalities and performance.
Your key responsibilities:
Manage and oversee the entire product line life cycle, including strategic planning, development, and tactical execution.
Develop and support product positioning strategies based on customer demands and market trends.
Guide the entire process of product development from concept, design, implementation to launch.
Regularly evaluate product functionalities and performance, and propose enhancements based on market feedback and consumer demands.
Conduct comprehensive market research to identify potential partnerships for the product, and generate innovative ideas for increasing market share, improving customer experience, and driving growth.
Oversee market research studies to keep abreast of new technologies and competitor offerings.
Lead in the development and presentation of business proposals to capitalize on new business opportunities.
To qualify for the role, you must have
At least a Bachelor’s degree in any of these faculties - Computer Science, Information Technology, Programming & Systems Analysis, Science (Computer Studies)
Proven experience as a Product Manager or similar role in the digital industry.
In-depth knowledge of product management principles, concepts, and techniques.
Experience conducting market research, product positioning, and marketing strategies.
Exceptional project management and organizational skills.
Strong problem-solving abilities, coupled with excellent communication skills.
Experience in managing cross-functional teams.
What we look for
Highly motivated individuals with excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to prioritize shifting workloads in a rapidly changing industry.
An effective communicator, you’ll be a confident leader equipped with strong people management skills and a genuine passion to make things happen in a dynamic organization.
What we offer
EY offers a competitive remuneration package commensurate with your work experience where you’ll be rewarded for your individual and team performance. We are committed to being an inclusive employer and are happy to consider flexible working arrangements, where this may be needed, guided by our FWA Policy.
Plus, we offer:
Continuous learning: You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.
Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.
Transformative leadership: We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs.
Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.
If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, apply now.
To learn more about our service offerings, visit https://www.ey.com/en_gl/careers/what-you-can-do-here or subscribe to http://www.youtube.com/ernstandyoungglobal
To learn more about careers in EYSG, please visit https://www.ey.com/en_sg/careers or like us on https://www.facebook.com/eycareerssingapore

Roles & Responsibilities
The exceptional EY experience. It's yours to build.
At EY, you will have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we are counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better too.
We will support you with career-long training and coaching to develop your skills and enhance performance. You will be working with the best of the best in a collaborative environment. So, whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime.
The Opportunity
You will apply your knowledge and experience to shape our services, you’ll focus on client opportunities where your expertise can make a substantial impact, and motivate your team. You’ll build valuable relationships with clients and develop strong capabilities, through both formal training and working with senior mentors and talented colleagues.
We’re looking for Senior Manager to join our Technology Consulting practice with experience in any of the following:
Technology Consulting
Cybersecurity
Data & Analytics
Digital & Emerging Technologies
Technology Solution Delivery - SAP & GRC
Technology Transformation
What we look for
You have an agile, growth-oriented mindset. What you know matters. But the right mindset is just as important in determining success. We’re looking for people who are innovative, can work in an agile way and keep pace with a rapidly changing world.
You are curious and purpose driven. We’re looking for people who see opportunities instead of challenges, who ask better questions to seek better answers that build a better working world.
You are inclusive. We’re looking for people who seek out and embrace diverse perspectives, who value differences, and team inclusively to build safety and trust.
Qualifications:
A Degree in one of the following: Accountancy, Business, Marketing, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Analytics, Information Technology or equivalent
At least 10 years of experience in a relevant industry or consulting role. Management consulting experience gained through a Big 4 is highly advantageous
Experienced in engaging and managing a variety of stakeholders
Prior experience of leading team for projects and pursuits
Excellent written, communication, and presentation skills in English (additional local language skills are considered an asset)
What working at EY offers
EY offers a competitive remuneration package where you’ll be rewarded for your individual and team performance. We are committed to being an inclusive employer and are happy to consider flexible working arrangements. Plus, we offer:
Support, coaching and feedback from some of the most engaging colleagues around
Opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career
The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you
EY | Building a better working world
EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.
Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

Job Title: Data Engineer, Senior Manager, Technology Consulting
Job Description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The exceptional EY experience. It's yours to build.
At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.
The opportunity:
EY DnA is the data and advanced analytics capability within EY Asia-Pacific, with over 500 specialist employees working across multiple industry sectors.
We implement information-driven strategies, data platforms and advanced data analytics solution systems that help grow, optimize and protect client organizations. We go beyond strategy and provide end to end design, build and implementation of real life data environments and have some of the best architects, project managers, business analysts, data scientists, big data engineers, developers and consultants in the region.
We are looking for a Data Engineer within the DnA team in our Singapore office. This role is offered on a flexible full time basis.
Your key responsibilities:
Apply data mining, data modelling, natural language processing, and machine learning to extract and analyse information from large structured and unstructured datasets
Develop and implement techniques and analytics applications to transform raw data into meaningful
information using dataoriented programming languages and visualisation software.
Visualise, interpret, and report data findings and may create dynamic data reports as well
Design, develop, and maintain the organization's data architecture, including data pipelines, databases, and data warehouses.
Develop and maintain ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes to efficiently move data from various sources to the data
Implement data quality checks and monitoring processes to identify and resolve data issues in a timely manner.
Collaborate with data scientists, analysts, and other cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and deliver data solutions that meet business needs.
Skills and attributes for success
Experience in ETL, Data Engineering, Scripting.
Knowledge and experience in end-to-end project delivery, either traditional SDLC or agile delivery methodologies (or hybrid approaches)
Experience in a delivery role on Business Intelligence, Data Warehousing, Big Data or analytics projects
Exceptional communication, documentation and presentation skills and stakeholder management experiences
Experience in business intelligence, data warehousing/platform, and data strategy projects
To qualify for the role, you must have
At least a Bachelor's degree in any of these faculties: Computer Science/Information Technology/Programming & Systems Analysis/Science (Computer Studies)
Minimum total 3 years work experience in at least 1 of these job titles: (1) Chief Data Scientist (2) Data Engineer (3) Data Scientist (4) Head of Data Analytics
At least 10 years of experience in a relevant industry or consulting role. Management consulting experience gained through a Big 4 is highly advantageous
Experience in development and maintenance of Data processing pipelines
Experience developing machine learning workflows
Work closely with business analysts to create data components
Application packaging and deployment experience across DEV to PROD environments
Experienced in engaging and managing a variety of stakeholders
Prior experience of leading team for projects and pursuits
Excellent written, communication, and presentation skills in English (additional local language skills are considered an asset)
Ideally, you’ll also have
Dashboarding experience with Tableau / Power BI
Experience in engaging with both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Consulting experience and background, including engaging directly with clients
What we look for
Highly motivated individuals with excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to prioritize shifting workloads in a rapidly changing industry.
An effective communicator, you’ll be a confident leader equipped with strong people management skills and a genuine passion to make things happen in a dynamic organization.

Job Title: Senior Manager | Commodities and Global Markets, Credit Risk
Job Description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Join our inclusive and dynamic Risk Management Group as a Senior Manager in Credit Risk.
In this pivotal role, you will be instrumental in analysing and assessing credit and equity exposures to safeguard Macquarie from potential losses. Your expertise will be essential in reviewing counterparties, structuring transactions, and developing robust risk mitigation strategies in collaboration with our deal teams.

At Macquarie, our advantage is bringing together diverse people and empowering them to shape all kinds of possibilities. We are a global financial services group operating in 34 markets and with 55 years of unbroken profitability. You’ll be part of a friendly and supportive team where everyone - no matter what role - contributes ideas and drives outcomes.

What role will you play?
In this role, you will conduct in-depth credit reviews and analyses of Commodities and Global Markets' counterparties in the Asia region, focusing on Chinese corporate clients. You will collaborate with global credit offices to secure credit approvals, partner with Macquarie's business groups to evaluate new products and transactions, and provide well-founded recommendations to credit approvers. Additionally, you will assist in structuring transactions, reviewing legal terms, and offering general advice and analysis.

You will perform annual and new reviews of counterparties, stay updated on portfolio developments, and address ad-hoc credit requests. You will also maintain strong connections across the commodities market to stay informed of the latest news and developments.

What you offer
Over 10 years of experience in a large financial institution, commodity trading company, or major commodity producer
Expertise in preparing counterparty credit reviews, credit recommendations, and negotiating credit terms within ISDA and CSA documentation
Experience operating within the Chinese commodities markets and covering a portfolio of Chinese counterparties operating in the hard commodities markets
Due to the role’s focus on the Macquarie Chinese counterparty portfolio, excellent written and verbal communication skills in business-level Mandarin are required, in order to liaise with clients
Experience in transactional analysis and approvals of physical commodity transactions and OTC derivatives, with a focus on the metals /hard commodities markets
High degree of ownership, delivery, and timeliness in a fast-paced environment, with a proactive approach to anticipating and flagging issues, and a continual improvement mindset.
We love hearing from anyone inspired to build a better future with us, if you're excited about the role or working at Macquarie we encourage you to apply.

About the Risk Management Group
Our Risk Management Group works as an independent, and centralised function, responsible for independent and objective review and challenge, oversight, monitoring and reporting in relation to Macquarie’s material risks. We are a global team that aims to manage the risks of today and anticipate the risks of tomorrow. Our divisions include compliance, credit, financial crime risk, internal audit, market risk, operational risk, aggregate risk and prudential, and central.

Benefits
Macquarie employees can access a wide range of benefits which, depending on eligibility criteria, include:
Hybrid and flexible working arrangements
One wellbeing leave day per year
Up to 20 weeks paid parental leave as well as benefits to support you as you transition to life as a working parent
Paid volunteer leave and donation matching
Other benefits to support your physical, mental and financial wellbeing
Access a wide range of learning and development opportunities
Our commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion
We are committed to providing a working environment that embraces diversity, equity, and inclusion. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply for a role regardless of their identity, including gender, race, ethnicity, cultural identity, nationality, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, intersex status, marital or family status, neurodiversity, religion or belief, disabilities, or socio-economic background.

If you require adjustments to your working arrangements or the recruitment process, please let us know when applying.

Job Title: Digital Product Manager (Financial Services), Director, Technology Consulting
Job Description:
Roles & Responsibilities
We are the only professional services organization who has a separate business dedicated exclusively to the financial services marketplace. Join Financial Services (FSO) and you will work with multi-disciplinary teams from around the world to deliver a global perspective. Aligned to key industry groups including asset management, banking and capital markets, insurance and private equity, we provide integrated advisory, assurance, tax, and transaction services.
The opportunity
With our Data & Analytics team in FSO experiencing rapid growth, now is an exciting time to join us on this journey. We are looking for talent with a passion for data and the know-how to partner with our to clients to disrupt and transform Financial Services organisations. Whether you are a Consultant at the start of your career or a Manager looking for the next opportunity, if you want to make a difference by developing leading data and technology strategies and helping to solve our clients’ most pressing data challenges, we would love to hear from you.

Your key responsibilities
· Design the execution of our clients’ transformation programs to support their transition towards a digital and data-driven organisation, with data and people at the heart of change.
· Manage the life cycle, from strategic planning to tactical activities.
· Bring to life a seamless data and analytics strategy that solve our clients’ most complex business challenges to enable the making of better-informed decisions.
· Design and implement data and technology operating models that encompass people, process, technology, and data.
· Leverage data platforms and solutions to help our clients visualise and better understand their data.
· Provide thought leadership on how our clients can innovate with traditional or emerging technology tools and disrupt their current ways of working to extract greater value from their input.
· Lead and support the creation of client proposals and business development initiatives.
Skills and attributes for success
· Understand how digital and data strategies are created and implemented.
· Passion for designing large, multi-year digital and data transformations with people at the centre of change.
· Passion for solving big complex problems using data and technology
· Working with diverse and inclusive teams of talented people solving client issues.
· Build strong, meaningful relationships with client stakeholders.
· Work as a team player to support other team members by sharing your knowledge, experience, and skillsets.
To qualify for the role, you must have
· Minimum 10 years’ experience in Financial Services (either industry or consulting and appropriate to your level). Preferably a year of consulting experience in any of the Big 4 or consulting firms.
· Experience in data and analytics approaches such as data mesh.
What we look for
Highly motivated individuals with excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to prioritize shifting workloads in a rapidly changing industry. An effective communicator, you’ll be a confident team player that collaborates with people from various teams while looking to develop your career in a dynamic organization.
What we offer

· Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way
· Transformative leadership: We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs.
