Job Title: Residential Cleaning Team Leader (Handyman Experience Preferred)
Job Description:
Roles & Responsibilities
About Us:
We are a fast-growing residential cleaning company that takes pride in delivering high-quality services with efficiency and attention to detail. Our team works in a fast-paced environment where no two days are the same—ensuring that the workday flies by! We are looking for motivated leaders with cleaning and handyman experience to join our team and take charge of daily operations.
Position Overview:
As a Residential Cleaning Team Leader, you will oversee a team of cleaners, ensuring homes are cleaned to the highest standards. Your handyman skills will be a major asset in addressing minor home maintenance tasks that enhance our service. This is a hands-on leadership role where you will be expected to clean, lead, and solve small maintenance issues on-site.
Key Responsibilities:
Lead and supervise a team of residential cleaners, ensuring efficient and high-quality work.
Perform residential cleaning tasks, including deep cleaning, dusting, vacuuming, mopping, and sanitization.
Utilize handyman skills to perform minor home maintenance tasks (e.g., fixing door handles, light repairs, basic plumbing issues).
Train and mentor team members on best cleaning practices and safety procedures.
Manage schedules, assign tasks, and ensure all jobs are completed on time.
Communicate effectively with clients and handle any service-related concerns.
Maintain cleaning equipment and supplies to ensure a smooth workflow.
Requirements:
Experience in residential cleaning or a similar fast-paced industry.
Handyman skills or experience in maintenance, construction, or a trade is a strong advantage.
Ability to work quickly and efficiently while maintaining high standards.
Strong leadership and teamwork skills.
Positive attitude and problem-solving mindset.
Comfortable working in a physically active role.
Valid driver’s license (preferred but not required).
What We Offer:
Competitive salary with performance bonuses.
A fast-paced, engaging work environment—the workday flies by!
Opportunities for career growth and leadership development.
Supportive and team-oriented workplace culture.
Training to expand your skill set in cleaning and minor home repairs.
Join Our Team!
If you enjoy fast-paced, hands-on work and have experience in cleaning, handyman services, or a related field, we want to hear from you! Apply today and take the next step in your career.

Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description & Requirements
We are passionate technologists who believe in the power of software and technology as tools for social change. The people in Thoughtworks Singapore are as diverse in personality as we are in our backgrounds, culture, and expertise.
If you’re someone who’s inspired by technology, by joining Thoughtworks, you become part of a community. People join because they get to talk to the people who wrote the books that influenced them, work with the people who wrote the tools they would like to use, and collaborate on projects that propel change in the real world.
As a Polyglot Developer at Thoughtworks, you’ll get to:
Think through hard problems in a consultancy environment, and work with amazing people to make the solutions a reality
Work in a dynamic, collaborative, non-hierarchical environment where your talent is valued over your job title or years of experience
Build custom software using the latest technologies and tools
Craft your own career path
You'll be responsible for:
Creating complex, enterprise-transforming applications on diverse, high energy teams
Using the latest tools and techniques
Hands-on coding, usually in a pair programming environment.
Working in highly collaborative teams and building quality code
Working in lots of different domains and client environments
Understanding the business domain deeply and working closely with business stakeholders
Ideally, you should you have:
3 to 8 years of development and delivery experience with Java / C# / Ruby on Rails / Python / Node.js or any similar exciting technologies.

Great OO skills, including strong design patterns knowledge
Familiarity with few databases, like MySQL, Oracle, PostgreSQL, SQL Server, NoSQL, etc
Experience working with, or an interest in Agile Methodologies, such as Extreme Programming (XP) and Scrum
Knowledge of software best practices, like Test-Driven Development (TDD) and Continuous Integration (CI)
Strong communication and client-facing skills with the ability to work in a consulting environment are essential
Desire to contribute to the wider technical community through collaboration, coaching, and mentoring of other technologists
If you relish the idea of being part of a community that extends beyond the work we do for our customers, you may find Thoughtworks is the right place for you. If you share our passion for technology and want to help change the world with software, we want to hear from you!

Job Title: KYC SoW Remediation (Financial Services), Consultant / Senior Consultant, Risk Consulting
Job Description:
Roles & Responsibilities
At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.
The Opportunity
As part of the Financial Services Risk Management (FSRM) practice and you will provide a well-integrated broad array of risk management services to capital market participants within global banking, capital markets, asset management and insurance. FSRM products and services include Anti-Money Laundering, Regulatory Compliance, Prudential Supervision, Bank Holding Company reporting, Credit Risk/ Capital Adequacy/ Liquidity Risk, Market Risk, Operational Risk, Enterprise Risk, Structured Finance and Quantitative Advisory Services.
Your Key Responsibilities
As a Consultant/Senior Consultant in the Risk Management – Financial Crime Compliance team, you will be expected to provide strategic sourcing services related to regulatory compliance, Financial Crime Compliance (FCC), corporate governance, enterprise risk management, internal controls and internal audit, to our clients in financial services (FS) industry. You are also required to assist organizations to maintain effective and efficient controls, in order to manage organizational and strategic risks. Also, to be able to contribute to our advisory business in FCC, where advisory services on FCC target operating models, business processes and internal controls are in compliance with regulatory requirements without compromising on customer experience that are provided to the client.
Skills and Attributes for Success
Good understanding of economic or market issues and the ability to interpret their impact on clients
Possess strong interpersonal and teaming skills
Leverage technology to continually learn, improve service delivery and maintain our leading-edge best practices
Strong presentation skills and proficiency in the use of PowerPoint, Word and Excel
Build an understanding of our solutions, share knowledge and be able to draw on subject matter specialists accordingly
Self-motivated with lots of energy and drive
Effective project management and teamwork skills
Ideally, you’ll also have
Post-graduate qualifications in AML/CFT or professional/ technical qualifications in risk management.
Experience with the design, development and implementation of framework and strategy, internal controls for financial services business processes
To Qualify for the role, you must have
Min. 2 years relevant Financial Crime Compliance (AML/ CFT, KYC, Sanctions, Anti-Bribery & Corruption and Fraud) experience in banking, insurance, asset management, and/or in a big public accounting firm.
Strong understanding of expectations of regulators such as MAS and HKMA. Knowledge of other ASEAN jurisdictions’ AML regulations and environment, and practical experience in the industry a plus.
Knowledge of the global risk and regulatory environment, especially developments in the FCC space.
Graduate degree in law, finance or commerce preferred.
Industry related certification (e.g., CAMS or ICA diploma in AML)
Demonstrate strong planning, execution and reporting skills
Analytical skills; specifically, the ability to assess and decompose financial services industry processes utilizing a risk and control focus
What we look for
Highly motivated individuals with excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to prioritize shifting workloads in a rapidly changing industry. An effective communicator, you’ll be a confident team player that collaborates with people from various teams while looking to develop your career in a dynamic organization.
What we offer
· Continuous learning: You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.
· Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.
· Transformative leadership: We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs.
· Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.
If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.
The exceptional EY experience. It’s yours to build.
Apply now.

Job Title: Business Transformation (Financial Services) Senior Consultant, Business Consulting
Job Description:
Roles & Responsibilities
At EY, you will have the chance to build a career as unique as you are. With the global scale, training, support and guidance, inclusive culture and technology, you will get a chance to become the best version of you. With a network that stretches across the world, you will gain unparalleled insight and experience from different geographies and sectors. So whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime.

The Opportunity
In today’s volatile and unpredictable world, making the right decisions is key to successful and sustained business performance – more so than it has been ever before. As a Business Transformation consultant, you’ll use your analytical ability to translate the corporate strategy of leading organizations into meaningful change.
Business Transformation consultants at EY are strategic thinkers, as well as the engine room of our business, working on the front lines globally with our clients, colleagues and third-parties to transform businesses. They work across different segments within Financial Services, cross-pollinating with the best of customer, strategy, operations, digital and technology to design, build and run the businesses of tomorrow. They traverse the entire spectrum from strategy and innovation, through to experience transformation and digitization of operations. No two days are the same.
They embrace an outcome oriented culture, living EY’s core values, and widely collaborate with several other internal teams to consistently deliver value-added outcomes for our clients.

Your Key Responsibilities
The Business Transformation team focuses on strategy, future operating models, experience design, platforms, innovation and execution. The sheer nature of wide scope of work will require you to collaborate across teams to bring the best of EY to solve the client’s problem statements
Support senior team in developing new content for our clients which can include market research/sizing, as well as creating scalable digital solutions that solve teething client issues
Prepare timely, quality output and deliverables per client’s needs
Participate in business development activities and create client pitches and proposals
Form part of our client project delivery teams where you will manage deliverables, analyze data, prepare presentations and design solutions
Skills and Attributes for Success
You should be passionate about working with multiple parts of the businesses across different Financial Services domains, solutioning and delivering complex digital solutions
You find yourself always wanting to solve problems, innovate and shape the industry, wanting to differentiate
You should be able to understand and appreciate both sides of a coin, the business aspect and the technology aspect to enable business aspirations
You always see yourself as someone who is looking for opportunities to turn day to day business challenges into automated, frictionless working solutions aimed at providing the best client experience
You have an analytical mindset and a structured problem-solving approach
You enjoy communicating with people from various backgrounds and skillsets across an organization, and have always been great at communicating ideas across various channels and mediums
To Qualify for the role, you must have
An attitude to learn, approach problems head on, to be willing to roll your sleeves up to find solutions
Minimum 3 years of experience in the banking or insurance industry, or with a fintech, or as an internal/external consultant working on strategy, business transformation, program management, product, operations and/or technology projects
Structured problem solving, quantitative analysis, and storylining skills
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills
Ability to work in collaborative and client-facing environments
Strong business analysis experience
Ideally, you should also have
Experience with working across functions and stakeholders in consumer, commercial, transaction, investment or private banking
Experience of working with various stakeholders in the Insurance ecosystem
Knowledge of key problems faced by banks or insurers and ideas how some of these can be solved through automation and digitalisation
What working at EY offers
We offer a competitive compensation package where you will be rewarded based on your performance and will be recognized for the value you bring to our business. We also offer you:
Support, coaching and feedback from some of the most engaging colleagues and mentors.
Opportunities to develop new skills and shape your career the way you want to
The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that is right for you
A diverse and inclusive culture. You will be embraced for who you are and will be empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs
If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.
Explore the exceptional EY experience. It’s yours to build.
Apply now!

Job Description:
Roles & Responsibilities
At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.
We are the only professional services organisation who has a separate business dedicated exclusively to the financial services marketplace. Join Financial Services (FSO) and you will work with multi-disciplinary teams from around the world to deliver a global perspective. Aligned to key industry groups including asset management, banking and capital markets, insurance and private equity, we provide integrated consulting, assurance, tax, and transaction services.
The Opportunity
EY’s Business Consulting professionals bring a wealth of experience in working with major financial institutions to align their operating model and infrastructure to their business’ strategic objectives. We assemble the right multi-disciplinary teams, use consistent and proven global methodologies and tools, and draw on the full breadth of EY’s global network, to deliver value and trusted advice to the clients. The key service offerings cover finance function transformation, customer and distribution effectiveness, operations, shared services / outsourcing support, performance management, program advisory, enterprise intelligence, risk management and regulatory change.
Your Key Responsibilities
As markets rapidly change and develop, finance functions must demonstrate real added value to their business. As a finance advisor, you’ll use your experience and knowledge to help deliver greater insight – delivering functional efficiencies as well as transforming the role of finance in our clients’ businesses. You’ll be developing innovative, sustainable ways to improve the management of people, processes and systems, working alongside other finance professionals in high-performing teams.

Numerate, with a solid grasp of financial performance analysis in the Financial/ Insurance industry

Bachelor or Master Degree with a minimum of 3 years’ working experience, preferably with a year in a business consulting role in a leading consultancy firm. Candidates with more experience will be considered at a more senior level.
Qualified or part qualified accountant or financial analyst
Strong business acumen within the financial sector, with experience in the following discipline :
Enterprise Performance Management with integrated, driver based Planning, Budgeting, Forecasting and Scenario management.
Have hands-on experience in both design and implementation with the ability to articulate best practices and drive workshops.
Proven capabilities in delivering business transformation projects and programs, Finance Transformation projects and / or Financial Operating Model would be an advantage.
Ability to establish personal credibility quickly and deliver high quality deliverables.
Demonstrated key subject matter expert with the ability to develop thought leadership and deliver solutions for clients.

Ideally, you’ll also have
Experience of working within ASEAN
Strong stakeholder management skills in understanding strategic direction and being able to convert into cohesive change management strategy and plans
Ability to develop client opportunities and identify market growth opportunities
Ability to support the business development cycle
What we look for
Highly motivated individuals with excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to prioritize shifting workloads in a rapidly changing industry. An effective communicator, you’ll be a confident team player that collaborates with people from various teams while looking to develop your career in a dynamic organization
What we offer

Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.

At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

Cyber threats, social media, massive data storage, privacy requirements and continuity of the business as usual require heavy information security measures. As an information security specialist, you will assist in the end to end implementation of security solutions for our clients and support our clients in their desire to protect the business.

Roles & Responsibilities
Business Consulting, we deliver long-term value to our clients, people and EY by transforming businesses through the power of exceptional business insights, talent and experiences.

Business Transformation is the glue that integrates with the rest of EY to design and implement transformative change with our clients.

The opportunity

As a transformation professional at EY, you will help organisations deliver successful outcomes for some of the world's largest and most complex programs: be it Business Transformation, or Capital Investment; the opportunity to shape your career is yours.
We are looking for highly motivated self- starters and strong team players who like to push themselves, who can think strategically but enjoy 'rolling up their sleeves' and working closely with clients to get the job done.

Your key responsibilities
Qualitative and quantitative analysis on all aspects of sales and marketing transformation
Assist clients with successful delivery of their programs leading to service delivery improvements and/or successful investment outcomes
Deliver complex transformation and/or capital investment programs spanning the entire lifecycle - from strategy through to transition into operations
Contribute to business development and account management activities such as pursuits, proposals and managing key relationships
Skills and attributes for success
Degree in Business Studies, Business administration, Engineering, Sciences or similar
Min 3 years in a relevant industry/consulting role
Hands-on experience in projects and programs involving internal strategy, marketing, distribution support, business transformation and/or infrastructure and capital works development and delivery
Management consulting experience gained through a Big 4 or boutique consulting firm is highly desirable
Capabilities in Portfolio / Program / Project Management, Agile PM delivery, PM technology and digital services, PMO / PM as a service
Ideally, you’ll also have
Advanced analytical and problem-solving skills
Advanced Excel skills
Workshop facilitation and presentation skills
A desire to continue to grow and shape your skills set, to enable you to provide program management solutions for the Transformative Age (e.g. agile and design thinking)
Infrastructure Transformation Experience
Ability to communicate effectively both internally and externally
Ability to build effective, long-lasting relationships with clients
Experience in project planning tools (e.g. MS Project, Primavera P6, JIRA) and MS Power Platform
What we look for

Highly motivated individuals with excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to prioritize shifting workloads in a rapidly changing industry. An effective communicator, you’ll be a confident team player that collaborates with people from various teams while looking to develop your career in a dynamic organization.

What we offer
Continuous learning: You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.
Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.
Transformative leadership: We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs.
Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.
If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.

The exceptional EY experience. It’s yours to build.
Apply now.

Roles & Responsibilities
Program Development:
Design and implement personalized and group programs that meet residents' needs and collaborate with healthcare professionals to integrate therapeutic activities into care plans.

Team Management and Leadership:
Supervise and lead program coordinators, ensuring effective delivery, staff development, and a collaborative, innovative team environment.

Funding and Grant Writing:
Identify funding opportunities and write grant applications to support program development and sustainability, ensuring alignment with funding requirements.

Resident Engagement:
Foster an inclusive environment by encouraging resident participation and adjusting programs based on feedback to enhance satisfaction and engagement.

Staff Coordination and Training:
Train program coordinators on best practices for program facilitation and resident engagement, while promoting teamwork to create a supportive atmosphere for residents.

Community Outreach:
Build partnerships with local organizations, volunteers, and healthcare providers to enrich programs, and organize community events to connect residents with the wider community.

Quality Assurance:
Monitor and evaluate program effectiveness to ensure compliance with standards, and prepare reports on outcomes and participation for management and regulatory bodies.

Documentation and Reporting:
Maintain accurate records of program activities, participation, and feedback, and communicate updates to residents, families, and staff regularly.

Requirements:
Minimum of 3-5 years of experience in program management, specifically in a healthcare or long-term care setting
Proven experience in grant writing and securing funding for community-based or healthcare programs
Experience working with interdisciplinary teams in a healthcare or social services setting
Comfortable travelling to other centres
Strong knowledge of geriatric care, therapeutic recreation, and team management skills
Proactive in addressing challenges, with strong organizational and time-management abilities
Skilled in Microsoft Office Suite and familiar with grant management software
Compassionate, empathetic, and passionate about improving the quality of life for older adults

Job Title: CAD / BIM Drafter | Landscape | Up to $3,500
Job Description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Duration: 1 year
Location: Maxwell
Working Hours: Monday - Thursday 830am to 6pm; Friday 830am to 6pm

Responsibilities:
The role involves assembling 3D models of buildings in different BIM formats (e.g., RVT, IFC, GIS) through a suite of CAD/BIM authoring software to support the organization of planning data.
You will be required to understand and interpret planning and development records by synthesizing various data sources including approved plans in various formats (e.g., CAD, PDF, Bentley), as well as performing quality checks to ensure the accuracy of assembled data.
You will also be required to extract information from building floor plans, and update them into relevant data repositories, both in tabular form as well as a spatial data model using GIS software (ArcGIS).
Any other duties assigned by supervisor such as working closely with the team to explore and design data pipelines, data architecture and automated solutioning in lieu of the above.
Requirements:
Singaporean
Diploma holder
Experience in reading building submissions in CAD/BIM format, proficiency in Autodesk CAD

Job Title: Business Analyst (Financial Services) Health Insurance, Senior Consultant, Business Consulting
Job Description:
Roles & Responsibilities
At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture, and technology to become the best version of yourself. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

We are the only professional services organization with a dedicated business exclusively focused on the financial services marketplace. Join Financial Services Consulting, and you will work with multi-disciplinary teams from around the world to deliver a global perspective. Aligned to key industry groups including banking and capital markets, insurance, and wealth & asset management, we provide integrated consulting, assurance, tax, and transaction services.
The Opportunity
EY’s consulting professionals bring a wealth of experience in working with major financial institutions to align their operating models and infrastructure with business strategy. We assemble the right multi-disciplinary teams, use consistent and proven global methodologies and tools, and draw on the full breadth of EY’s global network to deliver value and trusted advice to our clients.

Our key service offerings cover business and technology strategy & transformation, customer and distribution effectiveness, operations, shared services/outsourcing support, performance management, program advisory, enterprise intelligence, risk management, and regulatory change.
Your Key Responsibilities
The team works collaboratively with our clients to address critical issues brought on by global changes, including regulatory changes, globalization, advances in technology, competition, and the evolving demands of their customers.

The team manages engagements with the support of Financial Services and Consulting resources across all aspects of design, analysis, and delivery of Financial Services solutions. You will support the implementation and delivery of quality deliverables, working and communicating effectively with the engagement team and client’s team to ensure exceptional performance.
Skills and Attributes for Success
Good understanding of economic or market issues and the ability to interpret their impact on clients.
Possess strong interpersonal and teaming skills.
Leverage technology to continually learn, improve service delivery, and maintain our leading-edge best practices.
Strong presentation skills and proficiency in the use of PowerPoint, Word, and Excel.
To Qualify for the Role, You Must Have
Minimum 3 years’ experience in the Financial Services industry, having worked with Insurance and/or Consulting firms.
Academic background in Engineering, IT, Business, Economics, Finance, or Accounting.
Experience writing functional specifications for Health Insurance systems and solutions.
Consulting skills, functional, and technical knowledge of health insurance platforms such as Facets, QNXT, Epic, HealthEdge, or similar systems are an added bonus.
Track record of dealing with senior stakeholders and adapting to demanding environments.
What We Look For
Highly motivated individuals with excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to prioritize shifting workloads in a rapidly changing industry. An effective communicator, you’ll be a confident team player that collaborates with people from various teams while looking to develop your career in a dynamic organization.
What Working at EY Offers
We offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. We also offer you:
Continuous learning: You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.
Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.
Transformative leadership: We’ll give you the insights, coaching, and confidence to be the leader the world needs.
Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.
If you can confidently demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.

Apply now.

Roles & Responsibilities
Responsibilities
Design, Code, and Test Siemens PLC Systems: Utilize the TIA portal to design, code, and test Siemens PLC systems, ensuring they meet project specifications and industry standards.
Pharmaceutical Industry Experience: Apply your knowledge of the pharmaceutical industry to develop and implement PLC solutions that comply with regulatory requirements and enhance operational efficiency.
Desigo CC System: Work with the Desigo CC system to integrate and manage building automation and control systems.
BMS/PCS Expertise: Leverage your expertise in Building Management Systems (BMS) or Process Control Systems (PCS) to support various projects and ensure seamless integration with other systems.
Hardware Design and Engineering: Design and engineer hardware components for PLC systems, ensuring they are robust, reliable, and meet project requirements.
Site Support and Troubleshooting: Provide on-site support and troubleshooting for PLC systems, addressing any issues that arise during installation, commissioning, and operation.
Interface with Other Systems: Ensure PLC systems interface effectively with other systems, including SCADA, HMI, and other automation and control systems.
Project Execution: Manage and execute PLC projects from inception to completion, ensuring they are delivered on time, within budget, and to the required quality standards.
Requirements
Experience: 4-6 years of relevant experience in Siemens PLC engineering, with a focus on the pharmaceutical industry.
Technical Skills: Proficiency in using the TIA portal for PLC design, coding, and testing. Experience with the Desigo CC system and BMS/PCS is highly desirable.
Problem-Solving: Strong troubleshooting skills and the ability to provide effective on-site support.
Communication: Excellent communication skills, with the ability to interface effectively with clients, project teams, and other stakeholders.
Project Management: Proven experience in managing and executing PLC projects, with a track record of delivering successful outcomes.
Certifications: Relevant certifications in Siemens PLC systems, BMS, or PCS.
Industry Knowledge: In-depth knowledge of regulatory requirements and best practices in the pharmaceutical industry.

Job Description:
This is a full time role for a Warehouse Manager located in Tuas West (Near to MRT). Our client is in the logistics industry. This role involves managing daily warehouse operations to ensure efficient, accurate, and timely product deliveries while maintaining safety, quality, and compliance standards. Key responsibilities include leading and training the warehouse team, optimizing storage and distribution processes, and coordinating local and export deliveries. The position also requires acting as the Risk Management leader (bizSAFE), implementing safety measures, and addressing operational risks. Clear communication with clients, cost management, and KPI tracking are essential to improve productivity and support company goals. Other duties may be assigned as needed to ensure smooth operations.

At least 10 years of experience in a warehouse environment, with proven warehouse management and organizational skills.
Strong leadership experience, with the ability to motivate and guide a team in a fast-paced setting.

Roles & Responsibilities
PanCare Medical introduces its forthcoming transitional care facility, catering to stable patients awaiting nursing home placement. Our central goal is to establish a nurturing temporary sanctuary for the elderly, fostering a sense of belonging and respect.
Our commitment extends to our devoted staff's well-being. We ensure optimal staffing and manageable workloads, prioritizing work-life equilibrium. Our vision is to cultivate a compassionate environment, empowering nurses and healthcare assistants to provide exceptional care to this esteemed population.
At our core, we offer a meticulously tailored program for seniors, guided by geriatricians, therapists, and social workers. We're equally dedicated to fostering strong family connections during this pivotal life phase. Join us in a role that exudes purpose and significance.
Job Highlights
Great Career Opportunity & Progression
Positive Working Environment
Attractive Remuneration
Job Description:
Plan and run occupational rehab therapy services in the TCF [in coordination with the Ops Manager and Physiotherapist].
Conduct assessments for patients during admission and periodic reviews.
Institute an appropriate and effective treatment.
Participate in multidisciplinary case discussions with the TCF care team.
Contribute to formulation and follow-up of patients’ Individual Care Plan [ICP] to ensure holistic health and care coverage.
Plan and conduct group therapy programmes and activities for patients.
Review and revise programme schedule when necessary to enhance the quality of the therapy program.
Take charge of proper documentation of therapy records.
Understand dementia issues and know how to manage patients who display behavioural problems [associated with onset of dementia].
Interact to foster close and warm relationships with patients’ families and caregivers; and to exhibit with sincerity the care and respect of patients.
Take charge of other duties which the Ops Manager may assign from time to time.
Job Requirements and Qualifications:
Bachelor degree or Diploma in Occupational Therapy
Qualified and registered with AHPC [Allied Health Professions Council].
Minimum 3 years of working experience in a hospital or eldercare institution; preference is for a candidate with working experience in a community setting.
Good communication and interpersonal skills.
Possess a passionate disposition to interact with seniors.
Office working hours.

· Excellent time management.
· Great networking abilities.

Company: ICE DATA SERVICES SINGAPORE PTE. LTD.
Job Description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description
Intercontinental Exchange, Inc. (ICE) presents a unique opportunity to work on cutting-edge technology and business challenges in the financial sector. The ICE Network Engineer provides leadership in network design, deployment, maintenance, and operational supports. The successful candidate will be able to multitask in a dynamic team-based environment demonstrating strong problem-solving and decision-making abilities and the highest degree of professionalism.
The Lead Network Engineer is an important role within the organization serving as a technical leader for Analysts and Engineers. The lead engineers are subject matter expert in parts of the network eco-system enabling them to handle complex issues. The engineer is fully involved in the project work, taking ownership of large network deployments from the design phase to the implementation, documentation, and support handover.
Along with having larger domain knowledge and advanced trouble-shooting skills. The Lead Engineer will be looked upon as an informal trainer to Analyst and Engineers, using every encounter to share knowledge and recovery tips with Engineers, better equipping them to handle similar issues in future. All interactions with the clients, colleagues and vendors must remain highly professional, helpful, and proactive.
Responsibilities
Design, deploy, support, and maintain mixed vendor network infrastructure.
Assist ICE staff with problem solving and escalation procedures.
Understand and follow operational policies/procedures and promote adherence to same
Provide technical knowledge needed to ensure safe, effective, and efficient changes to the network infrastructure.
Assist with development of policies and procedures for maintaining network infrastructure.
Collaborate and work closely with all other IT teams.
Lead Incident investigations, diagnosis, and service restoration and always give priority to the resolution of incidents.
Provide consultation (troubleshooting, designing, on-boarding, risk mitigation, operational improvement) for areas of domain strength.
Informal Trainer to Level II; ensures Level II skills are constantly growing through support and guidance.
Participation in 24/7 on-call rotation if needed.
Knowledge and Experience
Advanced knowledge of Cisco, Juniper, Arista and other vendor equipment and configuration
Advanced knowledge and experience with Routing Protocols (BGP, ISIS, OSPF, etc.)
Strong experience in MPLS and Traffic Engineering
10+ years’ experience hands on support and troubleshooting of networks.
6+ years’ experience with design and implementation on complex networks
Understanding of network management, security, and monitoring
Excellent writing and documentation skills
Excellent customer service attitude
Ability to operate effectively and professionally under pressure.
Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Technology, or a related field
Preferred
Experience working on financial and HFT networks.
Strong experience in Multicast in switched and routed networks
Expert level network certifications: CCIE, JNCIE. Etc.
F5, Checkpoint, or Palo Alto advanced certification
Automation and scripting experience
Unix/Linux system administration
Running and analyzing sniffer traces with deep TCP/IP protocol understanding.
Ability to grasp very complex architectural concepts.
In-depth hardware knowledge of switches and routers: (Internal chipsets specifications, TCAM and memory details, buffering capabilities and multicast replication details).
Master’s degree in computer engineering or related field preferred but not needed.
Schedule
This role offers work from home flexibility of one day per week.

Roles & Responsibilities
Position Overview
We are seeking a motivated and experienced Partner Manager to develop and lead our partner program. As the Partner Manager, you will play a pivotal role in driving business growth by establishing and managing relationships with resellers and implementation partners. You will develop a structured partner program and build a robust partner network that aligns with our business goals.
Key Responsibilities
Develop the Partner Program:
Design and implement a comprehensive partner program, including onboarding processes, training, certifications, and incentive structures.
Define tiers, benefits, and requirements for partners to encourage engagement and growth.
Build and Manage Partner Network:
Identify, recruit, and onboard resellers and implementation partners globally or regionally.
Establish and nurture strong relationships with partners, ensuring alignment with business objectives.
Act as the primary point of contact for partners, addressing their needs, resolving issues, and facilitating collaboration.
Drive Partner Sales and Growth:
Collaborate with the sales and marketing teams to create co-marketing initiatives and campaigns for partners.
Set and monitor partner performance metrics, including sales targets and customer satisfaction levels.
Provide regular reporting and insights on partner contributions to revenue and market share.
Support Partner Enablement:
Equip partners with the tools, training, and resources needed to effectively promote and implement our software product.
Organize and oversee partner events, webinars, and workshops to ensure continuous learning and engagement.
Strategic Development and Market Analysis:
Conduct market analysis to identify opportunities and gaps in the partner ecosystem.
Develop strategies to expand partner reach in key markets and industries.
Continuously refine the partner program based on feedback and evolving business needs.
Qualifications and Experience
Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Marketing, or a related field.
Proven experience (5+ years) in partner management, channel sales, or business development within the software or IT industry.
Demonstrated success in building and scaling partner networks.
Strong understanding of reseller and implementation partner dynamics.
Excellent interpersonal, negotiation, and relationship-building skills.
Strategic thinker with strong problem-solving capabilities.
Proficiency in CRM systems and partner management tools.
Willingness to travel as required to meet with partners and attend industry events.
Why Join Us?
Opportunity to shape and lead the growth of a key business channel.
Collaborative and innovative work environment.
Professional development and career advancement opportunities.
If you are passionate about building partnerships and driving growth, we would love to hear from you!

Job Title: Senior (Staff ) Physical  Design / IC Backend Design Engineer
Job Description:
Roles & Responsibilities
We are a chip design service company invested by an international consortium and founded by a senior chip design technical team.
The company is headquartered in Singapore and will take root in Singapore for long-term development.
The company has strong R&D capabilities and its core technical team members all have more than 10 years of experience in chip design.
We have rich industry experience and deep practical accumulation in ASIC design and business management.
Our office is located in one North and walking distance from MRT.
We Provide competitive salary and compensation package for the right candidate. We are work-life balance and friendly to employees with various benefit.

Job Description：
1. Works with the front-end design team to complete the chip floorplan , clock architecture, and powerplan .
2. Takes charge of the physical design tasks from the Netlist to the GDSII, including P&R, formal verification, static timing analysis, physical verification, power analysis, design for reliability and tapeout.
3. Researches the physical design methodology of advanced process nodes, and builds an automatic physical design platform.

Position Requirements:
1. Holds a bachelor's degree or above in electronic engineering, microelectronics, or computer science.
2. At least 5 years of work experience in the digital backend design field. Hands-on project experience is required. Tapeout experience at advanced technology is prefered. ( for excellect junior candidates with 3+ years experience will be considerated )
3. Those with experience in TCL , Perl or Python script development and familiar with EDA tool design will be plus.
4. Strong communication ability, good confidence and self-movitation.
5. Bilingual and with good teamwork spirit.
6. Salary is negotiable for excellent candidates.

Roles & Responsibilities
Responsibilities:
· Develops, implement and maintain Project HSE Management Plan, Procedures, and programs in accordance with client and company requirements and industry best practices.
· Manages HSE professionals in different fabrication sites (Singapore, China and Brazil).
· Prepares reports and share executive summary of the performance for monthly review. quarterly operations review and steering committees (Environment, Safety and Health)
· Ensure timely submission of the weekly and monthly data for HSE Statistics to client and HSE Management.
· Coordinates and manage all the internal/ external audits (ISO45K, 14K etc.)
· Conducts regular risk assessments and job safety analysis to identify potential hazards and implement corrective measures from different fabrication sites.
· Monitors compliance with HSE regulations, standards, and guidelines, ensuring that all employees are trained and aware of their responsibilities.
· Leads investigations of incidents and accidents, determining root causes and recommending corrective actions to prevent recurrence.
· Collaborates with management and staff to promote a positive safety culture, ensuring that safety considerations are integrated into all business operations.
· Provides training and support to employees on HSE topies, including emergency response, hazard recognition, and safe work practices.
· Prepares and maintain HSE performance reports and metries. presenting findings and recommendations to senior management and client.
· Coordinate and participate in HSE committees and initiatives, fostering teamwork and collaboration across departments.
· Keeps up date with industry trends, regulations, and best practices, ensuring the organization adapts to changes as necessary.
· Liaises with client, project director and company management regarding HSE compliance and initiatives.

Requirements:
· Bachelor's degree in occupational health and safety, Environmental Science, or
· related field.
· Minimum of 3 years of experience in HSE management. preferably in Marine and Oil and Gas Industry.
· Proficiency in Mandarin is an advantage
· Strong knowledge of HSE regulations, standards, and best practices.
· Proven experience in risk assessment, incident investigation, and safety program development.
· Having experience as a Project HSE Manager in FPSO projects is advantageous.
· Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to engage and influence employees at all levels.
· Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a detail-oriented approach.
· Professional certifications relevant in Marine Industry such as Assess Shipyard Safety for Hot-Work, Manage Work at Height, and WSQ Assess Confined Space for Safe Entry and Work (CSSA) are desirable.
· Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite and HSE management tools.

Job Requisition Number: IGSKA003
Job Level: More than 10 years of relevant experience (L4)
Location: Singapore

Job Objectives

We are looking for a Technology Delivery Manager. The applicant will have a strong background in technology with a strong understanding and at least 7 years’ experience with Technology Project Management.
Asset Management is a leading Asian asset manager with award-winning investment expertise in fixed income and equities. Headquartered in Singapore, we offer global investment management expertise to individuals, institutions and corporations from a regional network spanning Thailand, Malaysia, Brunei, Japan and beyond. Our comprehensive product suite includes innovative solutions covering retail unit trusts, exchange-traded funds and customized portfolio management services.

Key Responsibilities

Project Leadership and Management
· Lead and plan technical deliverables that meet project requirements within the allocated budget and schedule.
· Oversee and coordinate technical implementation activities across project teams, ensuring smooth production cutover and post-implementation support.
· Serve as the escalation point for the project team, addressing critical project issues and facilitating smooth execution.
· Provide hands-on guidance to ensure the project teams build enhancements according to the solution plan.
Technical Delivery and Risk Management
· Plan, monitor, and manage risks/issues related to technical project delivery, providing L3 support as needed.
· Collaborate across different domain application teams to manage technical and security-related dependencies of the solution.
· Partner with Architects, Security, Suppliers to ensure solution design aligns with enterprise design principles, security, and control standards.
· Work with Security teams to facilitate completion of penetration testing and remediation of findings.
· Partner with suppliers and testers to ensure the successful completion of SIT, UAT, performance/load testing, and application security testing with quality results.
Stakeholder Collaboration and Financial Oversight
· Partner with Program/Project Managers, Business Analysts, Suppliers to collate, understand, and finalize functional and technical requirements.
· Provide systems input during the specification phase (e.g., effort estimates, high level delivery plan) based on impact assessments.
· Engage with suppliers, conduct RFQ/RFI processes, and ensure timely, high quality product deliveries.
· Manage project financials and budgeting, ensuring alignment with the financial goals of multiple projects.
· Provide regular status updates on technical delivery and escalate issues affecting the project schedule, proposing workarounds or resolutions.
· Ensure project documentation is completed according to industry and organizational standards.

Key Requirements:

· Degree in Computing or related discipline to support job requirements.
· At least 7 years of experience in Program/Project management under Project Delivery.
· Experience in project management, business analysis, business process re-engineering.
· Self-driven, able to work independently with good multi-tasking skills to drive multiple projects concurrently.
· Adaptable and comfortable working in a dynamic environment.
· Well versed with request for Tender/Request for Proposal/Quotation process and standards (e.g., RFQ specification, issuance of RFQ up to award of RFQ which includes contract negotiations and finalization).
· Strong client management and interaction experience.
· Strong persuasion and negotiation skills including conflict resolution skills.
· Strong analytical and critical thinking skills, meticulous with attention to details.
· Ability to identify and improve on work & process inefficiencies.
· Proficient in MS Project, Confluence, JIRA.
· Proficient with SDLC, AGILE methodologies.
· End-to-end implementation of any of the following in a Financial Services Industry would be an advantage:
o Cloud related solutions
o Infrastructure / Network related solutions
o Endpoint / Workplace Technology related solutions
o Active Directory / Identity Management related solutions
· Good organization skill, able to multi-task and work under pressure.
· Adaptable and comfortable working in a dynamic environment.
· Excellent time management and can prioritize work.
· Strong analytical and critical thinking skills, and meticulous with attention to details.
· Team player, able to work independently or in a team with minimal supervision.
· Good communication, writing and presentation skills.
· Good stakeholder engagement and vendor management skills.

We are seeking a proactive and organised Marketing Executive for Product Marketing & Marcomms Support to join our team. In this role, you will be responsible for supporting product marketing efforts, executing marketing communications (Marcomms) strategies, and organising events to promote our corporate brand and products. You will work closely with various teams to develop compelling messaging, manage marketing materials, and ensure the successful execution of events and campaigns.

Key Responsibilities:
Planning, development and execution of marketing communication strategies and campaigns.
Develop, refine and maintain product positioning, messaging and key value propositions.
Create and manage marketing collateral such as product brochures, sales decks, presentation slides, demonstration kits, factsheets and white papers.
Coordinate and organise internal and external marketing events, webinars and trade shows, ensuring seamless execution from start to finish.
Coordination and execution of product launches and updates, ensuring timely and effective communication across all platforms.
Track, monitor and analyse the performance of product marketing initiatives and campaigns such as sign-up rates and leads generation, providing insights for optimisation.
Support corporate marketing and communications in managing public relations, social media outreach and internal communications.
Responsible for corporate website and all social media platform contents including content development, website design, maintaining and updating of contents.
Requirements:
Bachelor’s Degree or Diploma in Marketing, Mass Communications or equivalent.
Minimum 3 years of working experience in marketing communications, product marketing, event management, and related fields is required for this position.
Strong understanding of corporate and product marketing strategies and how to create content that drives engagement.
Demonstrated ability to create compelling graphics, promotional materials, and videos that support marketing objectives.
Knowledge of digital marketing platforms, social media strategies, and email marketing tools.
Proficiency in design software (e.g. Adobe Creative Suite) and video editing tools (e.g. Adobe Premiere, Final Cut Pro, etc.) is a definite advantage.
Ability to prioritize and manage multiple projects with attention to detail and deadlines.
Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to present ideas and collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.
Candidates with software or technology experience is an added advantage.

Company: GLOBAL INDIAN INTERNATIONAL SCHOOL PTE. LTD.
Job Description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job description:
Subject Knowledge and Methodological Competence
· Understanding curriculum standards and Principles of Biology.
· Creating stimulating lesson plans to foster maximum student’s engagement in Biology
· Strategizing lessons to create student’s interest in Biology with analogies from daily life situations and examples.
· Adjusting teaching practices to support differentiated learning.
· Supervising lab sessions, guiding students on Individual assessments, delivering practical demonstrations.
· Developing experimental and investigative scientific skills including the use of current technologies
· Creating real world connections via transdisciplinary and cross- curricular approach to bring out the nature of science
· Appreciating scientific study and creativity within a global context through stimulating and challenging opportunities
· Guiding students to be critically aware, as global citizens, of the ethical implications of using science and technology
· Developing an understanding of the relationships between scientific disciplines and their influence on other areas of knowledge.
· Creating a critical awareness of the need for, and the value of, effective collaboration and communication during scientific activities
· Developing an ability to analyse, evaluate and synthesize scientific information
· Taking part in the process of mentoring and supervising of the Extended Essay component of the IB for Biology.
· Willing to teach Biology across the age and for IGCSE & IB Diploma Programme (Grades 11 & 12).
· Identifying and teaching study skills that will develop students' ability to work both independently and collaboratively.
· Planning activities and worksheets aligned to foster approaches to learning.
· Demonstrates the necessary subject knowledge and methodological strategies to effectively educate students.
· Assists in managing curriculum and study courses for the student’s development.
· Provides students with structure and support in a safe learning environment to enable them to develop socially, emotionally and morally.
· Introduces new study patterns among the students to develop their interest and do regular studies.
· Gives practical analysis of the courses to create interest.
· Develops the lesson plan in accordance with the curriculum guidelines, and presents the lesson plans to the academic coordinators for approval.
· Plans lessons based on inquiry, focussed on conceptual understanding, differentiated to meet the needs of all learners and informed by assessment (formative and summative)
· Reviews the feedback from the academic coordinators and revises the lesson plans accordingly
· Keeps up to date with the latest teaching aids, such as the use of technology in classroom learning, and integrate these into the teaching process
· Creates challenging and engaging learning opportunities for students, and fosters a classroom atmosphere that is conducive for learning
· Develops worksheets, handouts, and other learning materials in line with the lesson plan and curriculum, as well as the assessments and examinations.
· Responsible for the timely marking and correction of assignments completed by the students
Organizational Competence:
· Creates a well-organized, orderly and task-oriented learning environment.
· Assesses students’ progress and reports to the principal about them. Conduct assessment tests to evaluate students’ progress
· Assesses, records and reports on the development, progress and results of students
· Identifies students who may require additional assistance, academic or non-academic, and ensures they receive the necessary support
· Contributes to extra-curricular activities and participates in school activities such as assemblies, meetings and conferences
· Ensures the safety of students at all times
Reflection and Development:
· Reflects regularly on the development of personal and professional capabilities.
· Communicates the development of students to the Coordinator & Principal.
Focussed on effective teamwork and collaboration:
· Collaborates with other teachers to share new ideas, teaching approaches, content and professional knowledge
· Communicates and provides feedback to the parents during the Parent Teacher Meetings, and whenever necessary
Interpersonal Competence:
· Creates an atmosphere of trust by dealing with students in a positive and open way.
· Ensures open communication channel and coordination with parents and others involved in the education and development of the students.
· Enables students understand their strengths and weaknesses in order to support their learning and personal development.
JOB REQUIREMENTS
· Graduate & Bachelor in Education (Specialisation in Biology for senior teacher)
· Preferred Masters in Biology with International Teaching Qualification / Certificate that qualifies for accreditation according to IB educational system.
· Computer literacy, is required to work on software.
· Fluent English Level: reading, writing, speaking; a professional command of the English language.
· Strong technology application skills.
· Ability to support Blended cum Hybrid Learning.
· Competent in applying the principles of Digital Pedagogy.
· 3-5 years of Teaching experience.

Job Title: Senior Consultant (ServiceNow GRC /  IRM),  - Risk Consulting
Job Description:
Roles & Responsibilities
We enhance performance through creating risk-enabled organizations. We help clients identify important risks, design frameworks to manage them and improve the effectiveness and efficiency of risk management. As a risk transformation professional, you will be addressing client issues such as business performance variability, business and process controls transformation; application security integrity, governance, risk and control (GRC) technology enablement, business and/or IT GRC, continuous monitoring, vendor and contract risk management and IT risk management. You will belong to an international network of specialists helping our clients transform risk functions and implement technology solutions that support risk management and governance.
We will support you with career-long training and coaching to develop your skills in risk strategy, risk function design, risk management and performance enhancement. As EY is a global leading service provider in this space, you will be working with the best of the best in a collaborative environment. So, whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime.
The opportunity
Applying your knowledge and experience to shape our services, you’ll focus on client opportunities where your expertise can make a substantial impact. You’ll apply your knowledge and experience to shape our services and motivate your team. You’ll build valuable relationships with clients and develop strong capabilities, through both formal training and working with senior mentors and talented colleagues.
Your key responsibilities
This is a role where no two days are the same – so you’ll find yourself taking on plenty of new responsibilities as you go. You’ll work alongside clients and colleagues, balancing your time between developing security strategies, advising stakeholders, providing workshops and supporting business development. If you’re flexible and ready to adapt to a constantly changing environment, there’s no better place to develop your skills. Since you’ll be working directly with clients, some travel will be required.
Skills and attributes for success
The role of a ServiceNow GRC Senior Consultant/Manager includes collaborating with other members of the engagement team to coordinate, plan and deliver ServiceNow GRC projects. As you build knowledge and experience, you’ll become a credible advisor to junior consultants to deliver work products across the focus areas mentioned above within the organization as well as the client contacts. Responsibilities include but are not limited to:
Implementing and delivering GRC technology enablement services using ServiceNow GRC/IRM platform – Policy and Compliance Management, Vendor Management, Risk Management, Audit Management, Business Continuity, and other risk management processes
Lead discussions and workshops with clients to create a risk-aware culture through proper technology enablement of risk-related processes using ServiceNow GRC/ IRM solutions.
Design and architect solutions to automated client processes into GRC solutions to meet their unique requirements
Assist with the business development activities (conduct demos/ POCs, scope/ efforts/ timeline estimation etc.) related to ServiceNow GRC/ IRM opportunities.
Effectively manage and motivate client engagement teams with diverse skills and backgrounds.
Consistently deliver quality client services and manage expectations of client service delivery.
Drive high-quality work products within expected timeframes and on budget.
Manager engagement budget, monitor progress, manage risk, and ensure key stakeholders are kept informed about progress and expected outcomes.
Demonstrate deep technical capabilities and professional knowledge.
Establish relationships with client personnel at appropriate levels
Demonstrate in-depth technical capabilities and professional knowledge, demonstrate ability to assimilate new knowledge
Remain current on new developments in GRC technology implementation services capabilities and industry knowledge.
To qualify for the role, you must have:
A recognized university degree in information technology, engineering, mathematics, accounting, business or other relevant disciplines.
At least 4 years of relevant consulting or industry experience, preferably in a professional services environment or MNC.
ServiceNow CIS certification in GRC/ IRM suite (Risk and Compliance, Vendor Risk Management etc.)
Experience in the design, architecture, configuration, and implementation of ServiceNow GRC/ IRM solutions.
Strong understanding of compliance and risk management processes.
Experience with agile methodology, creating process designs, technical designs, defining user stories, working with onshore/offshore development teams, leading user acceptance testing (UAT), and providing the necessary end-user training to deliver the proposed solution.
Experience in engaging and managing a variety of stakeholders with an ability to consult, provide recommendations, and develop solutions using GRC solutions.
Strong analytical, interpersonal, communication, writing and presentation skills.
Demonstrates integrity, values, principles, and work ethic.
Ideally, you’ll also have
Strong project management skills including agile methods.
Data analysis/ processing and visualisation skills using database, visualisation tools or spreadsheet application
Professional certifications such as Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA), Certified in Risk and Information Systems Control (CRISC), Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP)
Experience with other GRC technology solutions (such as ServiceNow, MetricStream, IBM OpenPages etc.) will be an added advantage.
What we look for
We’re interested in flexible professionals with excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to prioritise shifting workloads in a rapidly changing industry. You’ll also need the confidence to give professional advice and guidance to colleagues and clients from a diverse range of cultures, often with limited information – both verbally and in writing. If you’re a fast learner, with strong influencing skills and a genuine passion for information system security, this role is for you.
What working at EY offers
We offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. We also offer you:
Support, coaching and feedback from some of the most engaging colleagues around
Opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career
The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you

A pivotal role in our client’s new setup. Reporting directly to the General Manager (GM), you will oversee and integrate operations across our hotel and hospital services, ensuring exceptional guest and patient experiences.
Key Responsibilities
Strategic Coordination
Lead and execute operational strategies across hotel and hospital functions, aligning with organizational goals.

Serve as the primary liaison between hotel and hospital teams, fostering effective communication and synergy.
Operational Excellence
Oversee daily operations, including guest/patient services, housekeeping, food & beverage, facilities, and healthcare management.
Monitor performance metrics to uphold the highest standards in hospitality and healthcare operations.
Ensure compliance with industry regulations, policies, and standards.
Guest and Patient Experience
Cultivate a culture of excellence in service delivery, catering to the unique needs of guests and patients.
Develop initiatives to enhance satisfaction and build loyalty.
Resolve escalated guest and patient concerns promptly and effectively.
Team Leadership and Development
Lead, mentor, and inspire departmental heads across hotel and healthcare operations.
Promote collaboration and accountability within the team.
Implement training programs to enhance operational skills and elevate service delivery.
Financial Management
Manage budgets for hotel and hospital operations, focusing on cost optimization and revenue growth.
Prepare and present financial reports to the GM and senior leadership.
Identify opportunities to improve efficiency without compromising service quality.
Innovation and Compliance
Introduce innovative solutions to enhance operational efficiency and satisfaction.
Stay updated on industry trends and regulatory changes in hospitality and healthcare sectors.
Qualifications and Requirements
Education
Bachelor’s degree in Hospitality Management, Healthcare Administration, Business Administration, or a related field.
Experience
5 to 10 years of senior leadership experience with significant exposure to both hotel and healthcare operations will be advantage
Proven track record of managing large teams in high-performance environments
Skills
Strategic leadership and operational management expertise.
Strong communication and interpersonal abilities.
Financial management skills and regulatory compliance knowledge.
Preferred Candidate Profile
Demographics: Singaporean or Permanent Resident (PR)
Lanuguages: Ability to converse in Mandarin as required to liaison with Chinese clients
Cultural Fit: In-depth understanding of Singapore’s hospitality and healthcare sectors

Roles & Responsibilities
Summary of Job Responsibilities

The Primary responsibilities of the Housekeeping Training Assistant Manager is to train and develop the housekeeping department team members in all housekeeping policies and procedures. They are also responsible for developing and implementing comprehensive training programs for our housekeeping staff to ensure ambitious standards of cleanliness, efficiency, and guest satisfaction. The Housekeeping Training Assistant Manager plays a crucial role in enhancing the skills and knowledge of our housekeeping team, contributing to the overall success of our property.
All duties are to be performed in accordance with departmental and Marina Bay Sands ’s policies, practices, and procedures.

Job Responsibilities
Design, implement, and continuously improve housekeeping training programs to cover essential skills, procedures, and guest service standards.
Develop training materials, manuals, and resources that align with industry best practices and the specific needs of the property.
Facilitate the onboarding process for new housekeeping team members, ensuring they are equipped with the necessary tools, skills, and knowledge to perform their duties effectively.
Conduct ongoing training sessions to address new procedures, equipment, and industry advancements, keeping the housekeeping team up to date.
Develop and implement systems for evaluating the performance of housekeeping team members and identifying areas for improvement.
Provide constructive feedback to housekeeping operation team, offering coaching and support to enhance their performance and professional development.
Work closely with the housekeeping team to maintain high cleanliness and hygiene standards, conducting regular inspections and addressing any issues promptly.
Collaborate with other departments to ensure seamless coordination and communication regarding training needs and standards.
Partner with Learning & Develop team to ensure consistency in training practices and programs.
Stay informed about industry regulations, safety standards, and compliance requirements, ensuring all training programs align with legal and ethical guidelines.
Experience & Education
A minimum of Five (5) years’ experience as a housekeeper and 2 years management experience at 4 or 5-star property preferred.
Experience in developing and implementing housekeeping or similar training programs preferred.
Proven experience in housekeeping management or a similar role within the hospitality industry.
Strong knowledge of housekeeping procedures, cleaning techniques, and industry best practices.
Keep complete knowledge of OSHA standards and Regulations, including all safety Standards and Evacuation procedures.
Experience with operations in a unionized environment preferred.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Ability to create engaging and effective training materials.
Experience with performance evaluation and feedback processes.
Detail-oriented with a commitment to maintaining exacting standards of cleanliness.
Familiarity with relevant software and tools for training management.
Competencies
Strong Business and Data Analysis skills.
Strong written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills.
Preferably possess relevant certification or experience in process improvement, Lean or Six Sigma.
Preferably comfortable with Statistics and Probability models, working experience in data analysis.
Must be able to manage multiple priorities in an efficient/timely manner.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team - works well in a collaborative environment.
Ability to deal effectively with guests, management, employees, and outside contacts while working under pressure and meeting deadlines.
Able to work in a fast-paced environment.

Marina Bay Sands is committed to building a diverse, equitable and inclusive workforce, providing equal opportunities as we grow our talent base to match our growth ambitions in Singapore. Our employees are committed to adhere to and abide by all rules, regulations, policies and procedures, including the rules of conduct and business ethics of the Company.

Roles & Responsibilities
Our client is looking for someone who can drive the formulation and execution of HR strategy for compensation, performance management and benefits to reinforce the organisation’s attraction and retention of talents.

Key Responsibilities
1. Lead a small team to develop compensation and performance management strategies, and translate them into policies, practices, and processes.
2. Oversee the annual review exercise for salary increment and bonus payout.
3. Participate in annual salary benchmarking exercises and reviews.
4. Manage the benefits administration and vendors.
5. Build collaborative partnership with external and internal stakeholders and provide recommendations and solutions to HR teams and business departments.
6. Derive insights from C&B data to enable more effective people decisions and optimize cost.
7. Conduct internal audits and reviews to ensure compliance to relevant regulations and policies.

Key Requirements
1. Minimum 8-12 years of experience in HR, with a focus on compensation, benefits and performance management.
2. At least 5 years of supervisory experience.
3. Strong attention to details and management of confidential information.
4. Strong analytical and communication skills.
5. Comfortable with multi-tasking and working in a fast-paced environment.
6. University degree.
